Application Process: Offline application process. The applicant needs to visit the nearest Anganwadi Centre or District Social Justice Office and collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the official website of the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala. The application may be submitted to the District Social Justice Officers (DSJOs) or the concerned Anganwadi Centre.
Description & Benefits: Under the scheme, financial assistance will be provided to such school dropouts to pursue SSLC, +1, +2 equivalent courses implemented by State Literacy Mission. The benefits include course fee assistance, exam fee assistance, registration fee assistance, and admission fee assistance.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State. 2. The differently abled students with 40% or more disability are eligible to apply under the scheme. 3. Financial assistance will be provided to students falling in Above Poverty Line (APL) as well as Below Poverty Line (BPL) categories.
Tags: APL, BPL, Disabled, Financial Assistance, PwD, Student
Scheme Name: Financial Assistance To Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)
Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled students with 40% or more disability

Application Process: Offline, Last Date of Application (30th June and 31st December Every Year), Application form can be downloaded from ICMR website, Completed application should be accompanied by all the requisite documents and attach self-attested photocopies of all documents as required, Applications should be sent to Director General, ICMR Headquarters, Ansari Nagar, New Delhi-110029
Description & Benefits: Fellowship to foster high-quality research opportunities in cutting-edge areas of basic science, communicable and non-communicable diseases, and reproductive health including nutrition at ICMR Institutes /Centers, Consolidated fellowship of ₹65,000/- per month plus House Rent Allowance (HRA) and Non-Practicing allowance (NPA), Contingency grant of ₹3,00,000/- per annum
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Health & Family Welfare
Eligibility Criteria: Indian nationals only, Fresh PhDs/MD/MS within three years of completing their Ph.D./MD/MS degree, Maximum age limit is 32 years, relaxable up to 5 years in case of SC/ST/OBC/PH and women candidates
Tags: Research, Fellowship, Medical Research, Post Doctoral
Scheme Name: ICMR- Post Doctoral Fellowship
Target Beneficiaries: Fresh PhDs/MD/MS holders

Application Process: Offline application through prescribed form with all relevant documents to be submitted to the Regional Deputy Director.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides modern skill training and Tool Kits to traditional OBC craftsmen to improve their productivity and competitiveness, ensuring quality goods for enhanced income and qualitative improvement in their living conditions. The grant of ₹25000/- shall be given to the eligible person for his/her training, stipend (if found necessary) and tool kits.
Ministries/Departments: Backward Communities Development Department, Government of Kerala
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State, belong to the State Backward Communities of Kerala State, be engaged in traditional craftwork/skilled work, have an upper age limit of 60 years, and have an annual family income of ₹1,00,000/-.
Tags: Craftsman, Grant, Handicrafts, OBC, Self-employment, Stipend, Tool Kit, Training
Scheme Name: Tool Kit Grant for Traditional Handicrafts Experts
Target Beneficiaries: Traditional OBC craftsmen

Application Process: Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the application duly filled out should be submitted to the Kasaragod District Collector Office. The applicant may also visit Kerala Social Security Mission offices or the Social Justice Department in Kerala.
Description & Benefits: The scheme acts as a relief measure for the Endosulfan victims in the state of Kerala. Under this scheme, financial assistance has been granted from December 2010 onwards to the Endosulfan victims. This scheme also aims to provide educational assistance to the Children of Endosulfan-affected families. In addition to this, Kerala Social Security Mission is now providing monthly assistance of ₹700/- per month to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme.
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State. The applicant should be an Endosulfan victim.
Tags: Endosulfan, Financial Assistance, Educational Assistance, Bedridden, Victim, Kerala
Scheme Name: Snehasanthwanam
Target Beneficiaries: Endosulfan victims in the state of Kerala

Application Process: Online submission of the application form can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides additional financial assistance (Scholarship) to the OBC students belonging to the non-creamy layer of Andaman & Nicobar Islands for pursuing higher education after Secondary (X)/Senior Secondary (XII), in Government-recognized Polytechnic/ITI/College/University anywhere in India, as an incentive to supplement to the cost of their education.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Eligibility Criteria: Students who belong to OBCs so specified and notified in relation to Andaman and Nicobar Islands and are domicile of Andaman & Nicobar Islands and who have passed Secondary (Class X)/Senior Secondary (Class XII) from a recognized Board of School Education and pursuing higher education in a recognized Institution/University
Tags: Higher Study, OBC, Scholarship, Student
Scheme Name: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)
Target Beneficiaries: OBC students belonging to the non-creamy layer of Andaman & Nicobar Islands

Application Process: The application process is available only online. The applicants need to visit the official website, download the application form, fill it out, and submit it along with the required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a lump sum amount of Rs. 30, 000/- as compensation to the families who have lost their lead earners. The scheme is for below-poverty-line families.
Ministries/Departments: Uttar Pradesh Government
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be aged between 18 years to 60 years. 2. The family income should not be more than Rs. 56, 450/- in urban areas and Rs. 46, 080/- in rural areas.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Death Relief Benefit, Below Poverty Line Families, Uttar Pradesh Government
Scheme Name: National Family Benefit Scheme - Uttar Pradesh
Target Beneficiaries: Below-poverty-line families who have lost their lead earners

Application Process: Online application through National Scholarship Portal, with required documents and certificates
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to complete education, including maintenance allowance, reader charges for blind students, fees, study tours, and thesis typing/printing charges
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Eligibility Criteria: Indian nationals belonging to the General Category (Other than Schedule Caste, Schedule Tribe and Other Backward Classes), with income from all sources not exceeding ₹ 1,00,000 per annum
Tags: EBC, Post Matric, Scholarship, Student
Scheme Name: Dr. Ambedakar Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Post-Matric Scholarships for the Economically Backward Class (EBC) Students
Target Beneficiaries: Economically Backward Class (EBC) students studying at the post-matriculation or post-secondary stage

Application Process: Online application through the official web portal of the Odisha Working Journalist Welfare Scheme Application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to the legal heir of a working journalist in case of his/her death, and in case of permanent incapacitation. In the event of death of a working journalist, a fixed sum of money may be paid to the widow, and in the event of the deceased not being survived by his widow, equally to the minor children.
Ministries/Departments: Information & Public Relations Department, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Journalist should be working in Odisha. 2. The Journalist should be working for a media house registered with the I&PR department, Odisha. 3. The applicant should be a legal heir of the working journalist in case of his/her death or in case of permanent incapacitation.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Journalist, Death, Permanent Incapacitation, Odisha
Scheme Name: Financial Assistance under Odisha Working Journalist Welfare Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Legal heirs of working journalists in Odisha

Application Process: Online application process, registration, login, dashboard, eligibility alert, eligibility, data capturing format, PG details, Ph.D. details, declaration
Description & Benefits: Fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education, for pursuing research work leading to the award of a Ph.D. degree, financial assistance, contingency, HRA, medical assistance, leave
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Education
Eligibility Criteria: Any single girl child of her parents pursuing Ph.D. in any stream/subject in recognised Universities/Colleges/Institutes, registered herself in regular, full-time Ph. D. program, girl students up to the age of 40 years for general category and 45 years for the reserved categories i.e. SC/ST/OBC and PWD (Persons with Disabilities) as on the last date of submission of online application
Tags: Fellowship, Girl Child, Ph.D., Education, Research
Scheme Name: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship For Single Girl Child
Target Beneficiaries: Single girl child, i.e. the only girl child in the family without having any brother or sister

Application Process: Offline application process. The selection of educational institutions and students is done in consultation with the respective District Collectors (DCs)/Inspectors of Schools.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides practical exposure to students by visiting the Assam Legislative Assembly and witnessing the legislative sessions, debates, and bill discussions. Students have the opportunity to interact with dignitaries such as the Hon'ble Speaker, Chief Minister, Ministers, MLAs, and senior officials. The scheme helps students understand the functioning of the State Legislative Assembly and the legislative process.
Ministries/Departments: Parliamentary Affairs Department
Eligibility Criteria: Students from related subjects such as Political Science, Economics, etc. within the Arts/Humanities streams in colleges/higher secondary schools and social sciences in secondary schools. Selection is based on academic performance and enthusiastic participation in extracurricular activities.
Tags: Assam, Legislative Assembly, Student Visits, Learning, Education
Scheme Name: Exposure Visits To The Assam Legislative Assembly
Target Beneficiaries: Students from High School up to College level

Application Process: Online application submission, inspection and processing, grant disbursement in two installments, and execution of a continuity bond
Description & Benefits: Creating awareness about the ill effects of alcoholism and substance abuse, providing community-based services for indemnification, motivation, counselling, de-addiction, aftercare, and rehabilitation for whole-person recovery (WPR) of addicts
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Eligibility Criteria: Organizations with at least two years of experience in the related area or demonstrating competence to undertake the proposed scheme, registered societies, charitable non-profit-making companies, public trusts, non-official organizations involved in social welfare, and certain statutory bodies
Tags: Alcoholism, Substance Abuse, Social Defence, Rehabilitation, Financial Assistance, Grant-in-Aid
Scheme Name: Scheme of Assistance for the Prevention of Alcoholism & Substance (Drugs) Abuse and for Social Defence Services: General Grant-in-Aid Programme for Financial Assistance in the Field of Social Defence
Target Beneficiaries: Addicts, people affected by alcoholism and substance abuse

Application Process: Online application through SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal, registration and login required, fill in the application form and submit
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial aid to dependents as well as victims of crime, financial assistance of ₹20,000/- will be provided as one-time assistance to the eligible beneficiary
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State, the applicant must be either the person who has been seriously injured in a crime or must be a dependent - Wife/Husband/Unmarried son or daughter of the victim of the crime, the annual income of the family should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-, the applicant should have applied within 5 years of the crime
Tags: Crime Victims, Self-Employment, Financial Assistance, Kerala
Scheme Name: Jeevanam Self-Employment Scheme To Dependents Of Crime Victims
Target Beneficiaries: Dependents of crime victims, victims of crime with serious injuries

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Social Welfare Office, and request a hard copy of the format of the application form for the scheme from the concerned authority. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach all the (self-attested) mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Social Welfare Officer. 4. Acquire the receipt/acknowledgment of the successful submission of the application form from the District Social Welfare Office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides care and protection in the institutions. Besides food, shelter, bedding & clothing are also provided. For school-going destitute girls free education is provided in addition to other facilities.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Welfare, Government of Jammu and Kashmir
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a citizen of India. 2. The applicant should be a domicile / permanent resident of the state of Jammu & Kashmir. 3. The applicant should be a Female. 4. The applicant should be deserted /destitute / widow. 5. The applicant should not have any means of livelihood.
Tags: Rehabilitation, Shelter, Social Welfare, Widow, Destitute
Scheme Name: Nari Niketans
Target Beneficiaries: Deserted/destitute ladies/widows having no means of livelihood

Application Process: Online application through the official website of Chhattisgarh Labour Department. Unregistered applicants need to register first and then apply for the scheme. Already registered applicants can directly apply for the scheme.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance will be provided for the medical treatment of serious illness like treatment of kidney, cancer, sickle cell anemia, heart disease, AIDS and paralysis. Unorganized workers can receive up to ₹ 50,000 in medical assistance.
Ministries/Departments: Labor Department of Chhattisgarh State
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be registered with the State Board for at least 90 days. 2. The applicant must be between the ages of 18 and 60. 3. The applicant must be registered as a beneficiary of unorganized workers under Section 10 of the Act.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Medical Treatment, Serious Illness, Unorganized Workers
Scheme Name: Asangathit Karmakar Gambhir Bimari Chikitsa Sahayata Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Unorganized workers

Application Process: Online application process involving registration, login, form filling, uploading documents, and submission. The applicant enterprises should apply for this incentive within 6 months from the date of commencement of commercial production.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to reduce the stamp duty and registration charges incurred by MSEs investing in backward blocks in Tamil Nadu. Eligible enterprises receive a 50% reimbursement of stamp duty and registration charges incurred on land purchases intended for industrial use.
Ministries/Departments: Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a manufacturing enterprise (micro or small scale), set up in the declared backward blocks of the state of Tamil Nadu. The incentive is admissible to eligible enterprises on the land area up to five times the plinth area of the factory building constructed.
Tags: MSME, Reimbursement, Stamp Duty, Registration Charges, Tamil Nadu, Business, Enterprise
Scheme Name: Reimbursement of Stamp Duty and Registration Charges
Target Beneficiaries: Manufacturing enterprises (micro or small scale) set up in the declared backward blocks of the state of Tamil Nadu

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form with mandatory documents at the Coffee Board office. Post-application processes include scrutiny, feasibility assessment, procurement, installation, and commissioning of R&G machinery, and submission of support claim application.
Description & Benefits: This scheme aims to enhance the quality of coffee products and achieve value addition through the introduction of improved technologies in roasting, grinding, and packaging which will result in boosting domestic coffee consumption and entrepreneurship in the coffee sector, especially in the non-traditional areas. Benefits include subsidy support of 40% of the machinery cost with a ceiling of ₹10,00,000 for roasting units, and 50% subsidy support for SHGs, women entrepreneurs, SC/ ST, Minorities, and differently-abled beneficiaries.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Commerce And Industry
Eligibility Criteria: The applicants should be individual units, Partnership firms, self-help groups (SHG)/ Growers’ collectives interested in establishing coffee roasting units. The Scheme is applicable only for the establishment of new R&G units. The applicant’s unit must hold a valid business license from the respective statutory authorities.
Tags: Agriculture, Direct Benefit Transfer, Farmer, Financial Assistance, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Support for Value Addition - Support to R&G units
Target Beneficiaries: Individual units, Partnership firms, self-help groups (SHG)/ Growers’ collectives interested in establishing coffee roasting units

Application Process: Email CV, motivation letter, and recommendation letter from the Head of the Department/Chairman of the advisory committee to saravananraj.manage@gmail.com
Description & Benefits: Capacity development in research and extension, stipend of ₹10,000 per month for a 3-month internship or ₹35,000 per month for a 6-month internship
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Eligibility Criteria: Completed/ongoing PhD or M.Sc in Extension Education/ Economics/ Sociology/ Psychology/ MSW/ Journalism/ Communication/ Environmental Science, OGPA of a minimum of 8 out of 10 (minimum 80%), fluency in English, good writing skills
Tags: Agriculture, Environment, Internship, Management, Student
Scheme Name: MANAGE Internship Programme
Target Beneficiaries: Students from the disciplines of Extension Education, Economics, Sociology, Psychology, MSW, Journalism, Communication, and Environmental Science

Application Process: Offline, application form can be obtained from designated Offices notified by the Director of Women and Child Development or designated bank branches, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required), and send the application to: Director, Directorate of Women And Child Development, Panaji-Goa, 2nd floor, Old Education Building, 18th June Road, Altinho, Panaji, Goa - 403 001
Description & Benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹ 1,00,000, by means of a bank fixed deposit, jointly in the name of the Director (DoWCD) and the applicant, to financially empower the girl child to meet educational and other expenses on becoming a major of age and to improve the female sex ratio in the State
Ministries/Departments: Department of Women & Child Development, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a Girl, born in the State of Goa OR should be a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years, parental income of the applicant does not exceed ₹ 3,00,000 per annum, and the applicant should qualify for ANY ONE of the following three criteria: a) At least one of the parents of the applicant is born in Goa and is also a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years, b) One of the parents of the applicant is residing in Goa for the last twenty-five years, c) In case the applicant is an affected person of Tillari Irrigation Project (a joint venture of the Government of Goa and the government of Maharashtra) and was rehabilitated in the State of Goa
Tags: Financial Assistance, Girl Child, Marriage, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: Laadli Laxmi Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Girl child

Application Process: Online application through SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹5,000/- per person in a year for medical treatment, including surgery, to differently abled persons.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State. 2. The disabled person or who has become handicapped due to an accident is eligible to apply under the scheme for their medical treatment, including surgery. 3. Those differently-abled persons whose annual income does not exceed (₹20,000/- in Rural areas and ₹22,375/- in Urban areas) shall be eligible for financial assistance. 4. Physically handicapped persons shall include the following disabilities/categories: a. Blind b. Deaf and Dumb c. Orthopedically Handicapped d. Mentally Challenged e. Persons in the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category having 40 % disability or more.
Tags: BPL, Differently Abled, Distress, Financial Assistance, Handicap, Medical Treatment, PwD
Scheme Name: Distress Relief Fund For The Differently Abled (Medical Treatment)
Target Beneficiaries: Differently Abled persons

Application Process: Offline. The applicant needs to contact the Registrar/Principal, fill out the application form, and submit it to the concerned department.
Description & Benefits: Coaching schemes for students belonging to SC (Scheduled Caste), ST (Scheduled Tribe), OBC (Other Backward Classes) (non-creamy layer), and minority communities are implemented to provide them with equal opportunities and support in pursuing higher education. These schemes aim to bridge the educational gap and enhance the competitiveness of these students.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Minority Affairs
Eligibility Criteria: Financial assistance under the scheme is available to such universities and colleges which come within the purview of Section 2(f) and are fit to receive central assistance under Section 12(B) of the UGC Act, 1956. Institutions having a sufficient number of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and Minority Communities students will be considered for financial assistance. General candidates holding BPL Cards (Below Poverty Line) issued by the Central Government /State Government may also be allowed for such coaching classes.
Tags: Coaching, Education, Minority, SC, ST, OBC, University
Scheme Name: Coaching Schemes For Sc/st/obc (non-creamy Layer) & Minority Students For Universities
Target Beneficiaries: Students belonging to SC (Scheduled Caste), ST (Scheduled Tribe), OBC (Other Backward Classes) (non-creamy layer), and minority communities

Application Process: Offline
Description & Benefits: Umbrella scheme providing 45% subsidy, 45% bank finance, and 10% beneficiaries contribution for the cultivation of fruits like apples, walnut, orange, kiwi, and persimmon.
Ministries/Departments: Government of Arunachal Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: Residents and farmers of Arunachal Pradesh
Tags: Subsidy, Umbrella Scheme, Farmers, Arunachal Pradesh, Horticulture
Scheme Name: Atma Nirbhar Bagwani Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers of Arunachal Pradesh

Application Process: Online application through official website, Registration, Authentication through OTP, Filling of application form, Submission
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to educated unemployed citizens to help them overcome financial difficulties, The amount of self-help allowance will be paid to the eligible applicant at the rate of Rs.1000 per month for a maximum period of two years
Ministries/Departments: Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Age group of 20 to 25 years, 2. Unemployed young men/women who are not studying and are looking for employment, 3. Educational qualification is inter (12th) passed from a government-recognized institution located in the state but have not received higher education, 4. Permanent resident of the district of Bihar state, 5. Not received any kind of allowance/scholarship/student credit card/education loan or any kind of assistance from any other source, 6. Not get any type of government or non-government employment (contract/permanent/ temporary), 7. Not self-employed
Tags: Financial Assistance, Skilled Youth Program, Social Welfare, Unemployment
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Nischay Swayam Sahayata Bhatta Yojna
Target Beneficiaries: Educated unemployed citizens of Bihar State

Application Process: Offline application process. The applicant needs to take a print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. The application form should be submitted to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries or to the official posted at the BDO Office/Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to active fishermen whose fishing vessels are damaged or lost due to natural calamities. The benefits include financial assistance for death/disability, loss/damage to fishing canoe, loss/damage to fishing vessel, and loss/damage to fishing nets.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a Fisherman, should have been contributing to the Fishermen Corpus Relief Fund, should have a registered non-motorized/motorized canoe and mechanized fishing vessel/trawler with the Department of Fisheries, should not be a defaulter of the department, and the loss or damage should be verified by the competent authority.
Tags: Crisis, Disaster, Financial Assistance, Fishermen, Relief
Scheme Name: Natural Calamity Relief to Fishermen of State
Target Beneficiaries: Active fishermen who contribute to the Fishermen Corpus Relief Fund

Application Process: Applications are invited through advertisement and the project proposal should be submitted online. The application process involves endorsement from the Head of Institution, evaluation by referees, and final decision by the expert committee.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of grants to facilitate Academia-Industry interaction by undertaking projects in collaboration with an industrial partner which should result in commercializing the product or process or service. The grant amount is ₹40 lakhs excluding overhead cost and industry share (25%) for a period of three years.
Ministries/Departments: Kerala Biotechnology Commission (KBC) under the Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE)
Eligibility Criteria: Applicants should be Scientists and Technologists of R&D Centers/Academic Institutions/Organizations actively involved in biotechnological research with emphasis on areas relating to marine, agriculture, health, and environment. Proposals need to be submitted in active collaboration with an industry in which the industrial partner is willing to share 25% of the Kerala Biotechnology Commission allocated funds additionally.
Tags: Biotechnology, Grant, Industry, Research, Scientist, Technologist
Scheme Name: Industry Linked Biotechnology Research Scheme (IBRS)
Target Beneficiaries: Scientists and Technologists of R&D Centers/academic Institutions/Organizations actively involved in biotechnological research

Application Process: Offline application process. The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries or its designated offices.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance amounting to ₹50% is provided by the Government to eligible fishermen for the Purchase of Lifejackets and Lifebuoys. The support is extended up to ₹1,000/- per lifejacket and ₹1,500/- per lifebuoy.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman by birth or profession, a resident of Goa, and possess one of the following: a Canoe Fitted With OBM; Mechanised Trawlers Engaged in Trawling or Purse Seining Operations.
Tags: Fishermen, Lifejackets, Lifebuoys, Financial Assistance, Goa
Scheme Name: Financial Assistance for the Purchase of Lifejackets and Lifebuoys for Fishermen
Target Beneficiaries: Traditional fishermen by birth or profession, residents of Goa

Application Process: Offline application process involving certification completion, documentation, submission to Coffee Board Office, review, and verification.
Description & Benefits: This scheme aims to encourage coffee growers to improve quality for higher returns and improve access to high-value specialty markets through the production of eco-certified coffees.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Commerce and Industry
Eligibility Criteria: The applicants should be SHGs/collectives of tribal growers who obtain certification of their plantations for various sustainability and quality standards.
Tags: Agriculture, DBT, Farmer, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Coffee Development Programme in North Eastern Region: Quality Upgradation / Certification: Support for Eco-Certification / Organic Certification
Target Beneficiaries: SHGs/collectives of tribal growers, small growers

Application Process: Online application through UMANG App or website. Fill basic details, choose the mode of payment of pension, upload photo and click on “Submit”.
Description & Benefits: A monthly pension of ₹ 200 up to 79 years and ₹ 500 thereafter. The scheme provides social assistance benefits to poor households in the case of old age of the breadwinner.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Rural Development
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India, living Below Poverty Line, and at least 60 years of age.
Tags: BPL, Pension, Senior Citizen, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: NSAP - Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Citizens living Below Poverty Line and 60 years or above in age

Application Process: 1. Applicants have to visit the official scholarship portal of the Student Labor Welfare Board. 2. Fill out the entries of the academic scholarship application form online. 3. The applicant will have to authenticate his identity by giving his own and his mother's / father's Aadhaar numbers. 4. Online applications for academic scholarships will have to be made within the time limit. Applications received after the prescribed period will not be considered by the Board and no action will be taken. 5. Upload the required documents. 6. Submit.
Description & Benefits: The main objective of the Madhya Pradesh Shram Kalyan Academic Scholarship Scheme is to provide scholarships to the children of labourers to get an education. Through this scheme, scholarships will be provided from the 5th class to a higher level of education.
Ministries/Departments: Madhya Pradesh State Government
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The parents of the applicant should be employed in a factory or institution established in Madhya Pradesh under the Labor Welfare Fund Act, 1982. 3. Only 2 children of a family are eligible to get the benefits of this scheme. 4. Children of officers and employees working in institutions with managerial capacity are not eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Higher Education, Student Finance
Scheme Name: Shram Kalyan Shaikshanik Chatravriti Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Children of labourers

Application Process: Offline application through Block Development Officer (BDO) / Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) / Kolkata Municipal Corporation
Description & Benefits: A monthly pension of ₹1,000/- is transferred directly to the individual bank account of the beneficiary
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Development Department, Government of West Bengal
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of West Bengal, 2. Belong to Scheduled Tribe (ST) category, 3. Attained the age of 60 years or more, 4. Not a beneficiary under any other Social Security pension scheme, 5. Not a recipient of Government pension or pension from any other organization
Tags: Financial Assistance, Pension, Scheduled Tribe, Senior Citizen, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: Jai Johar (Old Age Pension) Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribe (ST) residents of West Bengal of the age of 60 years and above

Application Process: Online application through the INSPIRE program portal; three-tier selection process involving evaluation by discipline-based Expert Committees, recommendations of the Apex Level Committee and INSPIRE Faculty Award Council, and final selection by DST
Description & Benefits: Provides opportunities to 100 persons every year to carry out research in basic and applied science areas for 5 years; grants an attractive fellowship for a duration of 5 years; objective is to encourage young researchers to continue research in areas of S&T, Medicine, Agriculture, Pharmacy, and Veterinary Sciences
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Science And Technology
Eligibility Criteria: Indian citizens and People of Indian origin with PIO status having Ph.D. degrees in science, mathematics, engineering, pharmacy, medicine, and agriculture-related subjects; minimum 60% marks throughout academic profile; upper age limit of 32 years for General Category, 37 years for SC, ST, and Women candidates, and 42 years for persons with benchmark disabilities
Tags: Faculty Fellowship, Research, Science, Technology, Medicine, Agriculture, Pharmacy, Veterinary Sciences
Scheme Name: Innovation In Science Pursuit For Inspired Research (INSPIRE) - Faculty Fellowship
Target Beneficiaries: Young researchers with Ph.D. qualifications in the age group of 27-32 years

Application Process: Offline, Submit application form with required documents to the concerned authority
Description & Benefits: Subsidy for the procurement of fiber-reinforced plastic vallam with nets to increase marine fish production
Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry
Eligibility Criteria: Belong to fishermen community or professionally engaged in fishing/fish trade occupation, Resided in Puducherry for at least 5 years, Member of Fishermen Co-operative Society, Age between 23 and 60 years, Not a recipient of Old Age Pension, Not employed in Government/Government Undertakings/Fishermen Co-operative Society, No outstanding dues to Department/Fishermen Co-operative Societies
Tags: Fisheries, Subsidy, Marine Fisheries, Puducherry
Scheme Name: Subsidy for the Purchase of Fiber-reinforced Plastic Cattamaran/ Vallam/ Wooden Nava/ Marine Plywood Canoe With Nets
Target Beneficiaries: Fishermen community, Fish traders, Prospective entrepreneurs

Application Process: The application as per the prescribed format, along with the supporting documents showing the activities of the Child Committee of the Local Body, shall be addressed/submitted directly to: The Director, Directorate of Women And Child Development, Panaji-Goa, 2nd floor, Old Education Building, 18th June Road, Altinho, Panaji, Goa - 403 001.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an annual financial grant of ₹ 10,000/- towards administrative expenses incurred on organizing the activities of the Committee.
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Women And Child Development
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be the concerned local body i.e. a Panchayat or a Municipal local body. The applicant should have established a Village or Municipal Child Committee as prescribed under Rule 7 of The Goa Children's Homes Rules, 2004. The Committee should have met at least once in the last three months prior to submission of the application. The Committee should have met to discuss and resolve the issues relating to children within the jurisdiction of the local body. The concerned local body should have provided the space for facilitating sittings of the Committee in its premises as and when required.
Tags: Child Rights, Municipal, Panchayat, Village, Award, Grant
Scheme Name: Goa Village & Municipal Child Committee Grants And Awards Scheme (GVMCCGS)
Target Beneficiaries: Village and Municipal Child Committees

Application Process: The application process involves four steps: 1. Qualify in the Biotechnology Eligibility Test (BET), 2. Apply for the DBT-JRF program online, 3. Appear for the interview, and 4. Check the final selection list.
Description & Benefits: The Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) from the Department of Biotechnology (DBT) is a fellowship program that provides financial support to students who are pursuing doctoral research in biotechnology and life sciences. The fellowship amount for the JRF program is ₹31,000 per month for the first two years and ₹35,000 per month for the remaining three years.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Science And Technology
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Applicant must be an Indian citizen. 2. Applicant must have a master's degree in biotechnology or a related field from a recognized university. 3. Applicant must clear the GAT or NET exam in biotechnology or a related field. 4. Applicant should not be more than 28 years for general and EWS category candidates and 33 years for SC/ST/PH category candidates.
Tags: Biotechnology, Life Sciences, Research, Fellowship, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Junior Research Fellowship
Target Beneficiaries: Indian nationals pursuing doctoral research in biotechnology and life sciences

Application Process: Offline and Online application process. The applicant has to approach their concerned Gram Panchayat /Municipality / Municipal Corporation office, fill in the application form, attach mandatory documents and submit it to the designated receiving authority.
Description & Benefits: A pension is provided to elderly citizens above the age of 60 years belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category and the beneficiary will receive a monthly pension of ₹ 1500/-, ₹ 2000/- & ₹ 2500/- as per eligibility criteria.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Women & Child Welfare, Govt. of Sikkim
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of the state of Sikkim, from Below Poverty Line (BPL) family, attained the age of 60 years and above, have no source of income, not be a recipient of salary/pension/family pension from Central Government / other State Governments, and have opened a Bank Account under “Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana”.
Tags: Old Age, Pension, Below Poverty Line, Direct Benefit Transfer
Scheme Name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme - Sikkim
Target Beneficiaries: Elderly citizens above the age of 60 years belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category

Application Process: The applications are to be submitted only ONLINE at [www.aistic.gov.in](http://www.aistic.gov.in). The hard copies of the application are not required.
Description & Benefits: The scheme is launched as an initiative under the ASEAN-India Science & Technology Development Fund (AISTDF) to support young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries to carry out research at any of the Indian research/academic Institution. The fellowship provides full financial assistance, including round trip international airfare, visa fees, overseas medical insurance, consolidated Fellowship amount of Indian Rupees (INR) 60,000/- per month, one-time grant of INR 40,000/- as research contingency expenses, and institutional overhead charges.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Science And Technology
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be holding the nationality of any of the ASEAN Member Countries, possess at least a Master’s Degree in any Natural Sciences or an equivalent degree in Technology/Engineering/Medicine / allied disciplines, be working/studying and/or affiliated with any national R&D or academic institution in his/her home ASEAN Member Country, and be below 45 years of age as of the date of submission of the application.
Tags: ASEAN, Fellowship, Research, Science, Technology, Innovation
Scheme Name: ASEAN-India Research Training Fellowship (AI-RTF)
Target Beneficiaries: Young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries

Application Process: Online application through the official website/portal of the Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Department of the Government of Tamil Nadu, involving registration, login, form filling, document upload, and submission.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an incentive of 50% of the cost of eligible components, subject to a maximum limit of ₹ 10,00,000/-, to MSMEs that implement the recommendations of the Energy Audit Report and optimize energy consumption leading to energy saving and money savings in electricity bills.
Ministries/Departments: Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: MSMEs that have undertaken energy audits and achieved at least 10% energy savings in terms of the number of units of energy consumed per unit of product manufactured with reference to the last 12 months average.
Tags: Energy Audit, Energy Conservation, MSME, Tamil Nadu, Incentive, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Promotion of Energy Audit and Conservation of Energy (PEACE): Incentive for Implementing Energy Audit Recommendations
Target Beneficiaries: Manufacturing MSMEs in the state of Tamil Nadu

Application Process: Offline application is submitted to the Head of school/college/ institution who after verifying it shall forward it to the District Social Security Officer (DSSO) of the concerned district.
Description & Benefits: The scheme assists students with disabilities to secure education, academic, technical, or professional training to enable them to earn a living and become useful members of society. The scheme provides a scholarship of ₹200/- per month per student with a disability for education from class 1st to 8th and ₹300/- per month per student with a disability for education/training from 9th class onwards.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Security and Women & Child Development, Government of Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Students of Punjab having 40% and above disability certificate. 2. Monthly income of family/guardians should not exceed ₹5,000/- per month. 3. Candidate should have secured at least 40% marks in the previous annual examination.
Tags: Disability, PwD, Scholarship, Student, Education, Training
Scheme Name: Scholarships to Students with Disabilities Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Students with disabilities

Application Process: Offline: Visit the Office/ Sub-Office of the Department of Women and Child Development, request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Deputy Director (Women Development) or the Child Development Project Officer at least 30 days before the proposed marriage date.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to poor brides living below the poverty line to meet their marriage expenses. The assistance amount is ₹25,000, and it is granted for the first marriage of the bride.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry
Eligibility Criteria: The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹75,000 per annum. The parents/guardian of the bride should be a citizen of India and a native of the Union Territory of Pondicherry by birth or by continuous residence of 5 years or more. The assistance is payable only for the first marriage of the bride. The marriage should be performed in accordance with the law in force on the date of marriage. The assistance is given for the performance of the marriage of one daughter only. The bride should have attained the age of 18 years, and the bridegroom 21 years on the date of marriage.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Marriage, Poverty Line, Women Empowerment
Scheme Name: Grant of Financial Assistance for Performance of Marriage of Poor Brides Living Below Poverty Line
Target Beneficiaries: Poor brides living below the poverty line

Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal, followed by submission of required documents to the concerned Taluka office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a subsidy of ₹500/- per male calf for castration through the closed method (Burdizo Castrator) or open method (Surgical Method).
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be an individual livestock owner or an animal-rearing organization (Gaushala/Panjarapol/others). The male calf must be castrated through the close or open method.
Tags: Animal Husbandry, Cow, Low Genetic Animal, Castration, Livestock, Gujarat
Scheme Name: Intensive Castration Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Livestock owners and animal-rearing organizations

Application Process: Offline application process through submission of application form and documents to the concerned General Manager, District Industries & Commerce Centre (DICC)
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote and financially support the participation of MSMEs in national and international trade fairs, exhibitions, and buyer-seller meets, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries and Commerce, Government of Rajasthan
Eligibility Criteria: MSMEs existing anywhere in Rajasthan with Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) as per MSME Development Act 2006
Tags: MSME, Market Development, International Exhibition, National Exhibition, Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024
Scheme Name: Scheme for Assistance to MSMEs for Market Development
Target Beneficiaries: MSMEs registered in Rajasthan

Application Process: Online application through i-Khedut Portal
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for purchasing essential fishing equipment, life-saving gear, and infrastructure to enhance safety, efficiency, and fish preservation. It also provides financial aid to families of fishermen captured in Pakistan and subsidies for setting up ice plants, cold storage, and fish processing units.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a native of Gujarat, own a registered fishing boat under Real Craft software, possess a valid fishing license, have a bank account in their name, and have obtained in-principle approval to purchase of the floor plan.
Tags: Agriculture, Fishing, Infrastructure, Gujarat
Scheme Name: Providing Navigational Aids and Other Infrastructure Facilities
Target Beneficiaries: Fishermen

Application Process: Online application through e-District Portal of the Govt. of NCT of Delhi, registration and login required, fill in the application form, upload mandatory documents, and submit
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to students from marginalized communities pursuing higher education in recognized institutions, offers monthly scholarships to hostellers and day scholars based on their course of study, with amounts ranging from ₹420/- to ₹1,860/- per month
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC, Government of NCT of Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Delhi, belongs to SC/ST/OBC/Minority category, enrolled in a recognized school/college/institution in India, student, secured 60% or above marks in the previous examination, family income limit of ₹2,00,000/- per annum for OBC and Minority students
Tags: Scholarship, SC/ST/OBC/Minority, Higher Education, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Merit Scholarship to SC/ST/OBC/Minority students studying in recognised Colleges/Professional/Technical Institutions
Target Beneficiaries: Students from marginalized communities (SC/ST/OBC/Minority) pursuing higher education in recognized institutions

Application Process: Offline application process: Purchase kerosene or petrol from government-approved fuel stations, collect original bills, and submit an application along with required documents to the concerned district office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹50/- per liter of kerosene or petrol to eligible fishermen to help reduce their fuel expenses.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat, own a small boat operated by an Outboard Motor (OBM), and possess a government-issued Kerosene/Petrol Card.
Tags: Fishermen, Fishing Activities, Kerosene, Petrol, Gujarat, Agriculture
Scheme Name: Assistance to OBM Boat Owner Fishermen on Purchase of Kerosene
Target Beneficiaries: Fishermen owning small boats with Outboard Motors (OBM)

Application Process: Online application through iKhedut Portal
Description & Benefits: Provides financial support in kind (poultry birds and feed) to eligible beneficiaries, financial aid as a stipend to those undergoing poultry farming training
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be from Gujarat, belong to Economically Weaker Section(EWS), have taken 6 days of poultry-rearing training
Tags: Poultry Farming, Agriculture, Gujarat, Weaker Sections, Divyang Individuals
Scheme Name: Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R. Bird’s unit 40 R.I.R. Bird’s Unit and Stipend for Poultry Farming Training
Target Beneficiaries: Economically Weaker Section(EWS), Divyang individuals

Application Process: Offline and Online. Step 1: Present proposal during the open meeting of the Gram Sabha. Step 2: Submit proposal with required documents to the Veterinary Officer, Livestock Extension Officer, or Gram Panchayat Development Officer. Step 3: Proposal is reviewed and recommended by the village-level selection committee. Step 4: Financial assistance is disbursed to the beneficiary through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) within one to two months.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided by the State Government to eligible beneficiaries for purchasing sheep to establish a sheep-rearing unit comprising 10 female sheep and 1 male sheep, for a duration of 10 to 14 months. The scheme encourages the improvement of economic conditions of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes by providing them with sustainable livelihood opportunities in animal husbandry.
Ministries/Departments: Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Uttarakhand, 2. Belong to Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category, 3. Listed in SECC (Socio-Economic Caste Census) database, 4. Interested in establishing a sheep-rearing unit for self-employment
Tags: Self-employment, Sheep, Sheep Rearing, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Bhed Palan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes

Application Process: Offline and Online, involving proposal submission to Gram Sabha, review by village-level selection committee, and final selection by development block-level committee
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for purchasing a milch cow up to the fourth calving, with a total assistance of ₹36,000 and a beneficiary contribution of ₹4,000
Ministries/Departments: Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Uttarakhand, 2. Belong to Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category, 3. Listed in the SECC (Socio-Economic Caste Census) database
Tags: Cow Rearing, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribes, Self-employment, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Gau Palan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes under the SECC category

Application Process: Offline and Online. Step 1: Present proposal during the open meeting of the Gram Sabha. Step 2: Submit the proposal, along with all the required documents, to the Veterinary Officer, Livestock Extension Officer, or Gram Panchayat Development Officer of the concerned area. Step 3: The proposal is reviewed and recommended by the village-level selection committee. After recommendation, the development block-level committee conducts the final selection and forwards it to the Animal Husbandry Department.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote livelihood and self-reliance among women through goat rearing. Financial assistance of up to ₹35,000/- is provided by the State Government to eligible beneficiaries for the purchase of one unit of goats (comprising 3 females and 1 male), aged between 12 to 18 months.
Ministries/Departments: Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a woman. 2. The applicant should be interested in goat rearing. 3. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 4. The applicant should be from one of the following categories: Widow, Abandoned, Destitute, Living alone, Disaster-affected
Tags: Goat Rearing, Financial Support, Women Empowerment, Livestock Development
Scheme Name: Mahila Bakri Palan
Target Beneficiaries: Abandoned, widowed, destitute, single, and disaster-affected women

Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal, with 8 steps: 1. Visit the portal, 2. Click on 'Schemes' and then 'Animal Husbandry Schemes', 3. Select the scheme and click 'Apply', 4. Submit a new application, 5. Click 'Update Application' to add corrections, 6. Confirm the application, 7. Take a printout of the confirmed application, 8. Check application status/view/print/upload application details.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed free of cost to livestock owners during the critical post-parturition period, one month after delivery, to support the health of the mother cattle and the calf.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be a livestock owner. 2. The applicant must belong to the General Category. 3. The animal must have recently calved (given birth).
Tags: Animal Husbandry, Cattle Development, Concentrate Feeds, Milk Production
Scheme Name: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (General Category)
Target Beneficiaries: Livestock owners belonging to the General Category

Application Process: Online application through Antyodaya-SARAL Portal
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹36,000/- (i.e. ₹30,000/- for motherhood and ₹6000/- for nutritious food) will be given to women registered construction workers after the birth of the child.
Ministries/Departments: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: The women worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB) and have a minimum of one-year regular membership.
Tags: Maternity, Financial Assistance, Construction Workers, Women, Haryana
Scheme Name: Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Women registered construction workers

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Download the application form from the official website. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective General Manager, District Industries & Commerce Centre (DICC).
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote digital transformation and enhance the eCommerce capabilities of MSMEs in the state. Financial assistance is provided for adopting software, equipment for digitization, and for registering on eCommerce platforms.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries and Commerce, Government of Rajasthan
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The enterprise should be a Micro, Small, or Medium Enterprise (MSME) in production. 2. The enterprise should be located in Rajasthan. 3. The applicant should possess a valid Udyam Registration Certificate at the time of application. 4. The applicant should have incurred expenses on digitization (software/equipment) after notification of Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024. 5. The applicant should have registered on an eCommerce platform after the notification of Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024.
Tags: Digitization Of Business, eCommerce, Financial Assistance, MSME, MSME Policy
Scheme Name: Assistance for Digitization of Business Processes and Adoption of eCommerce
Target Beneficiaries: Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in production

Application Process: Offline application process. The interested applicant should visit the office of the District Sainik Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. OR The applicant should download the application form from the official website.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide lifelong financial assistance to war widows and parents of unmarried martyrs who sacrificed their lives in various wars, counter-insurgency operations, and aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999. The amount is deposited directly into the beneficiary’s bank account every month. Samman Bhatta is provided at ₹5000/- per month for a lifetime.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. The applicant should either be a war widow of a martyr or a parent of an unmarried martyr who sacrificed their life in wars, counter-insurgency operations, or aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Martyrs, War Widows, Parents of Martyrs, Rajasthan
Scheme Name: Samman Bhatta to War Widows and Parents of Martyrs
Target Beneficiaries: War widows and parents of unmarried martyrs

Application Process: Offline, Collect and submit the prescribed application form to the District Backward & Extremely Backward Class Welfare Office, Saharsa
Description & Benefits: Provides residential facilities to students, 9 kg of rice and 6 kg of wheat per month, and ₹1000/- per month under the Chief Minister's Hostel Grant Scheme
Ministries/Departments: BC & EBC Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Bihar, 2. Studying in an educational institution near the hostel, 3. Belong to the Extremely Backward Class (EBC), 4. Studying in Class 10+2 or higher
Tags: Education, Hostel, Student, Backward Classes, Extremely Backward Classes, Bihar
Scheme Name: Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Backward Classes and Extremely Backward Classes students

Application Process: Online application through e-District Portal of the Govt. of NCT of Delhi
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to SC students, covering maintenance allowance, tuition fees, and additional allowances for specific needs
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC, Government of NCT of Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: Annual family income limit of ₹2,50,000/- and enrollment in a recognized institution
Tags: Education, Scheduled Caste, Scholarship, Student
Scheme Name: Post Matric Scholarship for SC students (Delhi)
Target Beneficiaries: SC students pursuing post-matriculation or post-secondary education in recognized institutions within India

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the office of the District Sainik Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sainik Welfare Office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides lifelong financial assistance as a measure of relief to World War II ex-servicemen and their widows who are not receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source. Eligible beneficiaries receive ₹15,000/- per month, which is directly deposited into their bank accounts every month.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. 2. The applicant should be either an ex-serviceman who served during World War II (1st September 1939 to 15th August 1945) or his widow. 3. The applicant should not be receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source.
Tags: Pension, Ex-servicemen, Widows, World War II, Financial Assistance, Rajasthan
Scheme Name: World War II Pension
Target Beneficiaries: Ex-servicemen who served in World War II and their widows

Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal, with 8 steps: register, select scheme, apply, submit, confirm, print, and track application status
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for fish farming, fish seed rearing, and procurement of essential fisheries equipment, benefiting individuals, societies, and self-help groups involved in inland fisheries
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should be a Fisherman, above 18 years of age, have own private land/leased land, and a bank account
Tags: Fish Farming, Inland Fisheries, Fish Seed Production, Gujarat, Agriculture, Farmer
Scheme Name: To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Non-Tribal Areas
Target Beneficiaries: Individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir monopolies, private units involved in inland fisheries activities

Application Process: The legal heir of the deceased fisherman must collect and fill out the application form, submit it to the concerned district office along with necessary documents, and upon verification, financial assistance will be provided to the eligible beneficiary.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to the families of deceased fishermen in Gujarat in case of death in Pakistan Jail, lost in the sea, or accidental death while fishing at sea. The financial assistance varies based on the cause of death and is meant to help the legal heirs cope with the loss.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a legal heir of the deceased fisherman. The deceased must have been an active fisherman from Gujarat.
Tags: Accidental Assistance, Agriculture, Farmer, Insurance
Scheme Name: Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Families of deceased fishermen in Gujarat

Application Process: Online application through the i-Khedut portal. The applicant must upload necessary documents and follow the steps to submit the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides assistance for fish seed rearing, stocking, and transportation, as well as financial aid for boats, nets, and fish sale equipment. Additionally, training programs with stipends are available to enhance skills and productivity in the fisheries sector.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Individuals/societies/self-help groups/associations/reservoir monopolies/private units involved in inland fisheries activities can apply. The applicant should be a Fisherman, belong to the Schedule Caste (SC) category, be above 18 years of age, and have a valid bank account.
Tags: Fisheries, Scheduled Caste, Gujarat, Agriculture, Fishermen, Fish Farmers
Scheme Name: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste fishermen and fish farmers

Application Process: Offline. For identification of the beneficiaries, the government of J&K may stipulate credible and verifiable documents. The state government will verify the documents and recommend the name of the beneficiaries along with copy of Aadhar card and Aadhar linked bank account number of the beneficiaries to the MHA.
Description & Benefits: A relief and rehabilitation scheme providing central assistance to the displaced families from PoK And Chhamb and settled in the state of Jammu & Kashmir. The scheme provides a one-time full and final settlement of Rs. 2,000 crore for rehabilitation package for 36,384 such families against the properties they were forced to part with due to war and hostilities.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Home Affairs
Eligibility Criteria: The Claimant/Head of the Displaced Persons family or his/her successor or heir residing within the State should be part of the overall category of 36,384 families belonging to any of the following categories: Pakistan occupied Jammu & Kashmir 1947 Displaced Persons, Chhamb 1965 and 1971 (camp/non-camp) Displaced Persons
Tags: Business, Displaced, Family, Farming, Jammu, Kashmir, Rehabilitation
Scheme Name: Central Assistance For One Time Settlement Of Displaced Families From PoK And Chhamb Under Prime Minister's Development Package
Target Beneficiaries: Displaced families from PoK And Chhamb and settled in the state of Jammu & Kashmir

Application Process: Online application through the official website, with steps including registration, filling up of application form, uploading of required documents, and payment of application fee.
Description & Benefits: Scholarships are offered to all admitted students. An M.Sc. student is granted a scholarship/fellowship of value Rs.7,500/- p.m. In addition to this, M.Sc. students have a contingent grant of Rs.6,000/- per annum, for meeting out the expenditure on study tours, experimental material, purchase of books and preparation of thesis, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Eligibility Criteria: Bachelor of Science degree in Agriculture / Horticulture / Forestry / Agroforestry / Sericulture / Agricultural Marketing/ B.Sc.(10+2+3 System) with 60% marks or its equivalent Overall grade point average (OGPA) for the general category, and 55% marks or its equivalent OGPA for SC/ST/PH candidates.
Tags: Agricultural, Scholarship, M.Sc., Ph.D., Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Indian Agricultural Research Institute
Scheme Name: IASRI Scholarship For M.Sc And Ph.D
Target Beneficiaries: M.Sc. and Ph.D. students in Agricultural Statistics and Computer Application

Application Process: Online application process through single window portal website. Registration and login required. Application form to be filled and submitted with required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides Capital Investment Subsidy and Credit Linked Interest Subsidy to Medical Equipment and Accessories, Medical Diagnostics and AYUSH Products Manufacturing Units. Benefits include 20% of Gross Fixed Capital Investment made will be reimbursed subject to maximum of ₹50,00,000/- per unit and 60% per annum limited to maximum of ₹50,00,000/- lakhs per annum for Five years OR for the period of repayment of loan whichever is earlier.
Ministries/Departments: Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of Dadra & Nagar Haveli And Daman & Diu
Eligibility Criteria: Should be a New Manufacturing/ Service units or Existing Manufacturing/ Service units which undertakes Expansion/ Diversification in MSME sector. The unit should have commenced the commercial production between 20.05.2022 to 19.05.2027. Unit should be located in the U.T. of Dadra and Nagar Haveli & Daman and Diu. Enterprise shall have to apply at online portal within one year from the date of first disbursement of loan or on or before the date of commencement of commercial production.
Tags: Ayush Products, Entrepreneurship, Incentives, IPS, Medical Accessories, Medical Diagnostics, Medical Equipment, Medical Manufacturing Units, Reimbursement, Subsidy, Thrust Sectors
Scheme Name: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Scheme For Medical Equipment And Accessories, Medical Diagnostics And Ayush Products Manufacturing Units
Target Beneficiaries: Medical Equipment and Accessories, Medical Diagnostics and AYUSH Products Manufacturing Units

Application Process: The application process involves approaching the nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector of your area.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹20,000/- per year for the care of mentally retarded children of construction workers.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a registered member Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Punjab, the member should be depositing his contribution to the Board regularly, and the child of the member should be mentally retarded or disabled.
Tags: Mentally Retarded, Children, Construction Worker, Labour, Welfare Scheme
Scheme Name: Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered workers of the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, and their mentally retarded children

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Application for registration is to be made in the prescribed form and is to be accompanied by prescribed documents and a fee of not more than ₹50/-. 2. Application for registration has to be made to the officer authorized by the Board on this behalf. 3. A registered worker should request a prescribed format for the application from the officer authorized by the Board and should attach all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required). 4. Application shall be submitted to the Member Secretary (BOCWWB) for this benefit.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides Female Menstrual Hygiene Kit to registered female beneficiaries to increase the hygiene level during their Menstrual period.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. 2. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker. 3. The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. 4. The applicant should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days in a given year. 5. The applicant should be a female. 6. The applicant should be a registered member under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu.
Tags: Building Worker, Construction Worker, Female, Health, Labour, Menstrual Hygiene Kit, Promoting Registration, Wellness
Scheme Name: Distribution of Female Menstrual Hygiene Kit for the Construction Workers
Target Beneficiaries: Registered female workers of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

Application Process: Offline application process: Step 1: Application for registration is to be made in the prescribed form and is to be accompanied by prescribed documents and a fee of not more than ₹50/-. Step 2: Application for registration has to be made to the officer authorized by the Board on this behalf. For the application of the welfare scheme: Step 1: Any registered worker can make an application in the prescribed Form-VI along with the mandatory documents (self attested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the Member Secretary (BOCWWB) for this benefit.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides reimbursement of actual medical expenses incurred by the beneficiary for injuries sustained during employment upon presentation of original bills and pays half-monthly wages during the period of disablement.

Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. 2. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker. 3. The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. 4. The applicant should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.
Tags: Medical Assistance, Wage Loss, Construction Workers, Labour Department, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
Scheme Name: Medical Assistance and Wage Loss for the Construction Workers

Application Process: Offline application process involves registration as a Building/ Construction Worker and then applying for the welfare scheme with required documents.

Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of U.T. Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, should be a Building/ Construction Worker, should be between 18 and 60 years, and should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.

Application Process: Offline application process. Step 1: Application for registration is to be made in the prescribed form and is to be accompanied by prescribed documents and a fee of not more than ₹50/-. Step 2: Application for registration has to be made to the officer authorized by the Board. For the welfare scheme, Step 1: Any registered worker can make an application in the prescribed Form-IV along with the mandatory documents (self attested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the Member Secretary (BOCWWB) for this benefit.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for construction of house in their own land. The benefits include a token amount of ₹75,000/-, and additional amounts for applicants covered under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna (Gramin) and Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna (Urban).
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. 2. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker. 3. The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. 4. The applicant should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days in a given year. 5. Registered member Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. 6. The applicant should have completed one year membership with the Board. 7. The applicant should not have a pucca house. 8. The proposed house should be constructed on the applicant's own land.
Tags: Construction Workers, Labour, Housing, Financial Assistance, Welfare Scheme
