Application Process: Online application through the Corporation's official website, followed by submission of physical documents to the concerned Deputy Director (Non-Reserved Category) or the District Social Welfare Officer
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance of up to ₹10,00,000/- or actual expenditure incurred, whichever is less, for starting or expanding self-employment businesses
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Gujarat, age between 18 and 50 years, annual family income limit of ₹6,00,000/- or less, willing to repay the loan in equal monthly installments over 5 years
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, Loan, Self Employment
Scheme Name: Self-Employment Scheme: Nana Vyavasay Mate Loan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Unemployed or self-employed individuals from the unreserved category in Gujarat

Application Process: Offline application process: Collect application form from nearest Village (Dweep) Panchayat office, fill out the form and attach supporting documents, submit to the Executive Officer at the Village (Dweep) Panchayat office
Description & Benefits: Provides monthly financial assistance of ₹1,500/- per month (₹18,000/- per annum) to eligible widows, directly transferred to the beneficiary’s bank account
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs Department, Union Territory of Lakshadweep
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of the Union Territory of Lakshadweep, 2. Widow, 3. Not remarried, 4. Nominal income not exceeding ₹1,500/- per month (₹18,000/- per annum), 5. Not a beneficiary of any other similar pension scheme provided by the government
Tags: Pension, Widow, Financial Assistance, Lakshadweep
Scheme Name: Union Territory of Lakshadweep Pension Scheme for Widows
Target Beneficiaries: Widows who have not remarried and have no source of income

Application Process: Offline, approach the nearest Nari Adalat with your concern
Description & Benefits: Provides an alternate Grievance Redressal Mechanism for resolving cases of petty nature (harassment, subversion, curtailment of rights or entitlements) faced by women at Gram panchayat level by negotiation, mediation, and reconciliation with mutual consent for speedy, accessible, and affordable justice. It also provides a platform for awareness of rights, entitlements, social facilitation, and hand holding of women-centric organizations.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Women and Child Development
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a woman/girl
Tags: Women empowerment, justice, grievance redressal, affordable justice, conflict resolution, reconciliation, awareness generation
Scheme Name: Nari Adalat
Target Beneficiaries: Women and girls

Application Process: Online application through National Scholarship Portal. Steps include registration, filling the application form, uploading documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: ₹50,000/- per annum for every year of study i.e. maximum 4 years for the first year admitted students and maximum 3 years for the second year admitted students through lateral entry as lump sum amount towards payment of college fee, purchase of computer, stationeries, books, equipment, software, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Education
Eligibility Criteria: The candidate should be admitted to the First year of the Degree level course OR the Second year of the Degree level course through lateral entry in any of the AICTE-approved institutions of the respective year. Specially-abled students have a disability of not less than 40%. Family income from all sources should not be more than Rs. 8 lakh per annum during the current financial year.
Tags: Scholarship, Technical Education, Specially-Abled, Degree Course
Scheme Name: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Degree)
Target Beneficiaries: Specially-abled students

Application Process: Online application process with 4 steps: Registration, Filling of Application Form, Uploading of Documents, and Final Submission.
Description & Benefits: A scholarship scheme by the Student Development Cell (StDC) of All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to provide encouragement and support to orphans, wards of parents who died due to Covid-19, wards of Armed Forces, and Central Paramilitary Forces martyred in action (Shaheed) to pursue education. This is an attempt to give every such child, an opportunity to study further and prepare for a successful future through education in AICTE Approved institutions and courses. ₹50,000.00 per annum for every year of study i.e. maximum 4 years duration for first-year admitted Degree students and maximum 3 years for Diploma Students as lump sum amount towards payment of college fee, purchase of computer, stationeries, books, equipment, software, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Education
Eligibility Criteria: The candidate should be one of the following: (i) an orphan, OR (ii) whose either or both parents died due to Covid 19, OR (iii) Ward of Armed Forces and Central Paramilitary Forces martyred in action (Shaheed). The family income from all sources should not be more than ₹8,00,000 per annum during the financial year of the application. The candidate should be currently studying in the AICTE Approved institutions and courses at the Degree/Diploma level in regular mode (in 1st /2nd / 3rd /4th year). The candidate should NOT be a Recipient of any of the Central Govt. / State Govt. / AICTE Sponsored scholarships.
Tags: Scholarship, Education, Orphan, Covid-19, Armed Forces, Central Paramilitary Forces
Scheme Name: AICTE-Swanath Scholarship Scheme For Students
Target Beneficiaries: Orphans, wards of parents who died due to Covid-19, wards of Armed Forces, and Central Paramilitary Forces martyred in action (Shaheed)

Application Process: Offline application process involving registration, document submission, and verification by Zila Sainik Welfare Office (ZSWO) and Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB) Secretariat.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for the procurement of modified scooter for those Ex-Servicemen (ESM), who are disabled after their retirement from service with disability of 50% or more. The benefits include a financial assistance of a maximum of ₹ 1,00,000 and the beneficiary can re-apply for new mobility equipment after the lapse of 10 years from the date of purchase of the previous equipment.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Defence
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be an Ex-Serviceman. 2. The applicant should be disabled after retirement from the service. 3. The percentage of the disability should be 50% or more. 4. The applicant should not be covered under a similar scheme of the Army/Navy/Air Force. 5. The application of the applicant should be recommended by the respective Zila Sainik Board (ZSB). 6. The applicant should be capable of personally utilizing the mobility equipment provided.
Tags: Ex-Servicemen, Disability, Mobility Equipment, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Financial Assistance For Procuring Mobility Equipment To Disabled Ex-Servicemen (All Ranks)
Target Beneficiaries: Ex-Servicemen (ESM) who are disabled after their retirement from service with disability of 50% or more

Application Process: Offline, by downloading the application form and sending it along with required documents to the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
Description & Benefits: A scholarship scheme to support students with disabilities to obtain higher education viz., Master's degree, or Ph.D. courses from foreign universities, in one of the specified fields of study. The scheme provides various benefits including annual maintenance allowance, contingency allowance, equipment allowance, tuition fees, visa fees, poll tax, medical insurance premium, incidental journey allowance, and air passage.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a student, admitted into Master's level courses and Ph.D. courses abroad, with a disability percentage of 40% & above, and an age of 35 years or lesser, with a total family income not exceeding ₹ 6 lakh per annum.
Tags: Scholarship, Students with Disabilities, Higher Education, Master's Degree, Ph.D., Foreign Universities
Scheme Name: National Overseas Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
Target Beneficiaries: Students with disabilities

Application Process: The applicants can apply online through Research Leadership Building System (RLBS) Portal of ICAR. The last date to apply is 03 March, 2023.
Description & Benefits: The ICAR Emeritus Professor Scheme aims to utilize the talent and services of outstanding superannuated scientists/ teachers from NARES in teaching UG/ PG courses, other related activities, student research guidance and developing instructional material/ Text Books including e-learning resources for use in the national agricultural education programme and distance education. The benefits include Honorarium of Rs. 50,000/- p.m., Contingency grant (Non-lapsable) of Rs.1,00,000/- p. a. towards secretarial assistance, travel within the country connected with the assignment, stationery, postage, consumables, books and journals.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be an outstanding superannuated teacher/Scientist with a good record of published work and teaching/training experience of a minimum of 5 years. The teacher/Professor who is to retire in the next 12 months time is eligible to apply.
Tags: Agriculture, Education, Research, ICAR, Emeritus Professor
Scheme Name: ICAR Emeritus Professor
Target Beneficiaries: Superannuated teachers/Scientists of universities, colleges and institutions under the ICAR-AU System

Application Process: Online application process through the Gujarat Unreserved Education and Economical Development Corporation's website. Steps include registration, login, scheme details, address confirmation, document upload, and submission.
Description & Benefits: Provides financial aid for coaching to support non-reserved category students in pursuing professional courses in medical and engineering fields. Financial assistance of ₹20,000 per year per student or actual fee, whichever is lower.
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Belong to a non-reserved category. 2. Obtained 70% or more marks in Class 10th/ 11th/ 12th. 3. From Science stream. 4. Pursuing coaching for JEE, GUJCET, or NEET. 5. Coaching institute must have at least 3 years of experience. 6. Annual family income of ₹4,50,000/- or less.
Tags: Coaching Assistance, Engineering, GUJCET, JEE, Medical, NEET
Scheme Name: Coaching Help Scheme for JEE-GUJCET-NEET Exams
Target Beneficiaries: Non-reserved category students pursuing professional courses in medical and engineering fields

Application Process: Offline application process involving 7 steps: printing and filling the application form, attaching required documents, submitting to the Primary Weaver Cooperative Society, verification by the society, forwarding to the District Handloom Office, review by the selection committee, and final approval by the Managing Director.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial incentives to students from weaver families who secure admission to professional courses in government colleges. A financial incentive of ₹20,000/- is provided as an encouragement award to eligible students.
Ministries/Departments: Chhattisgarh State Handloom Development and Marketing Cooperative Union Limited, Raipur
Eligibility Criteria: The student must be from a family of weavers who are members of Primary Weaver Cooperative Societies affiliated to the State Handloom Union, Raipur. The student must be a resident of Chhattisgarh. The student's mother/father must be a regular member of a weaver cooperative society. The student must have secured admission in the first year of Engineering/Medical/CA/MBA course in any government college. More than 50% of the parent's income should be from weaving.
Tags: Education, Handloom, Scholarship, Student, College
Scheme Name: Uchch Shiksha Puraskar Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Talented students from weaver families

Application Process: The application process involves online registration, filling out the application form, uploading required documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to cover tuition fees, living expenses, and other educational costs. The repayment structure is flexible, ensuring students can repay the loan after completing their studies.
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must belong to a non-reserved category, have scored at least 60% in Standard-12, and have secured admission to an eligible foreign university for MBBS, graduation, post-graduation, or an equivalent diploma course. Additionally, the applicant’s family income must be ₹6,00,000/- or less.
Tags: Foreign Education, Higher Education, Student Loan, Gujarat
Scheme Name: Foreign Education Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Meritorious students from economically weaker sections who wish to pursue higher education abroad

Application Process: Online application through the corporation's website, followed by submission of required documents to the concerned Deputy Director (Non-Reserved Category) or the District Social Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance as on-road unit cost for purchasing vehicles such as rickshaws, loading rickshaws, Maruti cars, jeep taxis, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 2. The applicant must belong to the unreserved category. 3. The applicant's age should be between 18 years and 50 years. 4. The applicant must have a valid driving license. 5. The vehicle purchased under the scheme must be mortgaged (hypothecated) to the corporation. 6. The applicant must be willing to repay the loan in equal monthly installments over 5 years. 7. The annual income limit of the family should be ₹6,00,000/- or less.
Tags: Business, Self Employment, Vehicle Loan
Scheme Name: Self-Employment Scheme: Vahan Loan Sahay Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Self-employed individuals

Application Process: Offline, through a single universal toll-free number across the country, which is 181
Description & Benefits: Provides 24X7 emergency and non-emergency response through telephonic short-code 181, linking women with appropriate authorities, and providing information about women welfare schemes and services.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Women and Child Development
Eligibility Criteria: Any women in distress seeking emergency/non-emergency services or information or any other individual on her behalf
Tags: Women, Emergency, Non-Emergency, Helpline, Violence, Safety, Response, Counselling
Scheme Name: Women Helpline 181
Target Beneficiaries: Women in distress seeking emergency/non-emergency services or information

Application Process: Applicants can apply online through the official portal Antyodaya-SARAL Portal or the official website of NSFDC.
Description & Benefits: The scheme offers loans up to ₹1,00,000/- to women Safai Karamcharis or their dependents for economic development through self-employment initiatives, such as establishing cloth shops, dairies, tea shops, bangle shops, beauty parlours, papad making, basketry, tailoring shops, etc. The Corporation contributes margin money at 10% of the project cost.
Ministries/Departments: Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC)
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana, female, aged between 18 and 55 years, and either a Safai Karamchari or a dependent of one. There is no income limit.
Tags: Loan, Mahila, NSKFDC, Safai Karamcharis, Samridhi, Self-employment, Woman
Scheme Name: Mahila Samridhi Yojana under NSKFDC- Haryana
Target Beneficiaries: Women Safai Karamcharis or their dependents

Application Process: Online application through Antyodaya-SARAL Portal
Description & Benefits: An additional amount, in addition to the pension, is provided to the widow of an ex-serviceman who dies while in service but not in any battle. This additional amount is given for up to three children and continues until the child dies, reaches the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.
Ministries/Departments: Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be the widow of an ex-serviceman. 2. The widow should be a resident of Haryana. 3. The benefit is provided for up to three children of the widow. 4. The benefit continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.
Tags: Pension, Ex-Serviceman, Widow, Children, Haryana
Scheme Name: Additional Pension to Widow of Ex-Serviceman having Children
Target Beneficiaries: Widow of an ex-serviceman who dies while in service but not in any battle

Application Process: Offline application process: Collect application form from Village (Dweep) Panchayat office, fill out and attach supporting documents, submit to Executive Officer at Village (Dweep) Panchayat office
Description & Benefits: Provides monthly financial assistance of ₹1,500/- to senior citizens in the UT, directly transferred to the beneficiary’s bank account
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs Department, Union Territory of Lakshadweep
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of the Union Territory of Lakshadweep, 2. Above 60 years of age, 3. Monthly income not exceeding ₹1,500/- (₹18,000 per annum), 4. No source of income, 5. Not a beneficiary of any other similar pension scheme provided by the government
Tags: Financial Assistance, Old Age, Pension, Senior Citizen
Scheme Name: Union Territory of Lakshadweep Pension Scheme for Old Age
Target Beneficiaries: Senior citizens in the UT above 60 years of age who do not have any source of income

Application Process: Offline, Collect application form from the Village (Dweep) Panchayat Office or District Panchayat Office, Fill out the application form and attach required documents, Submit the completed application form to the concerned officer at the Village (Dweep) Panchayat Office or District Panchayat Office
Description & Benefits: Provide temporary employment opportunities to Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) as Helpers on an 89-day rotational basis in the District Panchayat offices of their respective islands, Monthly salary of ₹9,900/-
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs, Union Territory of Lakshadweep
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Local resident of the Union Territory of Lakshadweep, 2. Minimum 40% disability, 3. Physically capable of performing the work of a helper, 4. Belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category, 5. Age between 18 and 45 years, 6. Passed at least the 8th standard
Tags: Employment, Helper, Job, Person With Disabilities, PwD, Lakshadweep, Scheduled Tribe, Disability
Scheme Name: Special Jobs to PwDs - Helper
Target Beneficiaries: Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) with a minimum of 40% disability

Application Process: Offline application process involving printing and filling of the prescribed application form, attaching required documents, and submitting it to the Labour Incharge of the Board.
Description & Benefits: Upon the death of the pensioner, the surviving spouse is provided 50% of the pension amount or ₹1,500/-, whichever is higher.
Ministries/Departments: Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: The deceased should have been a pensioner of the Board. The applicant should be a family member or a dependent of the deceased.
Tags: Construction, Family, Labour, Pension, Worker
Scheme Name: Family Pension (DBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Surviving spouse of the deceased pensioner

Application Process: Offline application process involving registration with the Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce, submission of half-yearly claims, and scrutiny by the Task Force Committee
Description & Benefits: The scheme aimed to promote industrial growth, create a healthy environment for setting up new industrial units, revive sick industrial units, provide employment to local youths, and create manpower suitable to the needs of the industry. Additional benefits included a 5% increase in local employment subsidy, preference in capital contribution, and increased interest subsidy limits.
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: Manufacturing units, including new and existing micro, small, medium, and large enterprises, employing 80% local manpower, with focus on units in 'Green', 'Orange', or specified 'Orange' environmental categories
Tags: Employment, Entrepreneur, Incentive, Industry, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Goa State Employment Subsidy Scheme for the Industries, 2008
Target Beneficiaries: Manufacturing units, including new and existing micro, small, medium, and large enterprises, employing 80% local manpower

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form along with required documents to the Deputy Manager (Education Loan) in Room No. 208, 2nd Floor, Ambedkar Bhawan, Sector-16, Rohini, Delhi-89.
Description & Benefits: The scheme offers need-based loans with a maximum limit of ₹7,50,000/- for studies in India and ₹15,00,000/- for studies abroad.
Ministries/Departments: Delhi SC/ST/OBC/Minorities and Handicapped Financial Development Corporation Ltd., Government of Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Delhi, with an annual family income below ₹5,00,000/-. The applicant should be from one of the following target groups - Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Other Backward Class, Minority, Persons with Disability.
Tags: College, Disability, Education, Loan, Minority, OBC, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Student
Scheme Name: Education Loan Scheme - Delhi
Target Beneficiaries: Students belonging to Scheduled Castes (SC), Scheduled Tribes (ST), Other Backward Classes (OBC), Minorities, and Persons with Disabilities (PwD)

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Fisheries Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Fisheries Office. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Fisheries Office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to enhance fish production through feed-based fisheries. Financial support in the form of grants for floating fish feed is provided to fish farmers to increase fish production in various districts like Ranchi, Ramgarh, Koderma, Bokaro, Dhanbad, and Seraikela. Benefits include floating fish feed subsidy, support for cage fish farmers, and support for Biofloc pond farmers.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Animal Husbandry & Cooperation Department, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a fisherman. 2. The applicant must be an active fish farmer involved in cage fish farming, Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS), or Biofloc systems. 3. The applicant should have at least one year of previous crop records. 4. The applicant should not be enrolled in other overlapping schemes for the same purpose.
Tags: Fisheries, Fish Production, Financial Assistance, Grants, Fish Feed, Cage Fish Farming, Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS), Biofloc Systems
Scheme Name: Feed Based Fisheries Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Fish Farmers

Application Process: Offline application process involving collection of application form, filling and submitting it with required documents, and payment of processing fee
Description & Benefits: Need-based loans up to ₹5,00,000/- at an interest rate of 6% per annum for various income-generating activities
Ministries/Departments: Delhi Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, Other Backward Classes, and Minorities Financial and Development Corporation (DSFDC), Government of National Capital Territory (NCT) of Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Delhi for the last five years, aged between 18 to 50 years, annual family income not exceeding ₹2,00,000/-
Tags: Business, Employment, Entrepreneurship, Loan, Minority, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe
Scheme Name: Dilli Swarojgar Yojna
Target Beneficiaries: Individuals from Scheduled Castes (SC), Scheduled Tribes (ST), Other Backward Classes (OBC), and Minority communities

Application Process: Offline application process involving printing and filling of the application form, attaching required documents, and submitting to the Branch In-Charge / Section In-Charge of the Delhi SC/ST/OBC/Minorities/Handicapped Financial & Development Corporation.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides need-based financial support to individuals from targeted groups to help them pursue various income-generating activities, promoting self-employment and entrepreneurship, and economic independence and social inclusion.
Ministries/Departments: Delhi SC/ST/OBC/Minorities/Handicapped Financial & Development Corporation, Government of NCT of Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be from one of the target groups, a resident of Delhi, between 18 to 50 years old, with an annual family income not exceeding ₹1,20,000/-, willing to pursue income-generating activities, and have a proper workplace.
Tags: Disability, Employment, Entrepreneurship, Loan, Minority, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe
Scheme Name: Composite Loan Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, Other Backward Classes, Minorities, and Persons with Disabilities

Application Process: Online application through official website, registration, login, form completion, document upload, verification, and submission
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance for infrastructure development, educational resources, and staffing assistance to strengthen infrastructure and ensure holistic development of institutions
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Secondary Education, Department of School Education and Literacy, Jharkhand Government
Eligibility Criteria: Varies by institution type (secondary schools, madrasas/Sanskrit schools, intermediate colleges), including approval by State Government or Jharkhand Academic Council, student strength, pass rate, and infrastructure
Tags: Education, Infrastructure, Financial Assistance, Jharkhand
Scheme Name: Grant to Jharkhand State Unaided Educational Institutions
Target Beneficiaries: Approved unaided secondary schools, permanent intermediate colleges, madrasas, and Sanskrit schools

Application Process: Online application through Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP), Registration process involves filling in the registration form, verifying email ID, and completing the application process by filling in required details and uploading mandatory documents
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to SC/ST entrepreneurs for acquiring industrial sheds in mini estates developed by private developers, It encourages industrial growth by offering support for land, building, and infrastructure costs, Private developers receive an additional 15% assistance on the total cost of the shed, SC/ST entrepreneurs need to pay only 30% of the shed price, after which possession is handed over, and developers can claim assistance, The government disburses 35% of the shed cost after the sale and the remaining amount after production begins
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The firm must be a Micro/Small/Medium enterprise run by SC/ST entrepreneur, The shed must be located in a government-approved mini estate, The entrepreneur must pay 30% of the shed cost to acquire possession
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Start Up
Scheme Name: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance to MSEs for Shed Developed by Private Developer
Target Beneficiaries: SC/ST entrepreneurs, Micro/Small/Medium enterprises (MSEs)

Application Process: Online application through Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP). Registration process involves filling in the registration form, verifying email ID, and logging in to access the application form. Post-registration process involves filling in required details and mandatory documents about the business.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to MSMEs for expenses incurred in raising capital through SME Exchange, encouraging them to explore funding options through the capital markets. MSMEs can receive up to 30% of the total expenditure incurred for raising capital through SME Exchange with a maximum up to ₹5,00,000/-.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The firm must be a Micro/Small/Medium enterprise run by SC/ST entrepreneur. The enterprise must have successfully raised equity capital through an SME Exchange. Enterprise shall have to apply within one year from the listing date in SME Exchange.
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Start Up
Scheme Name: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance for Raising Capital through SME Exchange
Target Beneficiaries: SC/ST entrepreneurs, MSMEs

Application Process: Online application through Antyodaya-SARAL Portal, Registration and login required, Fill in the online application form and submit
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides monthly financial assistance of ₹2750 to eligible beneficiaries, The financial assistance will continue until the beneficiary turns 60 years old
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice, Empowerment, Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes and Antyodaya (SEWA) Department, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a domicile of Haryana or have been residing in the state for at least the last 15 years, The applicant should be a widower, The applicant should have attained the age of 40 years, The applicant's verified annual income should be up to ₹3,00,000/-, The applicant should possess a Family ID
Tags: Empowerment, Financial Assistance, Social Security, Widower
Scheme Name: Financial Assistance to Widower and Unmarried Persons Scheme : For Widower
Target Beneficiaries: Widowers who are unable to sustain themselves from their own sources and are in need of financial assistance from the State

Application Process: Online application through the Harchhatravratti portal. Registration process involves entering Parivar Pehchaan Patra (Family Id), selecting the department and college, and creating a password. Application process involves logging in, checking eligibility, selecting the scholarship scheme, providing necessary details, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Castes students pursuing AICTE-approved technical courses by reimbursing tuition fees and transport costs.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Technical Education, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a Scheduled Caste student of Haryana. 2. The student should be enrolled in an AICTE-approved Diploma, Undergraduate, or Postgraduate technical course. 3. The applicant should be pursuing an AICTE-approved course in a government, private, or aided technical institution approved by the Technical Education Department, Haryana. 4. The applicant should be admitted through centralized counselling. 5. The applicant’s annual parental income should be between ₹2.5 lakh and ₹3.5 lakh for tuition fee reimbursement. 6. The applicant should not be residing in a campus hostel to be eligible for transport facility reimbursement.
Tags: Scheduled Castes, Technical Education, Haryana, Tuition Fee Reimbursement, Transport Facility
Scheme Name: Reimbursement of Tuition Fee and Transport Facility to Scheduled Castes Students Studying in Technical Institutions in Haryana
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes students pursuing AICTE-approved technical courses in Haryana

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of project report to Industries Commissionerate, scrutiny of the proposal, and submission of claim of assistance to Industries Commissionerate.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to support the development and upgradation of industrial infrastructure in the state. It provides financial assistance to eligible institutions for creating infrastructure facilities that foster industrial growth, improve operational efficiency, and encourage investments. Benefits include general assistance of up to 80% of the eligible project cost or ₹25,00,00,000/- per project, whichever is less, supplementary assistance, assistance for MSE clusters, and funding for specific studies.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Eligible institution means any Industries Association, Chamber of Commerce and industry or SPV of industries (which are registered under Societies Act, Trust Act or the Companies Act) or any Large Project/Group of Industries are eligible. Any Government Department, Govt. Agency or Authority, State and Central Govt. PSUs, Board, Corporation, Municipal Corporations will be considered as eligible Institution.
Tags: Industrial Infrastructure, Investment, Entrepreneurship, Gujarat
Scheme Name: Scheme for Assistance for Industrial Infrastructure
Target Beneficiaries: Eligible institutions, industries associations, chambers of commerce, SPVs, government departments, PSUs, and municipal corporations

Application Process: Offline, eligible citizens will be identified by their respective Gram Panchayat during the Gram Sabhas. The Panchayat Secretary maintains a register of eligible persons and sends the Gram Sabha resolution recommending eligible persons to the Mandal Parishad Development Officer (MPDO).
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to disburse monthly pensions to old age citizens, both male and female, who are 65 years of age or above and are destitute. The pension amount is notified by the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Rural Development, Government of Andhra Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family, a local resident of the district, from a rural area, not covered under any other Pension Scheme, 65 years of age or above, destitute, with no means of subsistence, and no family or relatives to depend upon
Tags: Financial Assistance, Old Age, Pension, Senior Citizen, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Rural)
Target Beneficiaries: Old age citizens, both male and female, who are 65 years of age or above and are destitute

Application Process: Offline application process. Submit the application form to The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development (CED) for onward submission to the Screening Committee. Applications are received twice a year in April and October.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to enhance skill development by providing industry-relevant training. It enables Industry Partners and Host Institutes to collaborate in setting up specialized training centers to equip trainees with in-demand skills, improving employability and workforce readiness. Financial assistance is provided for fixed cost, refurbishing support, and recurring cost. Additional assistance is provided for awareness programs, seminars, and other expenditures.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Host Institute must be an ITIs, Polytechnic, Engineering College, or Government-Affiliated Institution with at least 5 years of experience. Industry Partner must be an industry/association with at least 10 years of experience in skill development. Both entities must be legally registered under Societies Act, Trust Act, or Companies Act. Courses should be aligned with NSDC, NCVT, GCVT, or Sector Skill Council guidelines. A minimum of 25% of course intake must be industry-sponsored. At least 75% of industry-sponsored trainees must be provided employment. The training center must be operational for at least 5 years.
Tags: Entrepreneurship Development, Manpower Solution, Short Term Bridge Courses, Skill Development, Technical Competence
Scheme Name: Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower: Scheme of Financial Assistance for Running Short-term Bridge Courses
Target Beneficiaries: Industry Partners and Host Institutes

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form to The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development (CED) for onward submission to the Screening Committee.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial support to MSMEs for the skill upgradation of their workforce, bridge the industry’s skill gap, boost employment, and align workforce training with evolving technology and business needs. Benefits include financial assistance, skill enhancement, recognized training, and third-party assessment.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant unit should belong to the MSME sector, the MSME must sponsor a candidate from its workforce, the candidate must have at least one year of experience in the MSME, and the training partner/organization must have at least 10 years of experience.
Tags: Entrepreneurship Development, Manpower Solution, MSME, Skill Development, Technical Competence
Scheme Name: Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower: Scheme of Financial Assistance for Skill Development to MSME Sector
Target Beneficiaries: Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) and their employees

Application Process: Online application through the Centralized Scholarship Portal of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana, with registration and application steps involving OTP verification, form filling, and document uploading.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial incentives to CBSE toppers, covering their school/college fees up to the completion of their graduation, with a limit of ₹25,000 per year till 10+2 and ₹1,00,000 per year till graduation.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Higher Education, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a domicile of Haryana, top-ranked boy or girl in the CBSE 10th or 12th annual exams at the state level, continuing education as a regular student, passed from a school in Haryana, and secured required percentage in CBSE exams.
Tags: Education, Financial Assistance, Incentive, Merit, School, Student
Scheme Name: Haryana State Meritorious Incentive Scheme for the Students Who Attain First Position in CBSE Annual Exams in the State
Target Beneficiaries: Meritorious students who attain top positions in CBSE annual exams

Application Process: Offline application process involving preparation of a Detailed Project Report (DPR), filling out a prescribed application form, and submitting the application with required documents to the Industries Commissionerate
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for the relocation or retrofitting of polluting industrial units to designated green estates, aiming to reduce environmental pollution and promote sustainable industrial growth.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Industries recommended by GPCB for relocation or retrofitting, and approved by the State Level Empowered Committee (SLEC)
Tags: Environment Infrastructure, Entrepreneurship, Green Estate, Industrial Growth, Pollution Control, Sustainability
Scheme Name: Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure: Scheme for Development of Green Estate
Target Beneficiaries: Institutions or groups of industries with polluting industrial units recommended for relocation or retrofitting by GPCB

Application Process: Offline application through newspaper advertisements and single-window systems, submission of proposals with necessary land documents and proof of experience in fish farming to District Fisheries Officers, selection process by district councils, approval and funding, construction and monitoring.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for constructing rearing ponds with a minimum water area of one acre, supporting private-sector fish farming for sustainable fish production.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, and Cooperation (Fisheries Division), Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a fisherman, have proposed land near their residence, be engaged in fish farming or have constructed a fish seed hatchery with a departmental subsidy, have undisputed land, and be financially capable of contributing their share of the pond construction costs.
Tags: Fish farming, Rearing ponds, Financial assistance, Sustainable fish production, Private-sector fish farming
Scheme Name: Rearing Pond Construction Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Private-sector fish farmers, Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes

Application Process: Online application through the Centralized Scholarship Portal of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana. Registration and login required.
Description & Benefits: Monetary rewards are granted to students who secure top positions in annual university examinations across Arts, Commerce, Science (Medical and Non-Medical), and Education streams. ₹5,000/- per annum for students securing the first position, ₹3,000/- per annum for students securing the second position, and ₹2,000/- per annum for students securing the third position.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Higher Education, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. College-specific, 2. Top three meritorious students in each stream, 3. Pursuing general courses in Government Colleges, 4. Not eligible for students from Non-Government Colleges and those who pursue their studies through correspondence courses/open universities
Tags: Education, Incentive, Merit, Scholarship, Student
Scheme Name: Haryana State Meritorious Incentive Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Meritorious students studying in government colleges

Application Process: Online application through Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP), Registration Process: Fill in the Registration Form, Verify the E-mail ID, Post-Registration Process: Fill in the required details and mandatory documents about your business
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a capital investment subsidy to support micro-enterprises in manufacturing, Financial Assistance: 30% of term loan amount upto ₹40,00,000/- for Category 1 Taluka, 25% of term loan amount upto ₹35,00,000/- for Category 2 Taluka, and 15% of term loan amount upto ₹15,00,000/- for Category 3 (Municipal Corporation areas)
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The firm must be a Micro/Small/Medium enterprise run by SC/ST entrepreneur, The enterprise must be a manufacturing enterprise, Applications must be submitted online within one (1) year of the first loan disbursement date, the date of commercial production commencement, or the GR issue date, whichever is later, and before the scheme's last operative date.
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Start Up
Scheme Name: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance of Capital Investment Subsidy
Target Beneficiaries: SC/ST entrepreneurs, Micro/Small/Medium enterprises

Application Process: Online application through the Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP). Registration, login, and filling in the required details and documents are necessary to complete the application process.
Description & Benefits: The scheme supports MSMEs in the manufacturing sector to obtain quality certifications and enhance their product standards in a competitive market. It covers the implementation of ERP systems and national/international quality certifications.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: The firm must be a Micro/Small/Medium enterprise run by SC/ST entrepreneur. The enterprise must apply within one year from the date of certification issuance.
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Start Up
Scheme Name: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance for Quality Certification
Target Beneficiaries: SC/ST entrepreneurs, MSMEs in the manufacturing sector

Application Process: Online and Offline, Registration Process involves filling in the Registration Form, verifying the E-mail ID, and filling in the required details and mandatory documents about the business
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to private developers for developing Logistics Facilities and Logistics Park with all required infrastructure and logistic services, Exemption of Electricity Duty from the date of Commencement of Operation
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Newly established units or projects, Developer has to maintain and operate the logistic facilities for at least minimum period of 5 years
Tags: Logistics Facilities, Electricity Duty, Gujarat, Industrial Growth, Economic Development
Scheme Name: Scheme for Financial Assistance to Integrated Logistics Facilities: Exemption of Electricity Duty
Target Beneficiaries: Private developers for developing Logistics Facilities and Logistics Park

Application Process: Offline, through submission of application form and required documents at any Govt./Pvt. network hospital in the state
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides cashless medical services for secondary and tertiary treatments through empaneled hospitals, offering up to ₹1.5 lakh under MJPJAY and ₹5 lakh under Ayushman Bharat annually.
Ministries/Departments: Public Health and Family Welfare Department, Government of Maharashtra
Eligibility Criteria: Families holding Yellow, Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY), Annapurna Yojna and Orange Ration Card, White ration card holder families, Students in Govt. and Govt. recognized Ashram School, etc.
Tags: Health Insurance, Cashless Service, Diseases, Hospital, Maharashtra
Scheme Name: Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Jan Arogya Yojana (MJPJAY)
Target Beneficiaries: All families in the state of Maharashtra, including low-income families

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: 1. Obtain the application form from the Office of the Collector, Assistant Director, Backward Classes and Minority Welfare Department District Office. 2. Fill in the application form and attach required documents. 3. Submit the application form to the concerned authority. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority.
Description & Benefits: Provides free accommodation to backward class students who are eligible for the Post Matric Scholarship, studying in an educational institution near the hostel, and are not local residents.
Ministries/Departments: Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should belong to the Backward Class. 2. The applicant should be studying in an educational institution located near the hostel. 3. The applicant should not be a resident.
Tags: Education, Hostel, Student, Backward Classes
Scheme Name: Admission in Post Matric Hostel
Target Beneficiaries: Backward class students

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: 1. Obtain the application form from the college, 2. Fill in the form and attach required documents, 3. Submit the form to the authority, 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement.
Description & Benefits: The scheme allows students to claim a refund of the remaining admission fee (including caution money) if they leave the college during the academic session after admission, are declared failed after provisional admission, or if their online admission is cancelled.
Ministries/Departments: Higher Education Department, Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be admitted to a college. 2. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh.
Tags: College, Education, Financial Assistance, Student
Scheme Name: Refund of Fees
Target Beneficiaries: Students

Application Process: Apply online through the official PREJHA Foundation application portal, fill out the application form with personal details, select the desired course, upload necessary documents, and submit the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides skill-based nursing education and employment opportunities for young women in Jharkhand, including free residential training, advanced nursing education, hands-on practice in modern simulation labs, 100% campus placement assistance, safe and modern campus with advanced simulation labs, and free 15-day residential coaching for JCECEB nursing entrance exam.
Ministries/Departments: Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand, between 18-30 years of age, and have passed the 12th grade in any stream.
Tags: Nursing Education, Employment Opportunities, Women Empowerment, Jharkhand
Scheme Name: Nursing Kaushal College Jharkhand
Target Beneficiaries: Young women from Jharkhand, especially from Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities, and Other Backward Classes

Application Process: Offline application process involving tender participation, earnest money deposit, and compliance with quality standards.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides benefits such as price matching, reduced tender document costs, and priority in payments to Micro and Small Enterprises permanently registered with the Directorate of Industry, Trade & Commerce.
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Industry, Trade & Commerce, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: The enterprise should have a turnover not exceeding ₹6,00,00,000/- per annum for the preceding 3 financial years and should be permanently registered or acknowledged with Entrepreneurs Memorandum II by the Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce.
Tags: Business, Commerce, Entrepreneur, Incentive, Industry, MSME, Purchase, Tax
Scheme Name: Preferential Purchase Incentives for Micro and Small Enterprises Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Micro and Small Scale Enterprises

Application Process: Offline application process involving identification of eligible persons by Ward Sabhas, recommendation and sanction by the Municipal Commissioner, and disbursement of pensions by the Bill Collector.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to destitute weavers aged 50 years or above. The pension amount is notified by the Government of Andhra Pradesh and is disbursed on the first date of every month.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Rural Development, Government of Andhra Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be from a BPL family, be a resident of a district of Andhra Pradesh, be 65 years of age or above, be a weaver by profession, and not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.
Tags: Pension, Senior Citizen, Urban, Weaver, Below Poverty Line (BPL)
Scheme Name: INDIRAMMA Weavers Pension (Urban)
Target Beneficiaries: Destitute weavers aged 50 years or above from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families

Application Process: Offline application to the Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce in the specified format along with required documents
Description & Benefits: Financial support to local entrepreneurs, existing functional units, and units that utilize locally developed technology, Maximum capital contribution up to ₹1,00,00,000/- per unit, Guaranteed return of 6% or actual profit
Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: Clusters/Units which are in operation for a period of at least 3 years, Partnership firms and private limited concerns, Units permanently registered with the Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce
Tags: Business, Capital, Commerce, Financial Support, Technology
Scheme Name: Capital Contribution Scheme (Goa)
Target Beneficiaries: Local entrepreneurs, existing functional units, and units that utilize locally developed technology

Application Process: Offline application process involving site identification and proposal preparation, beneficiary committee formation, approval from Gram Sabha, submission to District Welfare Office/ITDA, technical assessment and approval, and administrative sanction.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to preserve and develop sacred tribal sites. It provides protection, fencing, infrastructure development, and beautification measures to ensure the conservation of tribal culture and traditions. Benefits include fencing of sacred sites, infrastructure development, beautification and preservation, solar-powered lighting, driveway and walkway development, and cultural promotion.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities, and Backward Classes Welfare, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: The site must be an officially recorded Sarna, Jahersthan, Hadgadi, or Masna location. The concerned site should be under tribal community usage and cultural significance. The beneficiary community must form a designated committee consisting of tribal members only. Gram Sabha selection and approval are mandatory for project initiation. The site must be registered under Revenue, Registration & Land Reforms Department records.
Tags: Tribal Culture, Infrastructure Development, Beautification, Preservation, Solar-Powered Lighting, Cultural Promotion
Scheme Name: Sarna /Jahersthan/Hadgadi & Masna Protection and Development Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Tribal communities managing Sarna, Jahersthan, Hadgadi, or Masna sites

Application Process: Offline application through Uzhavar Udhaviyagam (Farmers' Help Centres) or the Office of the Additional Director of Agriculture (Horticulture)
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance through DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer) mode for cutting & removal, replanting, and integrated management practices
Ministries/Departments: Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry, Coconut Development Board
Eligibility Criteria: All categories of coconut farmers with farmer's identity cards/ authenticated land records/documents
Tags: Coconut, Farmer, Financial Assistance, Garden, Plant, Seed
Scheme Name: Replanting & Rejuvenation of Coconut Garden (R&R)
Target Beneficiaries: All categories of coconut farmers

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of proposal to the Industries Commissionerate, scrutiny by the office of the Industries Commissioner, review and approval by the State Level Empowered Committee (SLEC), and reimbursement of sanctioned assistance
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial support to eligible institutions for establishing R&D or product development centers, aiming to promote innovation, technological advancements, and product design improvements. Financial assistance of up to 30% of the investment in machinery, equipment, hardware, software, and related assets, with a maximum limit of ₹5,00,00,000/-
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Institutions must be recognized by CSIR or DSIR, and engaged or about to be engaged in the manufacture, production, processing or job work of articles
Tags: Research and Development, Product Development, Industrial Growth, Environmental Norms, Innovation, Technological Advancements, Product Design Improvements
Scheme Name: Scheme for assistance for Research & Development Activities: Assistance to Establish Research & Development/Product Development Centre
Target Beneficiaries: Institutions, industrial associations, and professional bodies recognized by CSIR or DSIR, including legal entities such as companies, LLPs, trusts, societies, and similar organizations

Application Process: Offline application process through district welfare offices. Applicants need to visit the district welfare office, fill out the application form, attach necessary documents, and submit it for approval.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to improve healthcare access and outcomes for primitive tribal communities. It provides financial assistance of ₹38,41,632 for health-related services and programs to ensure better medical support and infrastructure for the targeted groups.
Ministries/Departments: Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should belong to a primitive tribal community and reside in districts covered under the scheme, including Dumka, Sahebganj, Pakur, and Godda.
Tags: Healthcare, Medical, Primitive Tribal, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Special Health Scheme for Primitive Tribes
Target Beneficiaries: Primitive tribal communities

Application Process: Offline, Step 1: Obtain application form from Office of the Head of the Department (HoD) of the School, Step 2: Fill in the application form, attach documents, and submit to the authority
Description & Benefits: Provides awards ranging from ₹3,000/- to ₹51,000/- to meritorious students based on their performance in 10th and 12th board examinations
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh, 2. Student, 3. From Scheduled Tribe (ST) or Scheduled Caste (SC) category, 4. Enrolled in Class 10th or 12th, 5. Selected based on merit list of 10th and 12th board examinations
Tags: Education, Merit, Pre Matric, Scholarship, Student
Scheme Name: Rani Durgavati and Shankarshah Puraskar Scheme (Reward Scheme for Meritorious Students)
Target Beneficiaries: Meritorious students from the Scheduled Tribe community

Application Process: Online application through Samarth Portal. Registration and login required. Fill in the application form, upload mandatory documents, and submit.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a scholarship of ₹1,230 per month for boys and ₹1,270 per month for girls for 10 months. The scheme benefits students from De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic tribes studying in local educational institutions.
Ministries/Departments: Department of De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Welfare, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a student belonging to the De-Notified, Nomadic, or Semi-Nomadic tribes. 2. The applicant should be studying in a local educational institution. 3. The applicant should apply for admission before the new academic session. 4. The applicant should secure a vacant seat, as new admissions depend on availability. 5. The applicant should have a higher percentage in the last passed examination for priority admission.
Tags: Education, Hostel, Nomadic, Student, Ashram
Scheme Name: Free Caste Hostel (De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Communities)
Target Beneficiaries: Students from De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic tribes studying in local educational institutions

Application Process: Online application, selection process takes 6 weeks, rolling advertisement on UGC website
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹ 10,00,000/- to 132 selected candidates, fellowship amount of ₹ 43,800/- pm for I year, ₹ 45,000/- pm for II year, ₹ 46,500/- pm for III year, contingency grant of ₹ 1,00,000/- p.a., HRA, and medical facilities
Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Education
Eligibility Criteria: PhD degree in relevant subject, unemployed, upper age limit of 35 years with relaxation for SC/ST/OBC/Women candidates
Tags: PhD, Post Doctoral, Science, Fellowship, Unemployed, Research
Scheme Name: Dr. D.S. Kothari Post Doctoral Fellowships In Sciences
Target Beneficiaries: Unemployed PhD holders in Science faculty, preferably below 35 years of age

Application Process: Offline application process involving online registration, filling of necessary details, uploading of required documents, payment of application fees, and submission of hard copy of the application form to the COE (Agri. Edn.) by post.
Description & Benefits: ICAR awards a certain number of Junior Research Fellowships for Postgraduate Studies (course and research work) leading to a Master’s degree, in different disciplines of agriculture and allied sciences. The duration of the fellowship is two years. The benefits include ₹ 12,000/- per month With a contingency grant of ₹ 6,000/- per annum for Veterinary Sciences, and ₹ 8,640/- per month With a contingency grant of ₹ 6,000/- per annum for All disciplines other than Veterinary Sciences.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Eligibility Criteria: Candidates having passed their Bachelor’s Degree or appearing at the Final Examination of the Bachelor’s Degree in the concerned field, under 10+2+5, 10+2+4 or 10+2+3 (only for basic science subjects) with minimum 60% marks or an Overall Grade Point Average (OGPA) of 6.60/10.00 or 3.25/5.00 or 2.6/4.00 for General, OBC, and Under Privileged States(UPS) categories, and 55% marks or an OGPA of 5.5/10.00 or 2.75/5.00 or 2.20/4.00 for SC/ST/Physically Handicapped (PH) categories
Tags: Agricultural Education, Agricultural Science, Agriculture, Fellowship, Post-graduate, Research
Scheme Name: ICAR Junior Research Fellowship For Post-Graduate Studies In Agricultural Sciences
Target Beneficiaries: Talented students pursuing higher agricultural education

Application Process: Online application process through the portal. Registration, login, and filling of the Common Application Form are required. The application process involves selecting the scheme, filling in application details, and uploading required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to startups to enroll and participate in nationally or internationally recognized acceleration programs. This initiative is designed to support innovative projects across all sectors, enabling startups to access advanced resources, mentorship, and opportunities for growth. Financial support of up to ₹3,00,000/- is provided to participate in acceleration programs.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Any individual or group of individuals with an innovative idea or concept, recommended by an approved Nodal Institution, is eligible. The scheme is open to startups in any sector or branch of science, technology, engineering, agriculture, healthcare, etc.
Tags: Startups, Innovation, Acceleration Program, Entrepreneurship, Gujarat Industrial Policy
Scheme Name: Scheme for assistance for Start Ups/ Innovation: Assistance to Enroll and Participate for Acceleration Program
Target Beneficiaries: Startups with innovative ideas or concepts

Application Process: Offline application process: Step 1: Take a print of the prescribed application form. Step 2: Fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with documents at the empanelled ITKCs Centre.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to create a large pool of computer literate manpower, enabling citizens for quality job opportunities in IT Software/IT enabled services including BPO. It provides various Job-oriented IT Training courses, including training for BPO Operations/ Call Center Executives.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communication, Government of Goa
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be from a Schedule Tribe (ST) or Schedule Caste (SC) Community.
Tags: ICT Tools, IT Knowledge Centre, Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Computer Literacy, Job Opportunities, IT Software, BPO, Goa
Scheme Name: Empower ST/SC Communities using ICT Tools through IT Knowledge Centre (ITKC)
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribe (ST) or Schedule Caste (SC) Community

Application Process: Online application process through Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP). Registration, post-registration, and helpdesk processes are described in the application process section.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial relief to developers who have paid Stamp Duty on the purchase of land required for a new unit/project. The scheme is aimed at promoting new developments by reducing the financial burden on eligible projects during their establishment phase.
Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Only new units/projects are eligible for this reimbursement. Developer is eligible for reimbursement of the Stamp Duty paid on the purchase of required land for the project during the operative period of the scheme.
Tags: Logistics Facilities, Reimbursement, Stamp Duty, Gujarat Integrated Logistics and Logistics Park Policy
Scheme Name: Scheme for Financial Assistance to Integrated Logistics Facilities: Reimbursement of Stamp Duty
Target Beneficiaries: Private developers for developing Logistics Facilities and Logistics Park

Description & Benefits: The scheme supports MSME sick industrial enterprises by reimbursing part of the costs for preparing a diagnostic report and rehabilitation plan, with a reimbursement of 50% of the cost for preparing the Draft Rehabilitation Scheme, up to a maximum of ₹1,00,000/-.

Description & Benefits: Scholarships including admission fees, tuition fees, and maintenance allowance ranging from ₹230 to ₹1,200 per month

Eligibility Criteria: 1. Belong to minority community, 2. Secured minimum 50% marks in previous final examination, 3. Family annual income not exceeding ₹2,00,000, 4. Regular student in government or private higher secondary school/college/university, 5. Not availing of any other scholarship for the same purpose

Submit the application form to the JHASCOFISH office. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the JHASCOFISH office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to support fishermen cooperatives in Jharkhand by providing financial aid, technical support, and welfare measures to enhance fish production and improve socio-economic conditions. Benefits include financial aid, administrative support, infrastructure development, marketing support, fishermen welfare, and new vehicle purchase.

Societies with pending legal cases or misuse of prior funds are not eligible.

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the Head of the Institution and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents within the prescribed period.

Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to empower widowed women by offering financial support, ensuring they achieve self-reliance and dignity. Eligible beneficiaries receive a monthly pension of ₹1,250/- directly deposited into their Post Office accounts.

Application Process: Offline and Online application process: 1. Visit the district labor office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the district labor office. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the district labor office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to identify and support migrant workers from the state and ensures social security, rehabilitation, and welfare for migrant workers and their families. Financial, healthcare, and livelihood support are provided under the scheme.

The worker should belong to economically weaker sections (EWS).
