Application Process: Online application process through the official website, involving registration, filling out the application form, uploading required documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of up to ₹10,00,000/- to promote entrepreneurship and self-employment among individuals from all categories in the state.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries, Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be a permanent resident of Bihar, belong to Extremely Backward Classes, aged between 18 and 50 years, and have passed at least 10+2, Intermediate, ITI, Polytechnic Diploma, or equivalent.
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, Extremely Backward Class, Self Employment, Youth
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Ati Pichhada Varg Udyami Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Individuals from Extremely Backward Classes in Bihar

Application Process: Online application process through the official website, involving registration, filling out the application form, uploading required documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of up to ₹10,00,000/- (50% as a non-repayable grant and 50% as an interest-free loan) to promote entrepreneurship and self-employment among individuals from Minority communities in Bihar.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries, Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be a permanent resident of Bihar, belong to Minority community, be aged between 18 and 50 years, and meet educational qualifications (10+2, Intermediate, ITI, Polytechnic Diploma, or equivalent)
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, Minority, Self Employment, Youth
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Alpasankhyak Udyami Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Individuals from Minority communities in Bihar

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the Block Office, District Welfare Office, or Project Director (ITDA) Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Block Office, District Welfare Office, or Project Director (ITDA) Office. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for medical treatment to eligible beneficiaries, providing monetary support to alleviate financial burdens caused by illnesses, surgeries, or other medical needs. The grant amount varies depending on the type of illness, surgery, or treatment, and the age of the beneficiary.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand. 2. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, or Backward Class categories. 3. The applicant must be suffering from the illness or surgery. 4. Applicants already availing financial assistance from other government schemes are ineligible. 5. The applicant must be a holder of one of the following ration cards: Priority Household Ration Card (PHH), Antyodaya Ration Card, or Green Card
Tags: Financial Assistance, Health, Rural, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Backward Class, Jharkhand
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Swasthya Sahayata Yojana Jharkhand
Target Beneficiaries: SC/ST/OBC residents of Jharkhand with a Priority, Antyodaya, or Green Ration Card

Application Process: Online and offline application process through the official website, registration, login, and submission of application form with required documents
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote self-employment and entrepreneurship by providing subsidized loans and financial assistance, including a subsidy of 40% of the loan amount or up to ₹5,00,000, whichever is lower, loan guarantee facility, low interest rate of 6%, and entrepreneurship development training
Ministries/Departments: Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant's age should be between 18 to 50 years, permanent resident of Jharkhand, annual family income should not exceed ₹5,00,000/- for rural and urban areas, not employed in any government or semi-government job, not a loan defaulter in any bank, only environment-friendly business proposals are acceptable, and if disabled, the percentage of disability should not be less than 40%
Tags: Entrepreneurship, Financial Assistance, Loan, Self-employment
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Rojgaar Srijan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribes (ST), Scheduled Castes (SC), Minorities, Backward Classes, and Persons with Disabilities (PwDs)

Application Process: Offline application process. The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website, fills in all the mandatory fields, attaches copies of all the mandatory documents, and submits the application form to the District Sports Officer.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide cash awards to coaches who train athletes and teams to achieve excellence in national and international competitions under the Jharkhand Sports Policy, 2022. Cash rewards are provided to encourage and sustain their contribution to sports development.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a coach who trains medal-winning athletes/teams participating in competitions recognized by the International or Indian Olympic Association. The applicant must have coached athletes/teams representing Jharkhand or India for at least four years. The medal-winning athletes must have competed in recognized competitions for the coach to qualify.
Tags: Athletes, Award, Coaches, Financial Assistance, International, National, Sports Development
Scheme Name: Jharkhand Sports Excellence Cash Award Scheme to Coaches
Target Beneficiaries: Coaches who train athletes and teams to achieve excellence in national and international competitions

Application Process: Offline application process involving visiting the concerned office of the District Officer or Committee, collecting and filling the application form, attaching mandatory documents, and submitting the complete application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide social security through financial assistance to workers and artisans in the unorganized sector in Bihar. Financial assistance of ₹37,500/- is provided in case of permanent partial disablement.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Resources Department, Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Bihar state, work as a worker or craftsman in the unorganized sector within Bihar, and be aged between 18 and 65 years.
Tags: Social Security, Unorganised Worker, Craftsmen, Permanent Partial Disability
Scheme Name: Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana: Permanent Partial Disability
Target Beneficiaries: Workers and artisans in the unorganized sector

Application Process: Online and Offline application through the Shram Seva Portal (MPBOCWWB) official website, with steps including registration, filling out the form, uploading necessary documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme offers free skill training to construction workers and their dependents, enhancing their skills and employability.
Ministries/Departments: Building and Other Construction Workers Board, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh, a Building/ Construction Worker, between 18 and 60 years, engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days during the preceding 12 months, and registered Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Madhya Pradesh.
Tags: Skill Training, Construction Workers, Madhya Pradesh, Education, Welfare Scheme
Scheme Name: Labour Skill Training Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Construction workers aged 18-45 years and their dependents aged 16-45 years

Application Process: Offline and Online. Step 1: Visit Commissioner Municipal Corporation / Chief Municipal Officer Nagar palika / Nagar Panchayat and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. Step 2: Fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period, if any.
Description & Benefits: Provides ₹1,00,000 in assistance to eligible urban construction workers, along with Central and State Government grants. Supports workers eligible under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Govt. of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Resident of Madhya Pradesh, 2. Building/ Construction Worker, 3. Between 18 and 60 years, 4. Engaged in building or other construction work for at least 90 days during the preceding 12 months, 5. Registration of the applicant should be renewed annually.
Tags: Construction, Financial Assistance, Housing, Labour, Urban, Worker
Scheme Name: Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Urban Housing Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Urban construction workers

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Obtain the application form from the Tribal Affairs Department Headquarters, Bhopal. 2. Fill in the form, attach required documents, and submit it within the prescribed period.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides scholarships to Scheduled Tribe students for pursuing higher education abroad, covering tuition fees of 40,000 US Dollars per year, along with a living allowance of 9,000 US Dollars and a contingency allowance of 1,000 US Dollars.
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Age: 35 years old as of 1st January. 2. Annual income limit: ₹10 lakhs. 3. Educational qualifications: Graduation with at least 55% marks for postgraduate studies, and postgraduate with at least 50% marks for Ph.D.
Tags: Higher Education, Scheduled Tribe, Scholarships, Abroad
Scheme Name: Study Abroad Scholarships (Scheduled Tribe)
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribe students

Application Process: Online application through national scholarship portal and JKBOCWWB website
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides annual financial assistance of ₹1,200 per child (up to two children) for the education of registered BOC workers' children through the national scholarship portal.
Ministries/Departments: Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: One of the student's parents must be a registered member of the Building and Other Construction Workers (BOC) Welfare Board. The applicant must be studying in classes 9th to 12th.
Tags: Construction, Education, Labour, Scholarship, Worker
Scheme Name: Workers for Class 9th to 12th Through National Scholarship (JKBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Children of registered Building and Other Construction (BOC) workers studying in classes 9th to 12th

Application Process: Offline and Online. The interested applicant should visit the Public Service Center/District Panchayat/Urban Body Office and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned authority. Fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the authority.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides funeral assistance and ex-gratia payment to the heir of a worker in the event of their death. It also offers ex-gratia in case of permanent or partial temporary disability of a registered worker due to an accident.
Ministries/Departments: Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MPBOCWWB), Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The construction worker must have passed away while he/she was registered with the Madhya Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MPBOCWWB) when he/she died. 2. The construction worker must have passed away while he/she held an active regular membership with the MPBOCWWB. 3. Only the legal heir or dependent family member of the deceased registered worker is eligible to apply for benefits under the scheme. 4. The construction worker must have passed away while he/she had a valid identity card.
Tags: Accident, Construction, Death, Disability, Funeral, Worker
Scheme Name: Death Assistance Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Legal heir or dependent family member of a registered construction worker

Application Process: Offline application process involving printing and filling of the prescribed application form, attaching mandatory documents, and submitting it to the Head of the Institution of the respective school.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides scholarships to students in standards 6 to 10, mitigating the risk of dropouts due to financial constraints. The scholarship amount is ₹50 per month per student for standards 6 to 8 and ₹75 per month per student for standards 9 & 10.
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of School Education, Union Territory of Puducherry
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India, a native of the Union Territory of Puducherry by birth or by continuous residence for not less than five years, studying from standard 6 to 10, belonging to the Other Economically Backward Class (OEBC), and having a family income not exceeding ₹75,000 per annum.
Tags: Education, Scholarship, School, Student, OEBC
Scheme Name: Award of Pre-Matric Scholarship to Other Economically Backward Class (OEBC) Students
Target Beneficiaries: OEBC students in standards 6 to 10

Application Process: Online application through Chevening website, complete online registration form, pass eligibility checker, make a note of access code, complete each section of the application form, submit application
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to deserving students for pursuing postgraduate education in top-ranked universities abroad, covers tuition fees, living expenses, travel, and other academic-related costs
Ministries/Departments: Department of Welfare of Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities and Backward Classes, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Jharkhand state, belongs to Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities, or Backward Classes, maximum age 35 years, holds a bachelor's degree, outstanding academic performance, admission offer from a top 100 globally ranked university or a UK university listed in Annexure-A
Tags: Scholarship, Overseas Education, Financial Assistance, Jharkhand Government
Scheme Name: Marang Gomke Jaipal Singh Munda Overseas Scholarship Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities, and Backward Class students

Application Process: Offline application process: Step 1: Fill in all the mandatory fields in the application form and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 2: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Block Development Officer in rural areas and the concerned Zonal Officer in urban areas.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to severely disabled and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 and above who are living below the poverty line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life. Eligible beneficiaries will receive a monthly pension of ₹1000/- (Central contribution- ₹300/-, State Contribution- ₹700/-).
Ministries/Departments: Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The age of the applicant should be 18 years or above. 2. The applicant's name should be included in the list of families living Below Poverty Line. 3. The applicant should be suffering from severe or multiple disabilities. 4. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits from any other Central or State Government pension scheme.
Tags: Disability Pension, Financial Assistance, Jharkhand, Poverty Line, Severe Disability, Multiple Disabilities
Scheme Name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme - Jharkhand
Target Beneficiaries: Severely disabled and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 and above who are living below the poverty line (BPL)

Application Process: Offline application process involving collecting the application form, filling in all mandatory fields, attaching required documents, and submitting the application to the concerned authority.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides free sewing machines to support individuals from Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNCs) engaged in tailoring work, aiming to improve their livelihood opportunities.
Ministries/Departments: Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu, belong to Backward Classes (BC)/ Most Backward Classes (MBC)/ and Denotified Communities (DNCs), possess tailoring knowledge, have an annual income not exceeding ₹40,000/- in rural areas and ₹60,000/- in urban areas, and be between 20-45 years of age.
Tags: Sewing Machines, Free of Cost, Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes, Denotified Communities, Tamil Nadu, Social Empowerment
Scheme Name: Distribution of Sewing Machines at Free of Cost
Target Beneficiaries: Individuals from Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNCs) engaged in tailoring work

Application Process: Online application through the official website, with DBT registration required prior to application. The application process involves 7 steps, including registration, filling in required details, uploading documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to encourage farmers to cultivate identified seed spices like coriander and fenugreek due to their medicinal and nutritional properties. Farmers are eligible for a 50% subsidy on the unit cost of ₹30,000/- per hectare and access to high-quality certified or verified seeds.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Agriculture, Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar, a farmer, have agricultural land a minimum of 0.25 acres (0.1 ha) and a maximum of 10 acres (4 ha), and be registered on the DBT portal.
Tags: Agriculture, Financial Assistance, Seed Supply, Spice Farming, Spice Seed, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Beej Masaale Ki Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers

Application Process: Online application process: 1. Visit the official website of the Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka. 2. Click on 'Incentives for Marriage' and select the 'Incentives to Intra-Caste Marriage' scheme. 3. Fill in the online registration form and upload required documents. 4. Review and submit the form. 5. Print the acknowledgement form for future reference.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an incentive of ₹2,00,000/- to couples who are both from the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community but belong to different sub-castes within the ST community.
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The couple should be residing in Karnataka. 2. Both the partners should be from the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community but from different sub-castes. 3. The combined annual income of the couple must be less than ₹2,00,000/-. 4. The couple must apply to this scheme within one year of their marriage. 5. The marriage should have taken place on or after 1st April 2018.
Tags: Incentive, Intra Caste, Marriage, Scheduled Tribe, ST, Karnataka
Scheme Name: Incentive For The Intra Caste Marriage within Scheduled Tribe Community
Target Beneficiaries: Couples who are both from the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community but belong to different sub-castes within the ST community

Application Process: Online application through DBT portal and official website. Registration process involves Aadhaar verification, filling in farmer details, land information, and bank account details. After registration, applicants can apply for the scheme with the help of 13 digit registration number.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a 50% subsidy for up to 4 hectares of marigold flower cultivation. Financial Assistance: 50% subsidy on ₹80,000/- per hectare for marigold cultivation.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Agriculture, Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Bihar. 2. The applicant should be a farmer. 3. The applicant must have agricultural land a minimum of 0.25 acres (0.1 ha) and a maximum of 10 acres (4 ha). 4. The applicant must be registered on the DBT portal Agriculture Department.
Tags: Agriculture, Financial Assistance, Flower Development, Plant Supply, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Phool Vikash Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers in 15 districts of Bihar

Application Process: Online application through the official website, with steps including DBT registration, filling in required details, uploading documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides training to farmers and grants for traditional equipment used in Makhana cultivation and processing, with the goal of boosting Makhana cultivation and productivity in 10 designated districts of Bihar.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Agriculture, Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a farmer, belong to one of the 10 designated districts of Bihar, have agricultural land between 0.25 acres and 10 acres, and be registered on the DBT portal.
Tags: Agriculture, Financial Assistance, Makhana Development, Seed Supply, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Makhana Vikas Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers in 10 designated districts of Bihar

Application Process: Automatic Enrollment: The scheme benefits are automatically applied to eligible consumers through the billing system.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial relief to domestic consumers by subsidizing their electricity bills, reducing their energy expenses. The subsidy is automatically applied through the billing system.
Ministries/Departments: Energy Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh, a domestic consumer with a monthly electricity consumption of up to 150 units, and have an approved load of 1 kilowatt for their electricity connection.
Tags: Bill Reduction, Domestic Consumers, Electricity, Energy Subsidy
Scheme Name: Atal Graha Jyoti Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Domestic consumers with low energy consumption

Application Process: Online application through eDistrict 2.0 portal
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides one-time financial aid to beneficiaries to ease the cost of their children's (maximum two) education. The scheme is structured to provide assistance based on the level of education. The benefits are: Higher Secondary/ Diploma: ₹4,000/-. Graduation/ Diploma: ₹6,000/-. Post-Graduation: ₹10,000/-. Engineering/ Medical: ₹30,000/-.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, West Bengal
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be between 18 and 60 years of age at the time of enrolment. 2. The applicant must be an unorganized worker employed in the operation of commercial vehicles, such as cars, taxis, luxury taxis, light commercial vehicles, vans, auto-rickshaws, tempos, lorries, trucks, or buses. 3. The applicant’s vehicle must be used for commercial purposes and not solely for personal or family use.
Tags: Education, Scholarship, Social Security, Transport Worker
Scheme Name: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Assistance for Education of Children
Target Beneficiaries: Registered beneficiaries whose children are pursuing higher secondary, graduation, post-graduation, or professional courses in engineering or medical fields

Application Process: Offline application process involving filling and submitting a prescribed application form along with required documents to the concerned authority, followed by online registration and application submission through the Madhya Pradesh Shiksha Portal.
Description & Benefits: This scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Caste students, offering ₹200 per year for boys and ₹600 per year for girls, to support their education.
Ministries/Departments: Scheduled Caste Welfare Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The student should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh
2. The student should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.
3. The student should be enrolled in classes 6th to 10th in a recognized educational institution..
4. The student should apply for the scholarship before the 31st of October.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Scheduled Castes, Scholarships, Student
Scheme Name: State Scholarship of Class 6th to 10th (Scheduled Caste)
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste students

Application Process: Online application through State Scholarship Portal 2.0, Madhya Pradesh. Registration and login are required to apply for the scheme.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides reimbursement of scholarship fees to students in Class 11th and 12th. It aims to encourage students from the Scheduled Caste category in the field of education and provide them with financial assistance.
Ministries/Departments: Scheduled Caste Welfare Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 2. The student should be enrolled in Class 11th or 12th in a recognized educational institution. 3. The student should provide a valid income certificate of the family, confirming that the annual income is below the prescribed limit. 4. The guardian should provide a declaration stating that there has been no increase in the family income for the last financial year.
Tags: Education, Scheduled Castes, Scholarships, Student
Scheme Name: Post Matric Students of Class 11th & 12th (Scheduled Caste)
Target Beneficiaries: Students from the Scheduled Caste category studying in Class 11th and 12th

Application Process: Online application through the eDistrict 2.0 portal, with steps including registration, login, and submission of required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance up-to ₹20,000/- for the treatment of beneficiaries or their family members suffering from major ailments, and up to ₹60,000/- for major surgery.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, West Bengal
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be between 18 and 60 years of age at the time of enrolment, an unorganized worker employed in the operation of commercial vehicles, and a resident of West Bengal state.
Tags: Health & Wellness, Major Ailments, Medical Benefit, Social Security, Transport Worker
Scheme Name: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Medical Benefit for Major Ailments
Target Beneficiaries: Transport workers and their families dealing with severe health conditions

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form with required documents to the Office of the Collector/Tahsildar/Talathi
Description & Benefits: Provides insurance and scholarship benefits to landless laborers in rural areas, including natural death benefit, accidental death benefit, permanent total disability benefit, loss of two eyes or two limbs benefit, loss of one eye or one limb benefit, and scholarship benefit for children
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice & Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Resident of Maharashtra, 2. Age between 18 and 59 years, 3. Landless labourer, 4. Residing in a rural area, 5. Family does not own any agricultural land, 6. Not covered under any other similar insurance scheme
Tags: Insurance, Scholarship, Landless Laborers, Rural Areas, Maharashtra
Scheme Name: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana (Maharashtra)
Target Beneficiaries: Landless laborers in rural areas, aged 18 to 59 years

Application Process: Online and offline applications are accepted. The applicant needs to register on the official website, log in, and apply for the scheme by providing required information and uploading necessary documents.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- is provided to the nominee or dependents in the event of natural death of a registered BOC worker.
Ministries/Departments: Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a nominee/dependent of a registered member/worker who has deceased due to natural causes.
Tags: Construction, Death, Financial Assistance, Labour, Worker
Scheme Name: Registered Construction Worker in case of his/her Natural Death (JKBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Nominee or dependents of a registered construction worker

Application Process: Offline application process: Collect application form from District Central Cooperative Banks or its branches, fill in all mandatory fields, attach required documents, and submit to the concerned authority.
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to citizens for housing construction, repair, and extension. The maximum loan amount offered is ₹10,00,000/- with an interest rate of 12% (subject to change).
Ministries/Departments: Co-operation, Food and Consumer Protection Department, Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu. Loans should be applicable only for Housing/ House Construction/ Repair Extension.
Tags: Housing, House Construction, Repair Extension, Loan, Tamil Nadu
Scheme Name: District Central Cooperative Banks and through its Branches: For Housing, House Construction, Repair Extension Loan
Target Beneficiaries: Citizens of Tamil Nadu

Application Process: Offline application submission to the office of Bihar State AIDS Control Society
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹1,500/- per month to AIDS patients in the state.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Bihar. 2. The applicant should be an AIDS patient. 3. The applicant should be 18 years of age or older.
Tags: AIDS, Financial Assistance, Bihar
Scheme Name: Bihar Shatabdi AIDS Pirit Kalyan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: AIDS patients

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form with mandatory documents to the District Welfare Officer
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to women to start small businesses or trades. This scheme encourages women to become self-reliant and supports their efforts in establishing small-scale industries or trade ventures, thereby improving their economic status and promoting self-employment opportunities across the state. Financial Assistance of ₹5,000/- is provided to women to help them start small businesses or trade activities.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Himachal Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a woman, set up their own business trade, and small industry to earn their livelihood. The applicant's annual income does not exceed ₹35,000/-.
Tags: Business, Financial Assistance, Self-Employment, Women
Scheme Name: Women Self Employment Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Women and physically handicapped individuals

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: 1. Obtain the application form from the District Social Welfare Office. 2. Fill in the application form, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority.
Description & Benefits: The scheme offers 100% government-funded tin stalls and provides ₹500/- as financial assistance to help protect them from heat, rain, and wind.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance of the Government of Maharashtra
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be from a Scheduled Caste. 2. The applicant should be a resident of Maharashtra. 3. If the applicant resides in a rural area, his/her total household income should be less than ₹40,000. 4. If the applicant resides in an urban area, his/her total household income should be less than ₹50,000. 5. The applicant should be 18 years or above in age. 6. The place where the applicant asking for the stall must be provided on rent/ lease/purchased/official free hand by Gram panchayat, Municipality, Cantonment Board or Municipal corporation or must be of own property of the applicant.
Tags: Employment, SC, Scheduled Caste, Social Welfare, Stall
Scheme Name: Providing Tin Stalls to Gatai Kamgar
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste individuals engaged in leather footwear production and leather goods preparation

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form and documents to the District Office of LIDCOM.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides loans ranging from ₹25,000/- to ₹50,000/- at a low interest rate of 4% per annum to uplift economically weaker women from the Charmakar Community, focusing on educational, economic, and social development.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a female. 2. The applicant should belong to the Charmakar Community. 3. The applicant's age should be between 18 and 50 years. 4. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Maharashtra. 5. The applicant must have knowledge of the business for which the loan is being applied. 6. For the 50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, the applicant's annual income must be below the poverty line. 7. For the NSFDC Scheme, the applicant's annual income should be below ₹98,000 for rural areas and ₹1,20,000 for urban areas.
Tags: Women Empowerment, Charmakar Community, Maharashtra, Loan Scheme, Economic Development
Scheme Name: Mahila Samridhi Yojana (Maharashtra)
Target Beneficiaries: Economically weaker women from the Charmakar Community, especially widows and divorcees

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form and documents at the District Office of the Leather Industries Development Corporation of Maharashtra (LIDCOM)
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance ranging from ₹25,000 to ₹50,000 to invest in income-generating activities, low interest rate of 5% per annum, ₹10,000 provided as a subsidy to reduce the financial burden
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance of the Government of Maharashtra
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Belong to the Charmakar Community, 2. Between 18 to 50 years of age, 3. Permanent resident of Maharashtra, 4. Below Poverty Line (BPL) category, 5. Income and Caste Certificate from an authorized government officer, 6. Knowledge of the business for which they are applying for the loan, 7. Annual income below the poverty line
Tags: Credit, Employment, Financial Assistance, Below Poverty Line, BPL, Charmakar Community
Scheme Name: Micro Credit Finance
