Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Submit the duly filled and signed application in the prescribed format along with required attachments at the Right to Public Service (RTPS) counter located at the block office level. 2. Receive an acknowledgment receipt from the RTPS counter. 3. Applicants will be notified of the application's approval or rejection via SMS or email. 4. If approved, collect the Sanction Order from the same RTPS counter where the application was submitted, upon presenting the acknowledgment receipt and a valid identity card.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a monthly pension to elderly people to support them financially. Beneficiaries aged 60 to 79 years receive ₹400 per month, while those aged 80 years or above receive ₹500 per month.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant (Woman/Man) should be a resident of Bihar. 2. The applicant should be a senior citizen. 3. The applicant should be 60 years of age or older. 4. The applicant should belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family. 5. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits under any social security scheme.
Tags: BPL, Indira Gandhi, Old Age, Pension, Senior Citizen
Scheme Name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme- Bihar
Target Beneficiaries: Elderly people (women/men) aged 60 years or above belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families

Application Process: Offline application submission to the office of Bihar State AIDS Control Society
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹1,500/- per month to AIDS patients in the state.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Bihar. 2. The applicant should be an AIDS patient. 3. The applicant should be 18 years of age or older.
Tags: AIDS, Financial Assistance, Bihar
Scheme Name: Bihar Shatabdi AIDS Pirit Kalyan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: AIDS patients

Application Process: Offline application on plain paper along with required documents to the office of the Sub-Divisional Officer.
Description & Benefits: A one-time grant of ₹20,000/- is provided to the family or close relative of the deceased person. The scheme provides social security to the immediate dependents of the deceased by providing them financial assistance after the sudden death of a member of a poor family in the state.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar, a family member or dependent of the deceased, and the deceased should have died in an accident or a criminal incident (if aged 18-60 years). The deceased should belong to a poor family.
Tags: Death, Family, Financial Assistance, Accident, Criminal Incident, Suicide, Poor Family, Social Security
Scheme Name: Chief Minister Family Benefit Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Immediate dependents of the deceased person from a poor family in Bihar

Application Process: Offline. Beneficiaries should register their names at their nearest Anganwadi Center.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to create a distinct identity for Anganwadi Centre children and bring a sense of uniformity and social harmony among the children. Under this scheme, a cash amount of ₹400/- per child per year is provided for uniforms to all eligible children.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The beneficiary should be a resident of Bihar. 2. The beneficiary should be a child. 3. The beneficiary should be between 3 and 6 years of age. 4. The beneficiary should be enrolled at an Anganwadi Centre. 5. The beneficiary should be receiving pre-school education at the Anganwadi Centre.
Tags: Anganwadi, Pre-school, Uniform, Education, Bihar
Scheme Name: Samekit Baal Vikas Chhtra Yojana: Dress for Pre-school Children
Target Beneficiaries: Children aged 3 to 6 years who are receiving pre-school education at Anganwadi Centres

Application Process: Online application through E-kalyan Portal
Description & Benefits: Under this scheme, students from minority communities who are studying and residing in hostels run by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Bihar, will receive a monthly stipend of ₹1,000/-, provision of essential facilities such as cots, mattresses, bed sheets, tables, chairs for studying, as well as cooking utensils and kitchen facilities, and monthly distribution of 9 kg of rice and 6 kg of wheat to each student.
Ministries/Departments: Minority Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Bihar. 2. The applicant should be a student. 3. The student should belong to a minority community. 4. The student should be enrolled in a recognized institution, school, college, university, or technical institution in their respective district. 5. The student should be pursuing a course that is recognized by the Government. 6. The student should reside in a hostel operated by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Bihar, while pursuing their studies.
Tags: Minority Community, Stipend, Student, Hostel, Education
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Alpsankhyak Chhatravas Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Students belonging to minority communities

Application Process: Online application through the official website of the department. Registration and login are required to submit the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides 50% of the pension amount or a maximum of ₹ 500/- to the family members of the deceased pensioner.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development, Govt. of Jharkhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a family member or dependent of the deceased pensioner. 2. The deceased pensioner should have been a resident of Jharkhand. 3. The deceased pensioner should have been receiving a pension from the Jharkhand Building and Other Construction Worker Welfare Board at the time of their death.
Tags: Construction Worker, Family, Pension, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: Parivaar Pension Yojana (JBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Family members of deceased pensioners

Application Process: Online application has to be submitted by the beneficiary on Board's Online Portal in the prescribed format. Approval and selection of the candidate will be done by the senior-most officer of the labour office or the competent authority appointed by the secretary after the application has been examined.
Description & Benefits: The purpose of this scheme is to encourage registered beneficiaries employed in building and other construction works and their children to participate in international sports. The incentive amount under this scheme for International level sports competition to the eligible beneficiary or his children will be given as follows: - Participating in the competition- ₹ 2,00,000/-, On receiving the Bronze medal- ₹5,00,000/-, On receiving the Silver medal- ₹8,00,000/-, On receiving the Gold medal- ₹11,00,000/-
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Rajasthan
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan State. 2. For this scheme, those construction workers will be eligible, who are registered as labour under labour law. 3. Those building and other construction workers will be eligible who are registered as beneficiaries in the board under Section-12 of The Building and Other Construction Workers (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1996 and are depositing their contribution regularly. 4. In addition to the above, unmarried sons and daughters of construction workers will also be eligible for assistance under the scheme.
Tags: Construction Worker, International Sports, Participation, Sports Scheme
Scheme Name: Nirman Shramik Antrashtriya Khel Pratiyogiyo Hetu Protsahan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Registered beneficiaries employed in building and other construction works and their children

Application Process: Online application through the official website of Karnataka Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (KBOCWWB). The application process involves registration, login, filling in mandatory details, uploading required documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered construction workers and their dependents for medical expenses related to specified major ailments. Eligible applicants can receive up to ₹2,00,000/- for medical expenses, subject to the rates prescribed under the Central Government Health Service (CGHS).
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Karnataka
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a registered construction worker Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka or his/her dependents. The worker or their dependents must suffer from a major ailment specified in the scheme.
Tags: Medical Assistance, Labour, Construction Worker, Building Worker, Ailments
Scheme Name: Assistance For Major Ailments (Karmika Chikitsa Bhagya) (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers and their dependents

Application Process: Online application process through the official website of Karnataka Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (KBOCWWB)
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial support to registered construction workers in the form of pension who are partially disabled due to accidents or diseases incurred at their worksite. Beneficiaries may receive an ex-gratia payment depending on the extent of their disability. The pension is discontinued upon the beneficiary reaching sixty (60) years of age.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Karnataka
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a registered construction worker Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka, partially disabled due to worksite accidents or diseases, and not have availed “Accident Benefits” for the same disability, and must be below sixty (60) years of age.
Tags: Disability, Pension, Ex-Gratia, Labour, Karnataka
Scheme Name: Disability Pension and Ex-Gratia (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers who are partially disabled due to accidents or diseases incurred at their worksite

Application Process: Offline application submission to the Joint Director/Deputy Director at the District Office of the Panchayat and Social Welfare Department
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides artificial limbs/assistive devices worth up to ₹6,900/- to persons with disabilities, aiming to increase their mobility and reduce the impact of their disabilities
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department of the Government of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Resident of Chhattisgarh, 2. Disability of 40% or more, 3. Possess a Disability Certificate or UDID Card, 4. Monthly income not exceeding ₹8,000/-, 5. Either a member of a BPL family or have a recommendation from the Collector or Sub-Divisional Officer (Revenue)
Tags: Artificial Limbs, Assistive Devices, Disability, BPL, PwD
Scheme Name: Artificial Limbs and Assistive Devices Supply Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Persons with disabilities of 40% or more

Application Process: Online - via CSCs, Offline - through nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides full course fees, boarding and lodging assistance to the registered workers who acquire Skill from technical institutions such as ITIs /Polytechnic colleges etc.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Punjab, a Building/ Construction Worker (Unorganised Worker), between 18 and 60 years, have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, have a monthly income of ₹15,000/- or below, not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law, not have membership of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF)/ National Pension System (NPS)/ Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC), and not be an income tax payer.
Tags: Skill Upgradation, Vocational Education, Building Worker, Construction Worker, Labour
Scheme Name: Skill Upgradation and Vocational Education Scheme: For Worker (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered workers of the BOCW Welfare Board

Application Process: Online application through ServicePlus website and then visit the website of the ministry to apply for the scheme.
Description & Benefits: The Internship Program is specifically focusing on the ‘Office set-up of MoPR’. The selected candidates will receive a certificate of completion. The Internship Program, MoPR shall provide a flat rate/amount of Rs.7,000/- per month as ‘stipend’ to the ‘Intern’, depending on the best applicants.
Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Panchayati Raj
Eligibility Criteria: The applicants i.e., ‘Students’ are enrolled/pursuing Undergraduate/Graduate/Postgraduate degree programme or ‘Research Scholars’ enrolled/pursuing Doctoral (Ph.D.)/Post-Doctoral degree in recognised/reputed University(s)/Institution(s) or completed any of the mentioned course , within last 2 years from India or Abroad are eligible to apply for the Internship Program.
Tags: Internship, Research, Students, Rural Development, Policy and Action Research
Scheme Name: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan - Internship Program
Target Beneficiaries: Students enrolled/pursuing undergraduate, graduate, or postgraduate degree programs and 'Young Research Scholars' enrolled/pursuing Doctoral (Ph.D.) or post-doctoral degrees

Application Process: Offline application process involving downloading the application form, filling in the mandatory fields, attaching required documents, and submitting the application to the concerned officer in the labour department.
Description & Benefits: The scheme offers a 90-day non-residential skill development training programme specifically designed for unemployed girls and women who are dependents of registered construction workers. The programme focuses on imparting curtain and garment stitching skills, providing participants with the necessary tools and training to become self-reliant and enhance their employability. Benefits include gaining hands-on experience and technical skills in curtain and garment stitching, receiving a domestic sewing machine upon completion of the training, and enhancing employability.
Ministries/Departments: Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a woman. 2. The applicant should be a dependent of the registered construction worker. 3. The applicant's age should be 18 years or above. 4. The applicant must have completed at least the 5th class. 5. The applicant should have knowledge of Telugu, Hindi, and English language. 6. The applicant should be any one of the following: Unemployed Girls, Widowed, Divorced and Deserted Daughters, Spouse
Tags: Skill Development, Training, Women Empowerment, Self-employment, Sewing Machine, Construction Workers
Scheme Name: Skill Development Training - 90 Days Skill Development Training Programme in Curtain & Garment Stitching
Target Beneficiaries: Unemployed girls and women who are dependents of registered construction workers

Application Process: Online - via CSCs, Offline - through nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides ₹2000/- as Leave Travelling Concession (LTC) to eligible registered construction workers for journeys to religious/ historical places in India or visiting their hometown.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Punjab, a Building/ Construction Worker (Unorganised Worker), between 18 and 60 years, engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, with a monthly income of ₹15,000/- or below, and not a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.
Tags: Labour, Leave Travelling Concession, Construction Worker, Welfare Scheme
Scheme Name: Leave Travelling Concession Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers

Application Process: Online application through CSCs or by approaching the nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector of the area.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of a Fixed Deposit Receipt (FDR) for the birth of a female child, with a maximum of two girls per family. The FDR can be encashed only at the time of the daughter's marriage.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Punjab, a Building/ Construction Worker (Unorganised Worker), between 18 and 60 years, engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, with a monthly income of ₹15,000/- or below, and not a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.
Tags: Building Worker, Construction Worker, Fixed Deposit, Girls, Insurance, Labour
Scheme Name: Balri Birth Gift Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered workers of the BOCW Welfare Board

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form and required documents to the District Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to women to start small businesses or trades. This scheme encourages women to become self-reliant and supports their efforts in establishing small-scale industries or trade ventures, thereby improving their economic status and promoting self-employment opportunities across the state. Financial Assistance of ₹5,000/- provides women to help them start small businesses or trade activities.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Himachal Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a woman, set up their own business trade, and small industry to earn their livelihood. The applicant's annual income does not exceed ₹35,000/-. Physically handicapped individuals are also eligible to apply under this scheme.
Tags: Business, Financial Assistance, Self-Employment, Women
Scheme Name: Women Self Employment Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Women and physically handicapped individuals

Application Process: Online application through the official website of Chhattisgarh Labour Department. Steps: 1. Register as a construction worker under CBOCWWB. 2. Apply for the scheme by selecting the scheme and uploading required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered construction workers to buy tool kits. 10,000 tool kits are distributed annually to registered construction workers.
Ministries/Departments: Labor Department of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The Applicant must be a native of Chhattisgarh. 2. The beneficiary should be a construction worker. 3. The beneficiary should be registered under the Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board. 4. The age of the registered worker should not be less than 18 years.
Tags: Construction workers, Financial Assistance, Labour Tools, Chhattisgarh
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Shramik Aujaar Sahayata Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Construction workers

Application Process: Offline application through District Differently Abled Welfare Officer
Description & Benefits: Free distribution of Battery-Operated Wheelchairs to provide mobility assistance to individuals affected by Muscular Dystrophy and Tetraplegia
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be affected by Muscular Dystrophy or Tetraplegia
Tags: Social Welfare, Disability, Mobility Assistance
Scheme Name: Battery Operated Wheelchair by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department
Target Beneficiaries: Differently Abled Person, Muscular Dystrophy, Tetraplegia-affected persons

Application Process: Offline application process: Submit duly filled and signed application in prescribed format along with required attachments at the Right to Public Service (RTPS) counter located at the block office level
Description & Benefits: Provides social security to differently-abled individuals from poor families by offering them financial assistance in the form of a monthly pension of ₹400/-
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Resident of Bihar or residing in Bihar for at least 10 years, 2. Physically disabled, 3. Disability certificate with a minimum of 40% disability, 4. Not receiving pension benefits under any other social security scheme
Tags: Disability, Pension, PwD, Social Security
Scheme Name: Bihar Disability Pension Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled individuals from poor families

Application Process: Offline application process involves submitting Form-XXXIV with mandatory documents to the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to beneficiaries in case of hospitalization for 5 or more days and disability due to an accident. Benefits include up to ₹10,000/- for hospitalization, up to ₹50,000/- for disablement, ₹750/- per month for permanent disablement, and ₹375/- per month for family pension in case of death of a pension holder.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, West Bengal
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of West Bengal, a Building/ Construction Worker, between 18 and 60 years old, and have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.
Tags: Accidental Benefit, Building Worker, Construction Worker, Disability, Hospitalization, Labour, West Bengal
Scheme Name: Accidental Benefit
Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, West Bengal

Application Process: Offline. The application process involves advertisement issuance by the Directorate of Higher Education, application examination by the concerned Regional Additional Director, and approval and disbursement of the amount to the applicant's bank account.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides reimbursement for the fees charged for computer and management courses. Additionally, eligible students receive a subsistence allowance of ₹1,500/- per month and a transport allowance of ₹500/- per month if they are in Municipal Corporation areas and ₹300/- per month if they are in Municipal Council areas.
Ministries/Departments: Higher Education Department of the Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The applicant should be a disabled student. 3. The student should be studying a Computer or Management subject/course at a government college. 4. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category. 5. The annual income of the applicant's parents or guardians should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.
Tags: Computer, Disabled Student, Management, PwD, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Subsistence Allowance, Transport Allowance
Scheme Name: Subsistence and Transport Allowance to Disabled Students for Pursuing Education in Computer and Management
Target Beneficiaries: Disabled students pursuing computer or management courses at government colleges

Application Process: Offline application in the prescribed format to the office of the Joint Director/Deputy Director, Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department in their district.
Description & Benefits: The objective of the scheme is to encourage disabled candidates who are successful at various stages of the Civil Services Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), New Delhi, and the Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC), Indore. Under this scheme, eligible candidates will receive financial incentives: ₹20,000/- on passing the preliminary examination, ₹30,000/- on passing the main examination, and ₹20,000/- on final selection.
Ministries/Departments: Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The applicant should have a disability of 40% or more. 3. A disabled candidate who passes any stage (preliminary examination, main examination, or final selection) of the Civil Services Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), New Delhi, or the Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC), Indore, is eligible for the scheme. 4. The application form should be submitted within 6 months of the exam result declaration.
Tags: Civil Services, Disabled, Incentive, MPPSC, PwD, UPSC
Scheme Name: Civil Services Incentive Scheme for Persons with Disabilities
Target Beneficiaries: Disabled candidates who are successful at various stages of the Civil Services Examination

Application Process: Online application through the 'Shram Sewa Portal' of the Madhya Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for study abroad to a maximum of 50 students every year to the children of registered construction workers to pursue quality higher education in recognized institutions abroad. The selected students are entitled to scholarships and other benefits for courses at the postgraduate level and a research degree (Ph.D.) for two years abroad.
Ministries/Departments: Labor Department of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a child of a construction worker. 2. Either parent of the applicant should be registered with the Madhya Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and hold a valid identity card for a continuous period of 5 years. 3. To pursue a postgraduate degree, it is mandatory for the applicant to have passed the graduation degree with 60% marks in the first division or its equivalent grade. 4. For PhD degree, it is essential to have passed a postgraduate degree with 60% marks in the first division and 02 years of teaching/research/M.Phil degree in the relevant field. 5. If the student is receiving benefits from any other source, he/she will not be eligible for this scheme.
Tags: Abroad, Building Worker, Construction Worker, Financial Assistance, Higher Education, Scholarship
Scheme Name: Videsh Siksha Yojana (MPBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Children of registered construction workers

Application Process: Offline, Advertisement issuance by Directorate of Higher Education, Application scrutiny, Approval and disbursement of scholarship amount
Description & Benefits: Financial support for PhD research to differently-abled students, ₹16,000/- per month, totaling ₹1,92,000/- per year
Ministries/Departments: Higher Education Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Native of Madhya Pradesh, 2. Disabled student, 3. Registered for PhD research at any recognized university in India, 4. Postgraduate degree with minimum qualifying marks as per UGC guidelines, 5. Annual family income not exceeding ₹1,00,000/-
Tags: Disabled Students, PhD, Research, Scholarship, Madhya Pradesh
Scheme Name: Research Scholarship for Disabled Students
Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled students pursuing PhD research

Application Process: Online and Offline application process available. Beneficiaries can apply through the portal or download the mobile application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides quality essential medicines for all kinds of diseases to patients visiting government health facilities at free of cost. It provides cashless medicinal drugs, has no age limit, easy enrollment, increased access, reduced financial burden, and enhanced health outcomes.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Health & Family Welfare Department, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: Patients who have done registration in the Govt. Hospitals are eligible to get free medicines under 'Niramaya'. Beneficiaries must be residents of Odisha.
Tags: Free Medicines Distribution, Health, Odisha
Scheme Name: Niramaya Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Patients visiting government health facilities

Application Process: Offline application process involving 5 steps: 1) Visit the official website and download the application form, 2) Fill in all the mandatory fields and attach required documents, 3) Submit the application form to the concerned officer in the labour department, 4) Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority, 5) Ensure the receipt contains essential details.
Description & Benefits: The scheme offers a comprehensive 15-day residential skill upgradation training programme designed to enhance the skills of registered construction workers. This programme aims to improve proficiency in various construction trades, ensuring better safety standards, productivity, and employability. The programme provides a stipend of ₹300/- per day per trainee.
Ministries/Departments: Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana
Eligibility Criteria: The worker must be registered with the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Hyderabad. The worker's age should be between 18-45 years old. The worker should have knowledge of Telugu, Hindi, and English language.
Tags: Skill Development, Training, Construction Workers, Financial Assistance, Telangana
Scheme Name: Skill Development Training - 15 Days Residential Skill Up-gradation Training Programme
Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers

Application Process: Online application through National Scholarship Portal (NSP)
Description & Benefits: Scholarship of ₹18,000/- per annum, Dietary Money @ ₹10/- per day for 295 days, and Clothing Allowance @ ₹1,500/- per annum for the first year and ₹750/- per annum for the subsequent years
Ministries/Departments: Department of Education, Himachal Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: Bonafide residents of Himachal Pradesh, studying at Sainik School Sujanpur Tihra, and meeting merit-cum-means basis
Tags: Sainik School, Scholarship, Himachal Pradesh, Education
Scheme Name: Sainik School Sujanpur Tihra Scholarship Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Students of Himachal Pradesh studying at Sainik School Sujanpur Tihra from Class VI to XII

Application Process: Offline and Online application process, download and fill the application form, submit the form along with required documents in the office of Chief Executive Officer, Mission Youth, Civil Secretariat, Jammu and Kashmir.
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to youth for establishing their business units with a special focus on high-growth entrepreneurship, encourages innovation and job creation, and fosters high-growth entrepreneurship through business plan competitions.
Ministries/Departments: Mission Youth
Eligibility Criteria: Age between 18 to 40 years, minimum qualification of 12th standard or above, unemployed and registered with the concerned District Employment and Counseling Center, etc.
Tags: Financial Assistance, High Growth Entrepreneurship, Start Up Loan, Young Entrepreneurs, Innovation, Job Creation
Scheme Name: Spurring Entrepreneurship Initiative
Target Beneficiaries: Youth of the Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir

Application Process: Offline: Collect application form from Gram Panchayat/Municipal Corporation, fill out and submit. Online: Apply through eDistrict Chhattisgarh Portal.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹500/- per month to support widows and deserted women living below poverty line (BPL) in living a respectful life.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Chhattisgarh. 2. The applicant should be either a widow or a deserted woman. 3. The age of the widow should be between 18 and 39 years. 4. The age of the deserted woman should be 18 years or older. 5. The applicant's name should be included in the list of families living Below Poverty Line. 6. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits from any other Central or State Government pension scheme.
Tags: Widow, Deserted Woman, Financial Assistance, BPL, Chhattisgarh
Scheme Name: Sukhad Sahara Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Widows and deserted women living below poverty line (BPL)

Application Process: Online application through the official website of the department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh. The applicant needs to fill the application form, upload required documents, and submit it to the concerned department.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a balanced ration of 3 kg per day for up to two cows or buffaloes for three months during the last trimester of pregnancy to BPL families. The benefits include improved cow health, improved calf growth and development, increased milk production, better breed quality, employment generation, and reduced poverty.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: Livestock owners belonging to BPL families of all categories rearing Desi/Indigenous/crossbred cows
Tags: Pregnant Desi Indigenous Cows, BPL Families, Livestock Farmers, Himachal Pradesh, Animal Husbandry
Scheme Name: Maintenance Of Pregnant Desi Indigenous Cows Ration For BPL Families
Target Beneficiaries: BPL families of all categories of livestock farmers in Himachal Pradesh who own pregnant Desi/Indigenous cows

Application Process: Online application through Antyodaya-SARAL Portal, registration, login, filling out the application form, uploading mandatory documents, and tracking the application status
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹11,000/- is provided to the widows of ex-servicemen (other than war widows) for the marriage of their daughters, for up to two daughters who are at least 18 years old
Ministries/Departments: Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Haryana, the applicant should be the widow of an ex-serviceman who did not die in the war, the daughter should be at least 18 years old, the widow can receive the benefit for up to two of her daughters, the widow should not have remarried or should have remarried the real brother of her late husband
Tags: Marriage, Financial Assistance, Ex-Servicemen, Widows, Daughters, Haryana
Scheme Name: Marriage Grant for the Marriage of Daughters of Widows of Ex-servicemen (other than War Widows)
Target Beneficiaries: Widows of ex-servicemen (other than war widows) and their daughters

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. The interested applicant requests a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the Hostel Superintendent or writes an application in plain paper. 2. Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents to the Hostel Superintendent. 3. After receiving the student's application, the list of students and related information will be uploaded/online on the Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Welfare Department portal by the Hostel Superintendent.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides ₹1,000/- per month to the students studying in Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe hostels. The scheme also provides facilities such as a cot, mattress, bed-sheet, table and chair for studying, utensils for cooking and kitchen, etc.
Ministries/Departments: SC and ST Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The student should be a resident of Bihar state. 2. The student belongs to the Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe. 3. The student should be enrolled and reside in hostels following the departmental guidelines and instructions operated by the Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Welfare Department. 4. The student should be studying in a recognized course. 5. The student should be studying in a recognized educational institution.
Tags: Grant, Hostel, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Student
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jati Evam Anusuchit Janjati Chhatrawas Anudan Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe students studying in hostels

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form along with mandatory documents to the Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC
Description & Benefits: Assistance for the organization of events for the Birth/Death anniversaries of prominent figures who have significantly contributed to social justice and the upliftment of weaker sections of society. Financial assistance up to ₹50,000/- per occasion, for a maximum of two occasions in one year.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of SC / ST / OBC / Minorities, Government of NCT of Delhi
Eligibility Criteria: NGOs should be registered under the Societies Registration Act and have audited accounts
Tags: Social Justice, Weaker Sections, NGOs, Eminent Personalities, Birth/Death Anniversary
Scheme Name: Scheme for Celebration of Birth/death Anniversary of Eminent Personalities
Target Beneficiaries: NGOs, weaker sections of society

Application Process: Online application through the official website of the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh. Fill the application form, upload required documents, and submit.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a 50% subsidy on a balanced ration for pregnant cows or buffalo during the last trimester of pregnancy. Benefits include increased milk production, improved health of pregnant cows & buffaloes, and birth of healthy calves.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Himachal Pradesh. 2. Livestock owners belonging to BPL of Scheduled Caste category families rearing Desi/Indigenous/crossbred cows or buffaloes are eligible under the scheme. 3. The subsidy will be provided to each BPL of Scheduled Caste category families for a maximum of up to two Desi/Indigenous cows/their crosses or buffaloes.
Tags: Livestock, Pregnant Cows or Buffaloes, BPL Families, Scheduled Caste (SC) Category, Himachal Pradesh
Scheme Name: Maintenance of Pregnant Desi/Indigenous Cow/Buffalo Ration Scheme for BPL families belonging to Scheduled Caste (SC) category
Target Beneficiaries: BPL families belonging to Scheduled Caste (SC) category rearing Desi/Indigenous/crossbred cows or buffaloes

Application Process: Eligible students should apply through the online portal of the Madhya Pradesh Tribal Affairs & Scheduled Caste Welfare Automation System (MPTAASC). The application process involves registration, filling out the online application form, uploading necessary documents, and submitting it
Description & Benefits: This scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Tribe students who have passed national competitive examinations and taken admission in IIT, NIT, NLU, MBBS (government colleges located in Madhya Pradesh), AIIMS or NDA. The financial assistance is ₹50,000/- for students whose annual parental income is up to ₹3,00,000/- and ₹25,000/- for students whose annual parental income exceeds ₹3,00,000/-
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a student, a native of Madhya Pradesh, belong to the Scheduled Tribe category, have an annual family income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/-, and have qualified in national competitive exams like JEE, NEET, CLAT, AIIMS, or NDA
Tags: Higher Education, Scheduled Tribe, Financial Assistance, National Competitive Examinations, IIT, NIT, NLU, MBBS, AIIMS, NDA
Scheme Name: Pratibha Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribe students who have passed national competitive examinations and taken admission in IIT, NIT, NLU, MBBS (government colleges located in Madhya Pradesh), AIIMS or NDA

Application Process: The application process involves online and offline modes. For online mode, the applicant needs to visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board, sign in, fill in the required details, and submit the application. For offline mode, the applicant needs to download Form-XXVII, attach the required documents, and submit it to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance as medical expenses for the treatment of beneficiary or his/ her dependents suffering from disease of Nervous system (Brain & spine related), Cardiovascular System, Kidney and Cancer. The assistance amount is ₹3,00,000/-.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha, a Building/ Construction Worker, between 18 and 60 years, engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, and not a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law. The beneficiary should be registered at least for one year in lines of the Odisha State Treatment Fund.
Tags: Medical Expenses, Treatment of Major Ailments, Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha
Scheme Name: Medical Expenses for Treatment of Major Ailments (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered workers of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

Application Process: The application process involves online and offline modes. For online mode, the applicant needs to visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board, sign in, fill in the required details, and submit the application. For offline mode, the applicant needs to download Form-XXVII, attach the mandatory documents, and submit it to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of maternity benefits to the female beneficiaries subject to a maximum of two children who are registered beneficiaries for a period of more than one year under the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. The financial assistance provided under this scheme ranges from ₹8,000/- to ₹10,000/- per child.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Odisha, Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha, a Building/ Construction Worker, between 18 and 60 years, engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, registered for a period of one year or more under the board, and pregnant.
Tags: Maternity, Pregnancy Care, Women, Labour, Construction Worker, Building Worker, Child Delivery
Scheme Name: Maternity Benefit (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Female beneficiaries who are registered workers of the board

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form and required documents to the District Social Welfare Officer, Tehsil Social Welfare Officer, or Social Worker of the Department in Leh/Kargil.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides one-time financial assistance of ₹50,000/- to female beneficiaries from AAY or PHH ration cardholder families. Additionally, Divyangjan beneficiaries receive ₹1,00,000/-.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social and Tribal Welfare, UT Ladakh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should belong to Antodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) or Priority Household (PHH) ration cardholder families. The bride and bridegroom should be permanent residents of Ladakh. The bride should be above 18 years of age. The bridegroom should be above 21 years of age. The marriage should be the first marriage between the bride and the groom. The divyangjan applicants with benchmark disabilities as defined in “The Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016 are eligible.
Tags: Marriage, Financial Assistance, Ladakh, Female, Differently-abled Person
Scheme Name: State Marriage Assistance Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Female beneficiaries from AAY or PHH ration cardholder families, and Divyangjan beneficiaries with benchmark disabilities

Application Process: Offline application by visiting the office of the Deputy Director, Farmers Welfare and Agriculture Development Department in their respective district in Madhya Pradesh.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a subsidy covering 75% of the unit cost (up to ₹25,000/-) for digging a tube well and 75% of the unit cost (up to ₹15,000/-) for the successful installation of a tube well submersible pump.
Ministries/Departments: Farmer Welfare and Agriculture Development Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh, a farmer, from the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category, and own agricultural land within the state.
Tags: Farmer, Nalkoop, Pump, Subsidy, Tube Well
Scheme Name: Nalkoop Khanan Yojana- Madhya Pradesh
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers from Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe categories

Application Process: The application process involves online and offline modes. For online mode, the applicant needs to visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board, sign in, fill in the required details, and submit the application. For offline mode, the applicant needs to download Form-XXVII, attach the required documents, and submit it to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides one-time reimbursement of ₹1,000/- to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Odisha, Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha, a Building/ Construction Worker, between 18 and 60 years, engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, and not a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law. The applicant should also be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and have deposited up-to-date annual contributions for one year to the Board.
Tags: Safety Equipment, Helmet, Safety shoes, Hand-gloves, Labour, Construction Worker, Building Worker, Odisha
Scheme Name: Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered workers of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

Application Process: Offline application process: Download the application form, fill out all required sections accurately, submit the completed application form along with all attached documents to the Block/ULB Administration office, and ensure you receive a submission receipt for future reference.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to support the education of cured leprosy children and children of cured leprosy persons studying at pre-matriculation or post-secondary stages in India. The scholarship amount varies based on the level of education: ₹800/- per month for pre-matric (Std. V to X), ₹1,000/- per month for post-matric (Std. XI-XII), ₹1,500/- per month for general graduate/post-graduate courses, and ₹2,000/- per month for professional degrees/diplomas/certificates.
Ministries/Departments: Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (SSEPD) Department, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant is a bonafide resident of Odisha, is either a child cured of leprosy or a child of a cured leprosy person, is a regular student of recognized educational institutions, has a family income of not more than Rs. 2,40,000/- per annum, and is not in receipt of any financial assistance from the State Govt./ Central Govt. under any other scheme.
Tags: Leprosy Persons, Post Matric, Pre Matric, Rehabilitation, Scholarship, Student
Scheme Name: Rehabilitation of Cured Leprosy Persons: Pre & Post-Matric Scholarship
Target Beneficiaries: Cured Leprosy children and children of Cured Leprosy Persons

Application Process: The candidate can apply through State Scholarship Portal, Government of Odisha.
Description & Benefits: The objective of the scheme is to extend financial assistance to the children of the beneficiaries under KALIA for pursuing Professional/Technical courses in the State of Odisha. It will lead to better access to Higher Education for children of Small and marginal farmers (SF/MF), Actual cultivators (sharecroppers), and Landless Agricultural households (LAH). KALIA Scholarship will support SF/MF & LAH in empowering their families.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Agriculture & Farmers Empowerment, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: The children of all the eligible beneficiaries under the KALIA scheme under the two different components, namely Support to Cultivators for Cultivation and Livelihood Support to Landless Agricultural Households are eligible for the scholarship.
Tags: Scholarship, Education, Agriculture, Odisha
Scheme Name: KALIA Scholarship
Target Beneficiaries: Children of Small and marginal farmers (SF/MF), Actual cultivators (sharecroppers), and Landless Agricultural households (LAH)

Application Process: The application process involves online and offline registration, filling in general details, address details, family and nominee details, details of the establishment(s) where the applicant worked during the last one year, bank details, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a one-time reimbursement of ₹4,000/- to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing tools on production of original bill/ voucher.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Odisha, Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha, between 18 and 60 years old, engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year, and not a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.
Tags: Building Worker, Construction Worker, Labour, Working Tools
Scheme Name: Grant for the Purchase of Working Tools (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered building and construction workers of Odisha

Application Process: Online application through the SSP (Student Scholarship Portal) software, upload necessary documents, submit hard copies to the college, and verification by college principals, inspection officers, and Taluk Backward Classes Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for food and accommodation expenses, monthly stipend of Rs. 1,500 for 10 months, totaling Rs. 15,000 per annum, directly credited to the students' bank accounts. Promotes access to higher education for eligible students, encourages academic performance, and reduces the financial burden on students pursuing post-matric courses.
Ministries/Departments: Government of Karnataka
Eligibility Criteria: Citizens of India and permanent residents of Karnataka, belonging to backward classes listed by the Government of India or the State Government, pursuing post-matric courses in recognized institutions, and not secured admission in any departmental or government-funded student hostel. The annual income of the student's family should fall within specific limits based on the category they belong to. Minimum marks required in the previous year's annual examination for fresh and renewal students.
Tags: Education, Stipend, Students, Karnataka, Backward Classes, Post-matric courses
Scheme Name: Vidyasiri Food And Accommodation Scholarship Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Students from backward classes pursuing post-matric courses in Karnataka

Application Process: Offline application through prescribed form along with required documents to the concerned District Collector, Madhya Pradesh within 60 days of completing the pilgrimage.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to pilgrims of Madhya Pradesh who undertake the Kailash Mansarovar pilgrimage, reimbursing 50% of the total expenses incurred during the pilgrimage, up to a maximum of ₹30,000/- per pilgrim.
Ministries/Departments: Religious Trusts and Endowments Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The applicant must have completed the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra after being selected by the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India. 3. Only individuals who have been selected by the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India, for the pilgrimage are eligible for the benefits of this scheme. 4. The applicant should not be an income taxpayer. 5. Each individual is eligible for the grant only once in their lifetime.
Tags: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, Madhya Pradesh, Pilgrimage, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra- Madhya Pradesh
Target Beneficiaries: Pilgrims of Madhya Pradesh going on the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra

Application Process: Online - via CSCs. Step 1: Gather necessary documents. Step 2: Visit the nearest Common Service Center (CSC) and complete the Biometric Verification Process. Step 3: Ensure that the CSC agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents. Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered female construction workers and maximum of two daughters of registered construction workers for marriage purposes. A one-time grant of ₹50,000/- is provided to meet the marriage expenses.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department Tripura, Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a female registered construction worker. 2. The female construction worker should have been registered for at least one year continuously. 3. The family of a registered construction worker can avail of this assistance only twice: however, there shall be only one claim in respect of a given marriage irrespective of the number of registered construction workers in the family. 4. The registered construction workers should not have any dues payable to the Board. 5. The registered construction worker's daughter should have attained the age prescribed by law for marriage for whose marriage the assistance is sought. 6. The registered construction worker's daughter should not be an employee in government or quasi-government.
Tags: Construction Workers, Female, Financial Assistance, Marriage
Scheme Name: Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Registered female construction workers and maximum of two daughters of registered construction workers

Application Process: Online and Offline applications are accepted. The beneficiary may download the MAMATA mobile Application or log in on the department portal to apply for the scheme.
Description & Benefits: A conditional cash transfer maternity benefit scheme aimed at reducing maternal and infant mortality, and improving the health and nutrition status of pregnant and lactating mothers and their infants. The scheme provides financial assistance of Rs.5,000 in two instalments as incentive to mothers.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Odisha. The scheme is primarily aimed at pregnant women. Pregnant & Lactating women of 19 years of age and above for the first two live births, except all Government/Public Sector Undertakings (Central and State) employees and their wives will be covered.
Tags: Maternity Benefit, Nutritional Support, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Mamata Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Pregnant Women And New Mothers

Application Process: Online application through official website, Registration, filling of application form, uploading required documents, and submission
Description & Benefits: Provides pension to indigent artists who are in distress condition despite their lifelong commitment/dedication to art and culture, Financial assistance of ₹1200/- per month
Ministries/Departments: Odia Language, Literature & Culture Department, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Minimum age of 50 years for males and 40 years for females, 2. Annual income not exceeding ₹50,000/- for rural areas and ₹60,000/- for urban areas, 3. Not eligible for similar benefits under any other scheme of the Government
Tags: Artist, Culture, Kalakar, Literature, Pension, Odisha
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Kalakar Sahayata Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Elderly artists who have consistently devoted themselves to enriching, displaying, and preserving the arts and culture of Odisha

Application Process: Offline application process involving forming a group of 5 eligible students, submitting an application with required documents, and approval by the Joint/Deputy Director of Social Welfare.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides free accommodation to a group of 5 disabled students, to motivate them for higher education, by providing accommodations to them. The accommodations are provided at a rental building.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Chhattisgarh, have a disability of 40% or more, have passed the Higher Secondary Examination, be enrolled as a regular student in a College, Polytechnic, or ITI, and live more than 20 kilometers from their educational institution.
Tags: Disability, Education, Housing, Chhattisgarh
Scheme Name: Student Housing Scheme for Students with Disabilities
Target Beneficiaries: Students with disabilities

Application Process: Online: Through eDistrict Chhattisgarh Portal. Offline: In rural areas, applicants must visit the Gram Panchayat office to collect and fill out the application form, submit it, and receive an acknowledgment receipt. In urban areas, applicants should visit the office of the concerned Municipal Corporation, Municipality, or Nagar Panchayat to collect the application form, fill it out, submit it, and receive an acknowledgment receipt.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to support them in living a respectful life. Eligible beneficiaries will receive a monthly pension of ₹500/-, (Central contribution- ₹300/-, State Contribution- ₹200/-).
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Chhattisgarh. 2. The applicant should be a person with multiple disabilities. 3. The applicant should have severe disabilities (with a disability percentage of 80% or above). 4. The applicant’s age should be between 18 and 79 years. 5. The applicant's name should be included in the list of families living Below Poverty Line. 6. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits from any other Central or State Government pension scheme.
Tags: Disability, Pension, BPL, PWD, Chhattisgarh
Scheme Name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
Target Beneficiaries: Severely disabled (with a disability of 80% and above) and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 to 79 years who are living below the poverty line (BPL)

Application Process: Offline application process. Application must be submitted in the prescribed form to the Deputy Director of the Social Welfare Department at the District Office.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to encourage persons with disabilities and organizations working for the interests of persons with disabilities and to motivate the community for the overall rehabilitation of persons with disabilities. The scheme provides cash prizes, appreciation certificates, and certificates to the winners in different categories.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should be a disabled employee in Chhattisgarh, an employer of persons with disabilities, a voluntary organization working for the benefit of persons with disabilities, or a district in Chhattisgarh providing provisional facilities as outlined in the Disabilities Act
Tags: Disability, Rehabilitation, Incentives, Awards
Scheme Name: Disabled State Level Award Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Persons with disabilities, organizations working for the interests of persons with disabilities

Application Process: Offline application process involving downloading the application form from the official website, filling in the mandatory fields, attaching required documents, and submitting the application to the concerned officer in the labour department
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance as a marriage gift to unmarried registered women workers and the daughters of registered building and construction workers who have reached the age of 18 years. The scheme provides ₹30,000/- as a marriage gift.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Telangana
Eligibility Criteria: Construction worker should be registered under the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Construction worker should be a woman, Construction worker should be unmarried, Daughter(s) should have completed 18 years of age at the time of application
Tags: Marriage, Financial Assistance, Construction Workers, Women, Daughter, Telangana
Scheme Name: Marriage Gift Scheme - Telangana
Target Beneficiaries: Unmarried registered women workers and daughters of registered building and construction workers

Application Process: Offline application process involving 5 steps: 1. Download the application form from the official website, 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields and attach required documents, 3. Submit the application form to the concerned officer in the labour department, 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority, 5. Ensure the receipt contains essential details.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial support to the nominee, dependents, or legal heirs of registered building and other construction workers in the unfortunate event of their accidental death. The scheme offers a substantial relief amount of ₹6,00,000/- to help the families cope with the sudden loss of their breadwinner.
Ministries/Departments: Telangana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (TB&OCWWB), LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be the nominee/dependant / legal heir of the deceased registered worker. 2. The deceased must have been a registered building or construction worker with the Telangana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. 3. The construction worker should have died on the spot or due to the injuries caused by an accident that occurred either in the work place or anywhere else.
Tags: Accidental Death, Construction Workers, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Fatal Accident Relief - Telangana
Target Beneficiaries: Nominee, dependents, or legal heirs of registered building and other construction workers

Application Process: Offline and Online. In Rural Areas: Collect the application form from the office of the Gram Panchayat, fill it out, submit it to the Gram Panchayat, and receive an acknowledgment receipt. In Urban Areas: Collect the application form from the office of the concerned Municipal Corporation, Municipality, Nagar Panchayat, or Panchayat Raj institution, fill it out, and submit it to the respective office.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to support them in living a respectful life. Eligible beneficiaries will receive a pension of ₹500/- per month, which is directly transferred to the applicant's bank account.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Chhattisgarh. 2. The applicant should be either a person with a disability or a dwarf person. 3. Children with disabilities (CwDs) aged 6-17 years are eligible, the CwDs in the age group of 6-14 should be school-going. 4. Persons with disabilities who are 18 years or older and have a disability of 40% or above are eligible for the scheme. 5. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits from any other central or state government pension scheme. 6. The applicant's name should be included in the list of families living the Below Poverty Line.
Tags: BPL, Disabled, Dwarf, Pension, PwD, Social Security
Scheme Name: Social Security Pension Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Below Poverty Line (BPL) Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) and dwarf individuals

Application Process: Offline application process involving 5 steps: 1. Visit the official website and download the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields and attach required documents. 3. Submit the application form to the concerned officer in the labour department. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority. 5. Ensure the receipt contains essential details.
Description & Benefits: Comprehensive training gains hands-on experience in key construction trades, including Masonry, Bar Bending, Plumbing & Sanitation, Electrical House Wiring, Painting, Welding, Dry Wall and False Ceiling, Formwork Carpentry, Land Surveyor, General Works Supervisor, and Store Keeper.
Ministries/Departments: Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a dependent of the registered construction worker. 2. The applicant's age should be between 18-30 years old. 3. The applicant should have knowledge of Telugu, Hindi, and English language.
Tags: Skill Development, Training, Construction Trades, Telangana, Labour Department
Scheme Name: Skill Development Training - 90 Days Residential Skill Development Training Programme
Target Beneficiaries: Unemployed youth who are dependents of registered construction workers

Application Process: Online and Offline application process through the Vidya Lakshmi portal. Registration and login are required to apply for the scheme.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an educational loan of up to ₹ 10 lakhs with an interest rate of 1% to be borne by the applicant, and the balance amount of interest will be borne by the Government of Odisha, Higher Education Department. The loan covers all courses like medicine, engineering, law, management, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Higher Education, Government of Odisha
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The student must be a resident/domicile of Odisha. 2. The annual income of the applicant's family should be less than or equal to ₹ 8,00,000 per annum. 3. Poor students willing to continue higher studies can apply for a loan under this scheme. 4. The student shouldn’t avail of similar benefits from any other Government/Institution for the same purpose. 5. The student must have secured admission to a higher education course in recognized institutions in India or Abroad.
Tags: Education, Loan, Student, Higher Studies, Odisha
Scheme Name: Kalinga Sikhya Sathi Yojana (KSSY)
Target Beneficiaries: Economically weaker background students who want to pursue higher studies

Application Process: Online and offline applications can be made through nearby Sewa Kendras or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector of the area.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial support in the form of stipends for the education of the children of registered construction workers, including hostel fees, ranging from ₹3,000 to ₹70,000 per annum.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Punjab, a registered construction worker, between 18 and 60 years, with a monthly income of ₹15,000/- or below, and not a member of any other Welfare Fund or income tax payer.
Tags: Education, Scholarship, Labour, Construction Worker, Punjab
Scheme Name: Stipend Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Children of registered construction workers and the beneficiaries themselves for their own education in evening classes

Application Process: Online - via CSCs, Offline - through nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector of your area
Description & Benefits: The Board will provide free cycles to the children of registered construction workers once during the period they study in 9th to 12th class in the State of Punjab.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a child of a registered construction worker Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Punjab. The beneficiary should be studying in any class between 9th to 12th in the State of Punjab. The beneficiary should not have received any bicycle from the State Government under “Mai Bhago Cycle Scheme”.
Tags: Construction Worker, Children, Cycle, Labour, Punjab
Scheme Name: Cycle Scheme for the Children of Construction Workers (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Children of registered construction workers

Application Process: Online - via CSCs, Offline - through nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector of your area
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides full course fees, boarding and lodging assistance to the children of registered workers who acquire Skill from technical institutions such as ITIs/ Polytechnic colleges etc.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Punjab
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a child of a registered construction worker Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Punjab. The applicant should have acquired skill training from technical institutions such as ITIs/ Polytechnic colleges etc.
Tags: Skill Upgradation, Vocational Education, Construction Worker, Labour, Punjab
Scheme Name: Skill Upgradation and Vocational Education Scheme: For Worker's Childrens (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
Target Beneficiaries: Children of registered construction workers

Application Process: Online application through NSP portal. Students need to register and fill in the application form, upload required documents, and submit the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to economically weaker meritorious Scheduled Tribe (ST) students to pursue professional and other courses in government-recognized institutes and colleges with the necessary financial support to continue their education without financial constraints. A one-time financial support of ₹1,00,000/- will be provided to selected students in two installments.
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Tripura
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The student should be a domicile of Tripura. 2. The student should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community. 3. The student should have passed Class 10th (Madhyamik) for pre-12th courses or Class 12th (H.S level) for post-12th courses in 2022 with at least 45% marks. 4. The student must have taken admission in any professional course listed in Annexure-A and Annexure-B during the academic year 2022-23, with a course duration of at least 2 years.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Professional Courses, Schedule Tribe, Student

Application Process: Online application through the Karnataka Minorities Development Corporation website. Steps: 1. Visit the website, 2. Click 'Apply Online', 3. Enter mobile number and submit, 4. Enter Aadhaar number, fill in captcha and select next, 5. Get OTP, 6. Fill in basic details, 7. Upload required documents, 8. Click 'Proceed' and submit application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to improve the financial condition of minority communities involved in silk reeling and spinning by providing financial assistance through loans and subsidies. This support is intended to enhance working capital, improve basic infrastructure, and promote better productivity and economic stability. Financial assistance of up to ₹2,00,000/- with 50% of the loan amount as a subsidy.

Eligibility Criteria: 1. Belong to the religious minority category of the state. 2. Permanent resident of the state. 3. Age between 18 to 55 years. 4. Family income from all sources should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-. 5. No member of the applicant's family should be a State/Central Government employee. 6. The applicant or his family members should not have availed of any loan/subsidy facility from the Corporation in the last 5 years except the Arivu education loan and Foreign Education Loan Scheme. 7. The applicant should not be a sustainer of the corporation.
Tags: Sericulture, Reelers, Minority Community, Financial Assistance, Loan, Subsidy, Karnataka

Target Beneficiaries: Minority communities involved in silk reeling and spinning

Application Process: Offline application process: Collect the application form from the nearest Agricultural Office, fill out the form with required details and attach mandatory documents, and submit the form to the concerned office (Assistant Agricultural Officer at the Village Level, Agricultural Officer/Deputy Agricultural Officer at the Block Level, or the Joint Director of Agriculture at the District Level).

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Relief Camp Nodal Officer/Labour Board Inspector. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the Relief Camp Nodal Officer or Labour Board Inspector to whom the application has been submitted.

Application Process: Offline application through educational institution. Collect the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents, and submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the educational institution.
Description & Benefits: The scheme helps students pursue higher education through providing financial assistance. The selected students receive ₹2,000/- in the first year and ₹1,500/- per annum for the next five years.
Ministries/Departments: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu, a student, belong to the SC/ST (Hindu Adi Dravidar) community, and have secured the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations in their district.
Tags: Education, Examination, Tribal Welfare, Award
Scheme Name: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award
Target Beneficiaries: Students from the Hindu Adi Dravidar community

Application Process: Online application process involving registration, uploading of documents, and spot verification by the department.
Description & Benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹2,50,000/- for SC men marrying a woman from another caste and ₹3,00,000/- for SC women marrying a man from another caste. The incentive is provided in two installments: 50% in cash and 50% as a fixed deposit with a minimum term of 3 years.
Ministries/Departments: Karnataka Social Welfare Department
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The bride and groom should belong to the Hindu Category. 2. The bride and groom should be residing in Karnataka. 3. The marriage should be performed between Scheduled Caste and other communities. 4. The income of the couple should not exceed ₹5,00,000/-. 5. The age of the bride should be between 18 to 42 years at the time of marriage. 6. The age of the groom should be between 21 to 45 years at the time of marriage.
Tags: Inter-caste marriage, Financial Assistance, Scheduled Caste, Karnataka
Scheme Name: Incentive for the Inter Caste Marriage Couple
Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals who marry outside their caste, particularly Hindu non-SC individuals

Application Process: Offline application process involving collecting the application form from the office of the Commissioner/ Panchayat Union/ District Adi dravidar and Tribal Welfare Officer/ Commissioner of Tribal Welfare, filling in the mandatory fields, attaching required documents, and submitting the application to the concerned office/ authority.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides free housing to tribal communities who have been allocated house site pattas, ensuring access to safe and permanent shelter, and improving living conditions of SC/ST communities by providing basic infrastructure.
Ministries/Departments: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu, belong to the Scheduled Castes (SC)/ Scheduled Tribes (ST) communities, and possess a free house site patta.
Tags: Free House Construction, Tribal Welfare, Housing Infrastructure

Target Beneficiaries: Tribal communities who have been allocated house site pattas, SC/ST communities

Application Process: Online application through the official website of the Jammu & Kashmir Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Steps include registration, logging in, selecting the scheme, filling in required information, uploading documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹5,000 to registered female workers during maternity, for up to two children, provided they have been engaged in building or construction work for at least 90 days in the preceding 12 months.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Jammu & Kashmir. 2. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker. 3. The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. 4. The applicant should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days during the preceding 12 months. 5. The applicant should be registered with the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Jammu & Kashmir.
Tags: Maternity, Pregnancy Care, Women, Labour, Building Worker, Construction Worker
Scheme Name: Maternity Benefit For Female Workers- JKBOCWWB
Target Beneficiaries: Registered female construction workers

Application Process: Offline application through District Central Cooperative Banks and its branches, with submission of required documents and receipt of acknowledgment.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to professionals to help them expand or enhance their professional activities, with a loan amount of up to ₹10,00,000/- at a competitive interest rate of 13%.
Ministries/Departments: Co-operation, Food and Consumer Protection Department, Tamil Nadu
