Target Beneficiaries: Doctors, Engineers, and Self-Employed Professionals

Application Process: Applications can be submitted online as well as offline. Online application process involves logging in to the official website, clicking on 'Scheme Registration' and selecting 'Apply for Scheme', entering required information and uploading necessary documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹4,00,000/- to the nominee or dependents of registered BOC workers in the event of an accidental death.
Ministries/Departments: Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Jammu & Kashmir, a Building/ Construction Worker, between 18 and 60 years, engaged in building or other construction work for at least 90 days during the preceding 12 months, and registration is renewed annually. The applicant should be a nominee/dependent of a registered member/worker who has passed away due to accidental death.

Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer.

Application Process: Offline application process: Download the application form from the MBOCWW website, fill it out, attach the required documents, and submit it to the Labour Commissioner or Government Labour Officer.

Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers under the Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW) and their family members undergoing treatment for critical illnesses

Application Process: Offline. Step-1: Download the application form from the MBOCWW official website. Step-2: Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Step-3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer. Step-4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority.

Ministries/Departments: Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: 1. Obtain a hard copy of the application form from the Nagaland Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board. 2. Fill in the application form and attach required documents. 3. Submit the application form to the Assistant Labour Commissioner. 4. Obtain a receipt or acknowledgement from the Assistant Labour Commissioner.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered beneficiaries and their family members for hospitalization. ₹1,000/- per day is provided for the first five days of hospitalization, followed by ₹500/- per day for up to 10 more days.
Ministries/Departments: Nagaland Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The construction worker should be registered under the Nagaland Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board. 2. The spouse and children of the construction worker are also eligible for financial assistance. 3. The applicant should be hospitalized for at least five continuous days for assistance.

Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers and their family members

Application Process: Online
Description & Benefits: The objective of the scheme is to sponsor market-driven skill development training for the youth of J&K to facilitate Enhancement of Employability & Marketability of Youth in high potential / emerging Job Markets, Establishment of Independent Livelihood avenues for youth in various economic sectors, Development of a resource pool of skilled youth that can be used for the positive economic transformation of J&K, and Promotion of the concept of 'Be Vocal for Local'. The trainings are given in focus sectors at Tourism, IT, handicrafts, Retail, Agriculture, construction, and other focus sectors of Jammu & Kashmir.
Ministries/Departments: Mission Youth
Eligibility Criteria: Candidates must have passed the qualifying examination prescribed for a particular training programme/course; Candidates who have already completed Skilling Training in any trade under any Government scheme will not be eligible to get benefits under this scheme; 40% of the number of sanctioned slots shall be earmarked for female candidates.

Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a student, a resident of Tamil Nadu, belong to BC, MBC, or DNC, parents' income should not exceed ₹1,00,000/- (for BC students), there should be no graduate in the family (for BC students), and the beneficiary should be studying in 11th or 12th standard in an English medium school.

Application Process: Online application through CSCs, submitting necessary documents for verification, and awaiting approval and financial disbursement upon successful application.

Application Process: Offline application process involving 5 steps: 1) Obtain application form from Textile Department, 2) Fill and submit the form with required documents, 3) Submit the application to Textile Department, 4) Submit the application to Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare District Office, 5) Obtain loan sanctioning from Social Welfare Department.

Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar, a ryot farmer, from any of the 21 specified districts, with agricultural land between 0.25 acres and 10 acres, and registered on the DBT portal.

Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Bagwani Mission: Dragon Fruit Vikas Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Ryot farmers

Application Process: Online application through eDistrict 2.0 portal
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to transport workers who are hospitalized for 5 or more days due to an accident. Benefits are directly transferred to the beneficiaries' bank accounts through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be between 18 and 60 years of age at the time of enrolment, must be an unorganized worker employed in the operation of commercial vehicles, and the vehicle must be used for commercial purposes and not solely for personal or family use.

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: 1. Obtain and fill the prescribed application form, 2. Attach necessary documents, 3. Submit the application to the Tehsil Social Welfare Officer (TSWO), 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides ₹1,000/- per month to widows aged 40 and above from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.
Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Jammu and Kashmir. 2. The applicant should be a widow. 3. The widow's age should be 40 years or older. 4. The widow should belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family. 5. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits under any other social security scheme.

Description & Benefits: Uplift lifestyle of economically disadvantaged Charmakar communities, Promotes educational, economic, and social development, Supports production and sale of footwear and leather articles, Provides financial assistance of ₹50,000, Subsidy of ₹10,000, Loan component of ₹40,000 with 5% interest rate
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra, National Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (NSFDC)
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Maharashtra, 2. Female, 3. Belong to Charmakar Community, 4. Age between 18 to 50 years, 5. Knowledge of business, 6. Annual income below poverty line or ₹98,000 in rural areas or ₹1,20,000 in urban areas

Target Beneficiaries: Economically disadvantaged Charmakar communities (such as Dhor, Chambhar, Holar, and Mochi), Female beneficiaries

Application Process: Online application through the official website of the Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka. Steps: 1. Visit the website, 2. Click on 'Incentives for Marriage' and select the 'Incentives to Inter-Caste Marriage' scheme, 3. Fill in the online registration form, 4. Upload mandatory documents, 5. Review and submit the form, 6. Print the acknowledgement form for future reference.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides incentives to the couple in which one spouse is from a Scheduled Tribe (ST) and the other spouse is non-ST. An incentive of ₹5,50,000/- is provided to the married couple, i.e. ₹3,00,000/- for the bride and ₹2,50,000/- for the groom.
Ministries/Departments: Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The couple should be residing in Karnataka. 2. The couple should belong to the Hindu religion. 3. One spouse should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community. Other spouse should belong to a community other than Scheduled Tribe (ST). 4. The combined annual income of the couple should be less than ₹5,00,000/-. 5. The couple should apply to the scheme within 18 months of marriage. 6. The non-ST partner should be a Hindu. 7. The non-ST partner should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 8. The marriage should have taken place on or after 7th February 2019.
Tags: Inter Caste Marriage, Scheduled Tribe, Incentive, Karnataka, Tribal Welfare Department
Scheme Name: Incentive For The Inter Caste Marriage Couple (Scheduled Tribe)
Target Beneficiaries: Couples where one partner belongs to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community and the other partner belongs to either the Hindu non-ST or SC category

Eligibility Criteria: 1. Resident of Mizoram, 2. Disabled person, 3. Student enrolled in government or private school, 4. From Below Poverty Line (BPL) family

Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled students

Minimum 20 years before retirement. 4. No pucca house in any part of the country. 5. Minimum land area (30 Square meters) for construction of Houses. 6. No central assistance under any housing scheme from the central/state Government. 7. Annual income not exceeding ₹3,00,000/-. 8. Belongs to the economically weaker section (EWS) category.

Application Process: Offline and Online, physical forms can be collected from the office of the District Agriculture Offices, required documents must be submitted along with the form.

Registered farmer’s associations: legally registered with the government of Meghalaya, not a defaulter at any financial institution.

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the district office of the Tahsildars and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Collector/Special Deputy Collector/Special Tahsildar.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹20,000/- to the BPL households on the death of their primary breadwinner (male or female).

Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be the legal heir of the deceased primary breadwinner. 2. Application Process: Online application process through the official website of the Chief Minister COVID-19 Child Welfare Scheme. The applicant needs to register and then apply by filling out the application form and uploading required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a pension on a monthly basis to children whose parents or guardians have died due to coronavirus infection. The pension will be provided till the child attains the age of 21 years. Apart from this, education and ration facilities will also be provided.
Ministries/Departments: Women and Child Development Department
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The affected family should be a local resident of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The family should not be eligible to avail the benefits of Chief Minister Covid-19 Yodha Kalyan Yojana. 3. The deceased parents of the child beneficiary should not have been government servants or employees of a government undertaking who were eligible to receive pension under the old pension scheme. 4. Such boys/girls whose age is 21 years or less, but till the prescribed duration of graduation course, whichever is less and whose- * Parent has died from COVID-19 or * Parents have died earlier and their legal guardian has died due to Covid-19. * One of the parents has died in the past and now the other has died of Covid-19. * Only During from 01 March 2021 to 30 June 2021
Tags: Children Care, Educaction, Financial Support
Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Covid-19 Bal Seva Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Children whose parents or guardians have died due to coronavirus infection

Application Process: Online application through the official portal, registration, and submission of required documents
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to eligible families for the marriage of their daughters, aiming to empower girls and their families by providing financial support for their marriage and ensuring that they do not face any financial burden. The scheme provides an assistance amount of ₹40,000 to the eligible families to cover the expenses related to the marriage.

The subsidy amount is 40% of the total price, and up to 50% subsidy is given to government farmers. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for the purchase of agricultural machinery and equipment, leading to increased efficiency, productivity, and profitability in farming operations.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture Department of the Rajasthan government
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Own agricultural land in his/her own name. 2. In case of undivided family, the applicant's name must be in the revenue record. 3. For tractor-operated agricultural implements, the tractor must be registered in the applicant's name. 4. Not have received a grant for the same type of agricultural implement in the last three years. 5. Not have received a grant for more than 3 different types of agricultural implements in a financial year.
Tags: Agriculture, Farmers, Subsidy, Machinery, Equipment, Rajasthan

Description & Benefits: The plastic Mulching scheme provides subsidies to farmers. Using plastic mulch helps prevent soil compaction and compaction. This material blocks moisture and heat and limits the loss of plant nutrients. Plastic mulch is the most restrictive of all the mulching materials available on the market, so it is well-suited for drip irrigation. Additionally, the plastic layer prevents people and pets from walking in the area, further strengthening the soil structure.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture Department of the Rajasthan government
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a farmer. 2. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. 3. The applicant must have agricultural land ownership and irrigation sources.
Tags: Agriculture, Farmer, Farming, Plastic Mulching, Rajasthan
Scheme Name: Plastic Mulching
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers

Application Process: Online application through the official website of the Uttar Pradesh Labour Welfare Board. Steps include registration, filling out the application form, uploading required documents, and submitting the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to ease the financial burden of construction workers and offer them a chance to experience holy pilgrimages. By providing a one-time grant, the SKSPTYY empowers registered construction worker families to embark on religious journeys. A maximum lump sum assistance of ₹12,000/- will be provided for the travel expenses.
Ministries/Departments: Uttar Pradesh Government
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Worker must be working in an establishment registered under the Factories Act, 1948. 2. Monthly salary (basic salary + dearness allowance) should not exceed ₹15,000/-. 3. Worker must have completed at least six months of continuous service in the establishment/factory and must be in service at the time of application. 4. Where both the worker and his wife are working as workers in factories/establishments, then only one of them will be eligible for this facility. 5. The worker and his dependents (dependents include wife, maximum 2 unmarried children, parents of the worker, mother-in-law and father-in-law in case of female worker) but the total number of members including the worker will be maximum 6. Only two children of the worker's family and dependent mother/father can be included. 6. The worker will be able to avail this facility once in his entire service period.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Pilgrimage, Travel, Construction Workers, Uttar Pradesh Government
Scheme Name: Shravan Kumar Shramik Parivar Tirth Yatra Yojana
Target Beneficiaries: Construction worker families

Tags: Death Benefits, Financial Assistance, Social Welfare

Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a Worker, between 18 to 60 years of age, completed ninety days of service as a registered worker in the year, registered with the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and permanently disabled due to Paralysis / Leprosy / Tuberculosis(TB) / Accident
Tags: Accident, Disability, Labour, Pension, PwD
Scheme Name: Disability Pension (GBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Workers who are permanently disabled due to Paralysis / Leprosy / Tuberculosis(TB) / Accident

Application Process: Offline application process. The interested applicant should take a print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. The application should be submitted through their employers or through the Heads of Educational Institutions where their child is studying, to the Secretary, Goa Labour Welfare Board, on or before 30th September every year.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to children of workers employed in establishments covered under the Goa, Daman & Diu Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1986. Scholarships are awarded to support the educational pursuits of these children, with amounts ranging from ₹2,000 to ₹20,000 depending on the educational level and course pursued.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour and Employment, Goa
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a regular worker, employed in an industrial establishment for at least six months, with a total income not exceeding ₹20,000 per month. The child of the applicant should be enrolled in a recognized institution in India, pursuing general or technical education, and have qualified for promotion in the last annual examination with at least 45% marks.
Tags: Scholarship, Education, Labour Welfare, Goa
Scheme Name: Scheme for Award of Scholarships to School or College-Going Children of Employees/Industrial Employees in Various Establishments
Target Beneficiaries: Children of workers employed in establishments covered under the Goa, Daman & Diu Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1986

Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal: [﻿
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is given to dairy farmers on purchase of electric powered chaff cutters. By using power driven chaff cutter, dairy farmers can reduce wastage of green and dry fodder which is economically important for their profitable dairy farming. The scheme provides financial assistance of up to 75% of the purchase cost of the powered chaff cutter or ₹18,000/-, whichever is less.
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 2. The beneficiary should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category. 3. The beneficiary should have a minimum of five (5) animals of his/her own.
Tags: Chaff Cutter, Dairy Farming, Fodder, Scheduled Tribe, Subsidy, TASP
Scheme Name: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP- ST Category)
Target Beneficiaries: Dairy farmers belonging to the Scheduled Tribes (ST) category

Application Process: Offline application process through Poompucar Sales and Manufacturing Plant Managers. Applicants need to submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to encourage artisans to produce utility based handicrafts. This award will be given to 3 artisans. This award consists of a cash prize of ₹40,000/-, a 4 gm gold medal, one thamirapattiram and a certificate.
Ministries/Departments: Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Department, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be an artisan, native of Tamil Nadu, manufacturer of handicrafts in Tamil Nadu, possess proficiency in Tamil and must be a contributor to Tamil literature, and use non-toxic and non-polluting craft materials.
Tags: Handicrafts, Artisans, Award, Tamil Nadu
Scheme Name: Utility Based Handicrafts Award
Target Beneficiaries: Artisans

Application Process: Offline application process through the Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation. The applicant needs to fill in the prescribed application form, attach required documents, and submit it to the Poombukar Head Office in Chennai.
Description & Benefits: The scheme recognizes and honors craftspersons who have made significant contributions to the development of Tamil Nadu's crafts. The rewards include a cash prize of ₹50,000/-, a four-gram gold medal, Thamirapathiram, and a certificate of recognition. Economically backward awardees are also eligible for a monthly pension of ₹3,500/- after completion of 60 years of age.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be an artisan, a native of Tamil Nadu, above 30 years of age, and have experience in their profession.
Tags: Award, Crafts, Financial Assistance, Tamil Nadu
Scheme Name: Poompuhar State Award
Target Beneficiaries: Artisans

Application Process: Offline, through a prescribed format, with mandatory documents, submitted to the Director of Public Instruction, Meghalaya through the Head of the Institution
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance for the purchase of books for their studies, with varying grant amounts depending on the academic course
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Higher and Technical Education, Meghalaya
Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Meghalaya, 2. Student, 3. Belong to Khasi-Jaintia or Garo Community, 4. Secured at least 60% marks in aggregate in the preceding examination, 5. Pursuing a regular course in a recognized institution in India, 6. Not employed in any capacity under the Government
Tags: Book Grant, Education, Financial Assistance, Post-matric Courses, Student
Scheme Name: The Meghalaya Tribal Students’ Book Grant (Post-Matric Education)
Target Beneficiaries: Meritorious tribal students

Application Process: Online application through the State Scholarship Portal 2.0. Registration and login are required to apply for the scheme.
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to economically disadvantaged students belonging to marginalized communities. The scheme helps alleviate financial burdens associated with tuition fees, maintenance allowances, and other incidental expenses.

Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh belonging to a backward class. 2. The applicant should be passed in the previous class. 3. The total annual income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.

Scheme Name: Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti
Target Beneficiaries: Economically disadvantaged students belonging to marginalized communities

Application Process: Online application through the State Scholarship Portal 2.0, involving registration, filling in required details, uploading documents, and submitting the application.

Ministries/Departments: Higher Education Department of Madhya Pradesh
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category. If the applicant is studying in non-government institutions, the annual income limit of parents/guardians is up to ₹6,00,000/-.

Scheme Name: Post Metric Scholarship - Madhya Pradesh
Target Beneficiaries: Students belonging to economically weaker sections of society

Application Process: Online application through e-District website. Registration and login are required.
Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to widows and destitute women to alleviate their economic hardship and provide a semblance of stability in their lives. The support often comes in the form of monthly stipends or welfare programs designed to meet their basic needs, including food, shelter, and healthcare.

Eligibility Criteria: The applicant women's age should be 18-60 years. The applicant should be a resident of UT, Chandigarh for more than 3 years. The applicant's family's annual income should not exceed ₹1,50,000/-
Tags: Financial Assistance, Widows, Destitute Women, Pension, Social Welfare

Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to farmers for purchasing various tools, equipment, sorting/grading equipment, and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment

Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat and belong to the Scheduled Tribes category

Application Process: Online application through e-Samaj Kalyan Portal, registration, login, filling application form, uploading documents, and submitting the application
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- or the actual coaching fee, whichever is lower, to Students of the Scheduled Castes category who are preparing for examinations like IIM, NIFT, NLU, and CEPT
Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: Students should belong to Scheduled Caste Category, secured 70% or more in Class 10th and studying in Class 12th (any stream) to get admission in CEPT, NIFT, or NLU, or secured 70% or more in Class 12th and be in the third year of graduation (any stream) or have secured 70% or more marks in graduation if completed graduation, no income limit

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: 1. Obtain application form from District Differently Abled Welfare Officer, 2. Fill and attach required documents, 3. Submit application, 4. Obtain receipt with essential details.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,000/- is provided to the legal heir of the deceased differently abled person, to meet the expenses in connection with the funeral.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be the legal heir of the differently abled person. 2. The differently abled person should be deceased. 3. The differently abled person should have been a registered member of the Welfare Board for the Differently Abled.

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance to Meet the Funeral Expenses of Differently Abled Person
Target Beneficiaries: Legal heir of the deceased differently abled person

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to the legal heir in the event of the natural death of the differently-abled person.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be the legal heir of the differently abled person. 2. The differently-abled person should have died a natural death. 3. The differently abled person should have been a registered member of the 'Welfare Board for the Differently-abled'.
Tags: Death, Differently Abled, Financial Assistance
Scheme Name: Financial Assistance on the Natural Death of Differently Abled Person
Target Beneficiaries: Legal heir of the differently abled person

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form and required documents to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: This program aims to provide vital financial support to improve the well-being and standard of living for those living with the after-effects of leprosy. Financial Assistance of ₹2,000/- per month.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be leprosy affected with deformity of 40% and above. The beneficiaries should not receive any other pension benefit of Tamil Nadu.
Tags: Disability, Financial Assistance, Leprosy, Monthly Allowance, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: Maintenance Allowance for Leprosy Affected Persons
Target Beneficiaries: Leprosy affected individuals with 40% or more deformity

Application Process: Online - via CSCs. Step 01: To become a beneficiary, a construction worker who has completed 18 years of age and has not completed 60 years, has worked as a construction worker for at least 90 days during the preceding 01 year, can register himself/herself. Step 02: The eligible worker may visit the nearest Jan Seva Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents for online registration. Step 03: Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a Registration Number for future reference. Step 04: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website.
Description & Benefits: Under the scheme, an umbrella will be provided free of cost to registered building & construction workers to protect them from rain and sun. No financial assistance will be paid to the beneficiary, and the benefit will be given only once in their lifetime.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Government of Uttarakhand
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant/beneficiary should be a resident of Uttarakhand. 2. The applicant should be engaged in any building or construction work. 3. The applicant should be registered under the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board. 4. The applicant will become eligible for benefits only after three months from their registration. 5. The applicant should have an active membership of the Board. 6. The beneficiary will receive the benefit only once in their entire lifetime. 7. The applicant should not have received the same benefits from any other scheme.
Tags: Umbrella, Building Worker, Construction Worker, Labour, Uttarakhand
Scheme Name: Umbrella Assistance Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered building & construction workers

Application Process: Offline application process involving visiting the District Differently Abled Welfare Office, filling and submitting the application form with required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides modular reflective folding sticks to support visually impaired individuals in achieving self-orientation and independent mobility, empowering them to navigate their surroundings with confidence, fostering self-reliance and improving their quality of life.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a visually impaired person.
Tags: Blind, Disability, Folding Sticks, Social Welfare, Visually Impaired
Scheme Name: Modular Reflective Folding Sticks (Smartcane)
Target Beneficiaries: Visually impaired individuals

Application Process: Online application through CSCs, involving registration, submission of documents, and tracking of application status online.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides bicycles to registered building & construction workers in plain areas and sewing machines to registered workers or their dependents in mountainous/hilly areas. These benefits are granted only once in a lifetime.
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Government of Uttarakhand
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand, engaged in building or construction work, registered under UKBOCWWB, have active membership, and become eligible for assistance three months after registration.
Tags: Welfare scheme, Uttarakhand, Labour Department, Construction workers, Bicycles, Sewing machines
Scheme Name: Bicycle/Sewing Machine Assistance Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered building & construction workers in plain areas and their dependents in mountainous/hilly areas

Application Process: Apply online or in-person by approaching the Ministry of Tourism regional office, filling out an application form, attaching required documents, and paying the prescribed fee.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides supplementary and quality accommodation for foreigners and domestic tourists to stay with an Indian family to experience Indian customs and traditions. It aims to provide comfortable Home Stay Facilities of Standardized World Class Services to tourists, and to supplement the availability of accommodation in tourist destinations.
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Tourism, Andaman & Nicobar Administration, Ministry of Tourism, Govt. of India
Eligibility Criteria: The owner/promoter of the establishment, along with his/her family, is physically residing in the same establishment and letting out a minimum of one room and a maximum of six rooms (12 beds).
Tags: Accommodation, Bed, Breakfast, Homestay, Tourism
Scheme Name: Andaman & Nicobar Bed & Breakfast / Home Stay Establishment Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Foreigners and domestic tourists

Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal. The beneficiary has to apply online, upload required documents, and confirm the application within 7 days.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an interest subsidy @ 12 % interest on a bank loan amount for 5 years. It also provides good-quality organic manure for improving crop fertility & crop yields. Dung is also used as fuel for domestic purposes. The surplus fodder agricultural by-products are utilized by animals & converted into value-added products viz. Milk, Meat, etc.
Ministries/Departments: Dept. of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Gujarat State. 2. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category only. 3. The benefit of this scheme will be available to the small and poor farmers of Gujarat State. 4. The applicant will be eligible for assistance only if he/she has obtained a loan for setting up the unit in the current financial year 2023-24 through a nationalized bank or a financial institution approved by the Reserve Bank of India.
Tags: Animal Husbandry, Cattle Farming, Loan, Scheduled Tribe, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Scheme For Subsidy On Interest For Establishment Of 1 To 20 Milch Animal Farm For Scheduled Tribe
Target Beneficiaries: Small and poor farmers of the Scheduled Tribe category of Gujarat State

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a personal assistance allowance of ₹1,000/- to differently abled persons who need assistance for their activities of daily living.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a differently abled person. 2. The differently abled person wants high support needs.

Scheme Name: Scheme of Personal Assistance Allowance to Differently Abled Persons with High Support Need
Target Beneficiaries: Differently abled persons with high support needs

Application Process: Offline application process involving 4 steps: obtaining and filling the application form, attaching required documents, submitting the application, and obtaining a receipt.
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50,000/- will be given to the differently abled Law graduates for enrolment in the Bar Council as lawyer and for the purchase of law books.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a differently abled person. He/She should be a law graduate.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Law Graduate, Social Welfare, Differently-abled Person
Scheme Name: Assistance to Law Graduates
Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled Law graduates

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form to the Principal, Rashtriya Indian Military College, Dehradun
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides scholarships worth ₹20,000/- per annum to the cadets belonging to the Union Territory of Puducherry who come from economically weak backgrounds and have been selected for admission into the Rashtriya Indian Military College, Dehradun
Ministries/Departments: Directorate of School Education, Union Territory of Puducherry
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India, belong to the UT of Puducherry either by birth or domicile i.e. continuous residence of not less than 5 years, and be studying at Rashtriya Indian Military College (RIMC), Dehradun
Tags: Cadet, Education, Military, Scholarship

Target Beneficiaries: Cadets belonging to the Union Territory of Puducherry who come from economically weak backgrounds and have been selected for admission into the Rashtriya Indian Military College, Dehradun

Application Process: Online application through Antyodaya-SARAL Portal. The applicant needs to register on the portal, fill in the online application form, and submit the required documents.
Description & Benefits: A lump sum financial assistance of ₹1.50 lakh to ₹3.00 lakh is given to registered workers on the basis of the percentage of disability which occurred due to an accident at the workplace during the course of employment.
Ministries/Departments: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB). 2. The registered worker should have regular membership. 3. The registered worker who has become disabled due to an accident at the workplace during the course of employment is eligible to apply under the scheme.

Scheme Name: Disability Assistance For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers who have become disabled due to an accident at the workplace during the course of employment

Application Process: Offline application process involves visiting the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer, filling the application form, attaching required documents, and submitting it to the officer.
Description & Benefits: This initiative provides financial assistance to differently-abled students enrolled in government-recognized schools, colleges, or training centers to help with educational expenses. Scholarships are provided as: ₹4,000/- per annum for students studying from 9th to 12th Standard, ₹6,000/- per annum for Degree Courses, and ₹7,000/- per annum for Postgraduate, Medical, Engineering, Vocational, and Other Professional Courses.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary must be a student, differently abled person, studying in government-recognized schools/colleges/training centers, obtained not less than 40% of the marks in the previous qualifying examination.

Target Beneficiaries: Differently abled students

Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be registered under the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, have a regular membership for one year, and require indoor treatment for chronic diseases like cancer, tuberculosis (TB), AIDS, etc.

Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Government of Haryana

Application Process: Offline application process involving visiting the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer, filling and submitting the application form along with required documents.
Description & Benefits: This initiative provides financial assistance to differently-abled students enrolled in government-recognized schools to help them purchase notebooks. The scholarship amount is ₹1,000/- per annum for students studying from 1st to 5th standard and ₹3,000/- per annum for students studying from 6th to 8th standard.

Scheme Name: Scholarship (I to VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons
Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled students studying in government-recognized schools

Application Process: Offline application through submission of application form to the Block Development Officer or the Executive Officer of the concerned Panchayat Samity, Sub-Divisional Officer, or the Controller of Vagrancy, West Bengal, along with required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month through DBT mode to the beneficiaries.
Ministries/Departments: Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department
Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary must be a widow girl/woman, aged 60 years or more, a citizen of India and a resident of West Bengal, with a family income not exceeding ₹1,000/- per month, and not maintained by any of her relatives.
Tags: Pension, Social Welfare, Financial Assistance, Widow, West Bengal
Scheme Name: Widow Pension-West Bengal
Target Beneficiaries: Widows facing economic hardship within the state of West Bengal

Application Process: Online application through the Shilpasathi Portal
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a reimbursement of stamp duty and registration fee paid by the enterprise for the purpose of registration of documents within the State.
Ministries/Departments: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles, Government of West Bengal
Eligibility Criteria: The business/organization should be a Micro/ Small/ Medium Enterprise, should belong to the manufacturing sector, should have started production on or after 1st April 2019, and should be in the private sector/ cooperative sector/ joint sector undertaking or should be a company/ undertaking owned and managed by the State Government or the Industrial SHGs.
Tags: Entrepreneurship, Financial Assistance, Incentives, MSME, Registration Fee, Reimbursement, Stamp Duty, Subsidy
Scheme Name: Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises: Subsidy on Stamp Duty and Registration Fee (SDRFS)

Application Process: Online application through the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana
Description & Benefits: Financial assistance for full tuition fees, hostel fees, books, stationery and laptop/computer for higher education
Ministries/Departments: Labour Department, Government of Haryana
Eligibility Criteria: Applicants must be engaged in building or construction work, registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and have at least one year's regular membership. The child must have scored 85% in senior secondary (10+2) or 75% or more in Bachelor's degree course and must be continuing studies as a regular student in the next class or course.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Labour, Student, Education, Haryana
Scheme Name: Mukhya Mantri Shramyogi Prathibhavan Vidyarthi Yojana (HBOCWWB)

Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form with mandatory documents to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer/Head Master of the Government special school for the differently abled concerned.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide free special education, vocational training, boarding and lodging to the visually impaired, hearing impaired, intellectual disability and locomotor differently-abled persons. Every year four sets of uniforms and textbooks are given free of cost.
Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu
Eligibility Criteria: The child should be a visually impaired, hearing impaired, intellectual disability, and locomotor differently abled person. A child's age should be 5 years and above.
Tags: Special Education, Differently Abled, Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Intellectual Disability, Locomotor Disability, Vocational Training, Boarding, Lodging, Uniforms, Textbooks

Target Beneficiaries: Visually impaired, hearing impaired, intellectually disabled, and locomotor differently abled persons

Application Process: Online application through Matirkatha/FMS portal. After successful submission of online application, hard copies of print out of the application with acknowledgement receipt, recent passport size photograph and other prescribed documents (self-attest, if required) will have to be submitted to the office of the Assistant Director of Agriculture of the concerned Block within the stipulated period.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to aid the farmers in procuring manually operated small farm implements necessary for agricultural operations. Financial support will be provided mostly for manually operated tools like sprayer, manually operated paddy thresher, cono weeder, weeder, drum-seeder, solar light trap, chaff cutter, seed bin, seed tray, seeder etc. and battery operated sprayers and PVC pipes for carrying water etc. under OTA-SFI.
Ministries/Departments: Agriculture Department, Government of West Bengal
Eligibility Criteria: Individual farmers registered under Krishak Bandhu (New) Scheme or Groups like SKUS/PACS/FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG duly graded /LAMPS etc approved/recognized by any Govt Institution/Departments. The age of the beneficiary should be minimum 18 years at the time of application.
Tags: Agriculture, Farmers, Financial Assistance, Small Farm Implements
Scheme Name: One Time Assistance to Small and Marginal Farmers for Purchase of Small Farm Implements (OTA-SFI)
Target Beneficiaries: Small and Marginal Farmers

Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide a retrofitted petrol scooter to orthopedically differently-abled persons whose legs are affected. The scheme provides free distribution of retrofitted petrol scooters.

The refund amount varies based on the zone, with Zone B & C getting 30% of Net SGST paid and Zone D & E getting 50% of Net SGST paid.

Scheme Name: Kashyapa Scheme for Food & Shelter
Target Beneficiaries: Underprivileged Brahmins in Andhra Pradesh, including orphan children, differently-abled individuals, widows, destitute women separated from their husbands, and elderly Brahmins

Application Process: Online application through the official website. Applicants need to register, fill out the required details, upload documents, and submit the application.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides annual financial assistance to selected applicants. The financial assistance varies from ₹12,000 to ₹36,000 depending on the course and age of the student.
Ministries/Departments: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation
Eligibility Criteria: The student and his parents should belong to the Brahmin community, reside in Andhra Pradesh, and be between 8 to 19 years old. The student should be pursuing a full-time vedic course in a registered Veda Pathasala.
Tags: Vedic Education, Brahmin Community, Financial Assistance, Andhra Pradesh
Scheme Name: Veda Vyasa Scheme for Vedic Education
Target Beneficiaries: Brahmin Community students pursuing Vedic Education

Application Process: Online application through the Corporation’s portal by providing the necessary information.
Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to the topper of the school/ College/ Institute for the course. The amount of assistance is ₹7,500/- for SSC, ₹10,000/- for Intermediate or equivalent, ₹15,000/- for Graduation, and ₹20,000/- for Professional Education Course.
Ministries/Departments: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation, a Government of Andhra Pradesh undertaking
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The student and his/her parents should belong to the Brahmin community. 2. The parents of the student should reside in Andhra Pradesh. 3. The student must be a regular (Full Time) student of the course for the academic year 2018-19. 4. The student should be the topper of the entire course (at the end of SSC/ Intermediate or equivalent /Graduation /Professional Edn. Course) in the School/ College/ Institute for the academic year 2018-19. 5. The toppers of SSC/ Intermediate or equivalent and Graduation should have completed the course in Andhra Pradesh. However, toppers of Professional Education Course may have completed the course from anywhere in India but the parents should be residing in Andhra Pradesh. 6. The student should not have availed himself/herself of any amount under any other government scheme for the same purpose.
Tags: Education, Financial Assistance, SSC, Student, Brahmin, Andhra Pradesh
Scheme Name: Gayathri Scheme for Academic Excellence
Target Beneficiaries: Students of Andhra Pradesh, Brahmin community

Application Process: Offline application through Duare Sarkar Camps. The application form will be available free of cost at the Duare Sarkar Camps. The applicant will submit the filled-in, duly signed application form at one of the Duare Sarkar Camps, along with the self-attested copies of the required documents.
Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to empower women and make them financially independent by providing them with a one-time grant to buy essential goods and services. The grant amount is ₹ 1,200/- per month to women SC/ST households and ₹ 1,000/- per month to other beneficiaries.
Ministries/Departments: West Bengal Government, Social Welfare
Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of West Bengal. 2. The applicant should be a woman. 3. The age of the applicant should be between 25 - 60 years. 4. The household of the applicant should be enrolled under the 'Swasthyasathi' scheme. 5. The applicant should not be a government employee in permanent employment/ retired government employee of Central/ State Government, Statutory Bodies, Government Undertakings, Panchayats, Municipal Corporations/ Municipalities, Local Bodies, teaching and non-teaching employees of Government aided Educational Institutions, etc. receiving regular salary/ pension.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Women Empowerment, Social Welfare
Scheme Name: Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme
Target Beneficiaries: Women from economically weaker sections of society
